reviewText: pros: The staff at this hotel are friendly helpful and genuinely thoughtful going above and beyond! The room was pristine large and had very thoughtful details throughout during the stay (including some delicious local treats). Fab breakfast with a great variety of sweet/savoury baked goods eggs hot/cold meats fresh seasonal fruit and natural yoghurt. Location is perfect for a short or long stay. I stayed here upon recommendation from my parents & friends who have stayed here over the years and my stay (altho short due to being delayed arriving) exceeded expectations. This was my first time in Portugal and I am really looking forward to returning! cons: Nothing!
pros: Location staff and the upgrade was a pleasant surprise cons: Nothing
pros: The location was really good it was near to everything cons: We could feel the vibration of the metro each time it passed and the bathroom can get very cold the floor was freezing
pros: Attention to detail! Staff makes you feel like a guest! cons:

pros: Very friendly staff excellent location comfortable beds and very good breakfast. I will definitely stay here again when I am in Lisbon. cons: Kept knocking on my door with chocolates wine etc. I just came off a 14 hour flight and was not interested in the disruptions.
pros: Great location amazing staff and service cons: Nothing
pros: The hotel is beautiful and well decorated. The location is extremely central and the star are exceptional!!! cons:
pros: Everything. Although the surroundings do not look very safe the location is excellent the hotel is beautiful very clean friendly personnel. cons: I did like everything.

pros: Well located near major attractions shopping and Metro stations. Yet tucked away from the crowd. The hotel gave us little treats (egg tarts wine welcome drinks petit fours) for the New Year festivities. The room we had was so comfy. cons: Nothing not to like about.

pros: The staff are wonderful and go out of their way to make sure guests are happy. My son came down with a stomach virus and hotel staff were so kind and helpful with preparing special food for him finding us a Dr who did housecalls and even scouring pharmacies to find us the medicine the Dr had prescribed. The breakfast was amazing and included smoked salmon and mimosas every day!  Also eggs bread cheese charcuterie fresh fruit/veggiesetc.  Can't understand why anyone would complain about this.  Hotel is central to almost everything and walkable.  Room was decent size and clean. cons: The bathroom had a slight sewage smell even though hotel tried to fix it. This is common in Lisbon especially in older buildings in the Baixa and wouldn't stop me from booking here again.  Hotel is located near the Mouraria neighborhood which can be dodgy at night but again no biggie for me.  I felt the subway but only barely  - didn't prevent me from sleeping like a baby during my stay.  Bring earplugs if you're sensitive to noise.  The amazing staff and comfy beds make up for these small issues
pros: Wonderful friendly staff. Super location and beautiful hotel. So helpful for information and guiding you to your tourist destination. cons: No complaints üëå
pros: Excellent location. Staff went above and beyond. Really great touches throughout our stay. cons: The pillows were not so comfortable but that‚Äôs a personal preference.

pros: Hotel central location in easy walking distance of many of Lisbon's attractions bus and tram stops and eateries. The staff were absolutely exceptionally courteous and helpful. Amongst the best we've experienced. cons: Maybe the breakfast coffee could have been stronger but we're nit-picking.
pros: Breakfast cons: No gym

pros: The hotel was at the perfect location for our needs.  Our room was clean and large.  The restroom and shower in the room was my favorite from my whole trip.  It was spacious and also clean.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious with fresh juices. We had a wonderful stay. cons:

pros: Very clean friendly staff good buffet breakfast. Location is excellent. cons: Couple of small things in the room could do with some attention but minor and wouldn‚Äôt stop me going back to the same hotel or room.
pros: Hotel Decoration and room inner service. cons: Room 306 the shower headrail is not easy to use.
pros: Excellent foods and very friendly staff especially the lead lady. Your treats going to the room at night are very unique and appreciative. Also enjoyed the wine tasting. cons: Nothing
pros: convenient location clean cons: very small breakfast room

pros: Very nice and clean hotel. Excellent service! Already fresh and delicious breakfast. The hotel location is great. The hotel send me the compliment the bottle of champagne for my birthday. 
If we ever come back to Lisboa we definitely stay at this hotel again. cons:

pros: It is a lovely hotel very centrally located near Rossio metro. The staff are so friendly and professional. We loved the treats that they provided us with during our stay. The bedding is superb and the bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is a good size with an excellent shower.The breakfast is of high quality and the hotel is very good value all things considered. cons: The standard double room is quite small really.. It has a huge bed but there little room at the foot of the bed. It is probably all to do with the construction of the hotel.
pros: Staff was very kind and helpful cons:
pros: All cons:
pros: Everything cons: Nothing
pros: Great location being in the centre of the City. Staff were lovely. cons: Breakfast choice could have been greater but adequate nonetheless.

pros: Staff are friendly and service orientated. Small and cosy at the reception area. Rooms size are satisfactorily big. cons: The plug points in the room. All at the lower level which is so inconvenient when come to charging your phone
pros: Staff very good/welcoming. Location was excellent very central. cons: Bathroom was a bit weird set up for a disabled person.
pros: An amazing hotel great location great staff great touches. cons:
pros: Everything was superb from the welcome wine tasting from the manager Joao to the reception staff restaurant staff bar staff doorman and the cleaners. cons: Nothing
pros: Fantastic staff hotel and location cons: Had to come home

pros: Fantastic location close to a lot of attractions and transport links. The staff went above and beyond to make the trip enjoyable. Nothing was too much trouble. As a group we couldn't praise them enough. 
The welcome drink and cake was a nice touch.
The rooms were larger than the average hotel room and the turn down service and chocolate were a bonus.
Overall it was a great experience and a hotel that we would all recommend cons:
pros: Clean convenient to everything. cons: We had a room facing the alleyway where bikers and pedestrians go. It was a bit noisy.
pros: Staff very friendly and helpful cons:

pros: Clean comfortable convenient. Dessert treats on our first & last days of our stay was a very nice touch. üëç cons: 1. No personal amenities e.g. toothbrush provided
2. No information about a metro strike taking place during our stay 
3. Bought a travel card at 10euros. Think it costs 6.80 + 0.50 euros from metro station. Ok to sell it at 10 euros for convenience of travelers but being informed would be great.
pros: Well appointed modern hotel.  Staff were friendly and went out of their way to assist. Close to old town perfect location room and staff cons: Nothing
pros: Location and Staff cons: Nothing
pros: The room was excellent! Very comfortable and clean! The staff was very friendly and kind. The location was also very convenient because its in the city centre. cons:

pros: Excellent location in the heart of Lisbon. Reasonably priced hotel friendly helpful and efficient staff. Surrounded by cafes and restaurants. Highly recommend. cons: We had no dislikes at this hotel.

pros: Excellent location first the prople without car
Room and bathroom have been refurbished and are OK.
breakfast is good cons:

pros: Excellent accommodation and position. Staff very friendly in particular Celia Ferreira in the dining room who went out of her way to accommodate my dietary restrictions. Highly recommended. cons:

pros: This Hotel I recommend to all my family relatives and friend when they will visit Lisbon. My wife and I will sure visit Lisbon again and only will go to this Hotel. You are right in the middle of Lisbon just perfect. Close to good restaurant shopping Bus Tours etc. Enjoy when you go. cons: Nothing
pros: Location and the efficiency friendly staff. The hotel manager was very gracious and generous of his time. cons:
pros: Great location very friendly staff !!! cons: Breakfast  not many choices

pros: It was very cute with a chicness and the rooms had a modern touch. The rooms were extremely clean too! cons: Would have been nice if the registration desk could recommend elegant restaurants in Lisbon and make the reservations for the guests.

pros: Beautiful and well-kept hotel. Service at the highest level. Room great. Probably even better than we booked. Gifts from the hotel and birthday champagne for my husband were a great surprise. I will recommend this hotel to everyone and we will come back but this time with our daughter. I have been to 7 countries recently and most hotels should learn from you. Thank you. cons: x
pros: Staff made you feel as if you were staying in their home. cons: Nothing
pros: Both excellent cons: All was fantastic

pros: The location was very central and with easy access to transport. The room was very comfortable with all the facilities we needed. Housekeeping was exceptional. The breakfast was well worth getting up for with a good range of cold and cooked food served well by the attentive staff. The hotel staff were excellent always happy to see us very courteous and professional nothing was too much trouble. cons: I don't think there was anything we did not like. This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in.

pros: Everything was perfect. I was really surprised with the service. Stuff was mega helpful. Rooms are modern clean and very comfortable. Location - at the city centre. Highly recommend this hotel. cons:
pros: Immaculate in every way stayed in Premier room superb. Location perfect for the old town. Staff excellent. cons: Perhaps more hot items for breakfast.
pros: The employees were great and so helpful.  They spoke excellent English and spent time explaining the area and providing information. cons:
pros: Staff are friendly and the hotel is stylish and clean. cons:
pros: Very pleasant staff great location. Good bathrooms. cons: Badly situated and too few power points for charging phones etc.
pros: Staff very friendly cons:
pros: attention to detail from the staff kindless cons: moquette in the rooms
pros: Location cons: Sound and vibration of metro when train is passing.
pros: Friendly staff. Clean accommodations. Great breakfast. Great location. cons: Nothing.

pros: Very centrally located within easy walking distance of main areas of Lisbon 
Room was spotless and beds ultra comfortable 
But the stand out positive was the staff !
They could not have been more helpful and friendly to my wife and myself on our couple weekend in Lisbon and went out of their way to make our stay extra special !
We will definitely be back. cons:
pros: The breakfast was excellent and they brought port and desert up to the room which was very nice. cons:

pros: Exceptional hotel should be 6 star

The location was great for walking to many attractions. The quality of the hotel and the room was excellent and the staff were the most friendly and helpful that we have ever experienced cons: Can't think of anything that wasn't perfect

pros: Perfect location. Within walking distance of the metro tourist attractions and restaurants. Staff were welcoming friendly and professional. Our room was upgraded and was fabulous! Good size great shower clean and comfortable. Breakfast was simple but delicious. Would definitely stay here again. cons: N/A

pros: Super friendly great location.  Included welcome drinks pastel de nata and chocolate for the evening.   Similar to something we had on the cruise.   Breakfast included for our stay.  Breakfast buffet was great too.   They have an umbrella in the room for guest to use too.    A personal welcome message on the tv screen too. cons: Can't find any.  Just one tip no car can go into the street.  If you take a taxi Bolt or Uber you will walk for a minute or 2.  Depends on where the drop off is.

pros: We had a deluxe room which was a good size well appointed and very clean. Spacious bathroom with Rituals toiletries. Hotel is in a great central location close to many of Lisbon's main attractions.  Good breakfast selection and very tasty too.  All staff so lovely helpful and friendly. cons:

pros: The food was very tasty. The minor problem was the number of seats. With a fully booked hotel it was necessary to wait for a free place. Sometimes there were missing glasses but the staff was nice and made an effort to deal with the problems. cons:
pros: Location cons: Very small room. Notes and coffee making facilities

pros: Very clean  well appointed room
Good breakfast
Very helpful staff cons: Room was well appointed but quite small and lacked storage 
You can hear the faint rumble of the metro early in the morning but that‚Äôs not really their fault or indeed should it be a deal breaker

pros: I stayed here with my son and our experience was truly exceptional. The rooms were comfortable and the ambiance made us feel instantly relaxed. However it was the staff that really made our stay unforgettable especially Diogo. His warmth and genuine care shone through and he took a special interest in my son's journey offering words of encouragement before his competition and celebrating with us after his success. Diogo's support truly added a personal touch that meant a lot to both of us. We look forward to coming back! cons: The breakfast selection could use a bit more variety to enhance the morning experience
pros: The room was very comfortable. The breakfast was fabulous and the hotel provided amenities and services that made the stay very special. cons:
pros: Location was perfect üëç cons: Nothing really however only served the beautiful Portuguese tarts once as a sweet option for breakfast and we were there for three nights.
pros: A lovely hotel and our room was perfect.  Spacious and bright.  The staff were very helpful and solicitous.  Nice quiet street as well.  The breakfast was delicious with lots of variety. cons:

pros: It was an incredible experience! The hotel has a perfect location ‚Äì just a few minutes away from Lisbon's main attractions yet it‚Äôs very cozy and peaceful. The room was elegantly decorated modern very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable.

The staff were friendly and always ready to help with any questions. The breakfasts which were included were delicious and varied. The hotel‚Äôs complimentary treats were something special: local drinks fresh desserts and incredibly tasty sweets.

Overall this is the perfect place for those seeking comfort and excellent service during their trip to Lisbon. I will definitely return and highly recommend this hotel to everyone! cons:

pros: Amazing hotel very helpful staff clean and very spacious room perfect location close to major attractions and lots of restaurants
the breakfast was very tasty
we stayed at the hotel 7 nights cons: nothing
pros: We loved the customer service the location the comfortable beds cons: Nothing. Everything was wonderful
pros: The location really is great cons: Check in time is late

pros: The hotel was lovely and the rooms very comfortable. Lots of added extras made this hotel a lovely place to stay  The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was delicious. cons: I can't think of anything that was missing.
pros: Loved this hotel. Great location. Beautiful room. Lovely breakfast. Staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Lovely little treats. Really enjoyed our stay. cons: Nothing not to like!
pros: Very clean and comfortable.. staff very helpful! Rooms beautiful! cons:
pros: Lots of choices for breakfast cons: We were put in a room which was noisy due to the train.

pros: We loved everything - the accommodations the staff the breakfast. Staff were friendly and helpful. The manager Jo√£o went above and beyond. Breakfast was delicious. We will definitely visit again. cons:
pros: Beautiful property with a beautiful staff!  Great location and we loved the roof top bar around the corner at the sister property. cons: N/A
pros: Lovely room. Very Clean. Ample breakfast. Very central. cons: Lights in room complicated.

pros: We like mostly the room.
The breakfast area was relatively small. cons: There was no sitting room with couches for coffee drinks and sweets.

pros: Was pleasantly surprised with the room as we received a bath with the skylight and the location of the hotel was absolutely perfect for our purpose. cons: Breakfast was a disdappointment compared to the standard the hotel set with the location friendliness and location.  The spread was not up to standard with the hotel's expectations

pros: The rooms are absolutely Elegant and beautiful: double height ceilings Separate shower and bathtub double sinks toilet and bidet. The location was very central. We could walk to everything. We left our car in their parking facility at a neighboring hotel. cons: Nothing!

pros: The hotel is centrally located next to Rossio Square. The room was exceptional with great amenities that included an abundance of soft towels great toiletries and an excellent bathroom with an oversized shower and a bidet. The sheets were high end and the bed super comfortable with a turn down service topped with a chocolate treat. The staff were super friendly and most helpful including those who served the lovely breakfast. Overall this is a wonderful place to stay. cons: During this visit which was the second over the two weeks we were in Portugal there was nothing I was unhappy with.
pros: Spacious well appointed room cons: The shower wasn't powerful enough

pros: Breakfast is OK good enough to start the day 
Big rooms and  bathrooms. 
Very comfortable beds and great pillows. 
Everything was cleaned very well daily.
Highly recommend cons:

pros: The Portugal Boutique Hotel is one of my favorite hotels. The staff were friendly and accommodating and went out of the way to make us feel welcome. Each night we had a tray of treats waiting for us.  One night they provided a small bottle of Ginjinha the most iconic drink of Lisbon dating back to the 13th century. On our last evening we had a lovely personalized note thanking us for our stay. The room was spacious and quiet - the wonderful shutters helped to keep it quiet and dark (we actually overslept the first morning it was so comfortable). The bathroom was outstanding with both a shower and a bathtub. Breakfast was superb with many choices (and oh that fabulous orange juice) which you could enjoy either inside or outside on their terrace (which we did). I could not have asked for a better location. It was within walking distance of all that we wanted to see. If we ever find ourselves in Lisbon again we will absolutely stay here again Thank you for a wonderful few days and nights! cons: The only thing that could have been better is that we had been able to stay an additional night or two! I can't think of a single thing that needed improvement! Wonderful hotel.
pros: Clean bright fabulous location super helpful staff. Loved everything cons: Nothing
pros: Great location very friendly staff comfortable room cons: Nothing worth mentioning

pros: The breakfast was great and the service provided by all the staff was excellent. The amenities linens and quality of the towels was first class. The support and attention to all requests was exceptional. cons: Not really anything to complain about.

pros: AMAZING staff who warmly greeted us and were available to assist in any way. Our room was luxurious and we were treated with sweet & savory treats each day. Wonderful breakfast and close to transportation and sights. cons:

pros: For my wife and I the best experience was Hotel during our visit and most definitely one of the best hotels we have stayed in. All staff members were excellent but 3 stood out to us the most:

Carlos works as a manager for the breakfast service and was incredible. He would always greet us well and go the extra mile to make sure we were well looked after. He made us feel like family and each time we saw him it was a delight to interact and learn about the Portuguese culture. 

In addition we were doing a trip to Sintra where we saw one of the breakfast team staff members on the train (I wish we had taken his name for this review). They could have easily ignored us but it was clear the level of respect they had for themselves and their job that they smiled and greeted us on the train when they didn't have to. 

Jo√£o the Hotel Manager was great too. The hotel offer a view of their wine cellar and you can try their hotel made wines too. We was under the impression that the experience would be around 30-45 mins long but my wife and I had such a great experience with Jo√£o and with his teachings of Portuguese wines and culture that we was there for over 2 hours. It was a great experience and with creating this great relationship with Jo√£o Jo√£o and the team would always go the extra mile to come talk and just share great learnings with us. 

We appreciate that for some people a Hotel may just be a place of sleep but in honesty the experience here was more than that for us. Everyone was truly great and just being able to interact with the staff on a more personal level you do really get to experience more than just place to sleep. 

Great Hotel great team and great experience (also in a great location too). cons:

pros: The hotel was a real find in Lisbon. The rooms were spacious beautifully appointed and very comfortable.
The breakfast spread was simple but delicious and plentiful and the staff very accommodating.
The hotel's location was excellent and as out room faced the interior courtyard was very quiet.
Access to the sister hotel's rooftop bar was a bonus as it has excellent views of Lisbon and the amazing sunsets.
The best thing about the hotel was the staff. The hotel manager made our group feel very special by inviting us to a private wine tasting. The reception staff were very knowledgeable about the city. One example staff of going above and beyond was when we advised them of our very early departure they had breakfast packs ready for our party of eight and also switched on the coffee machine early to offer us coffees before we left. cons:

pros: Great location to see many Lisbon sites by foot or take a trolley  bus underground train. Very good buffet breakfast. The hotel is modern and staff are wonderful. Beds are comfy. cons: Noisy - downside is that you can hear the underground rumble noise of the transit train all night long .  Sleep was an issue for us due to city noise and the train.

pros: Very centrally located - Martim Moniz for Tram 28E Praca  da Figueira - for tram 15E to Belem Rossio - for day trip coaches - all within 5 minutes walk. 
Staff were excellent - very patient and articulate. Special mention for Alexandra Joao Anonessa Mariana and the Brazilian guy in the ground floor Bar - they always seemed to go the extra mile to make you comfortable.
There is a welcome drink on arrival a Ginjinha drink on the first evening and another Port drink on the last evening before departure - all complimentary! Breakfast was good. Taxi from the airport took ‚Ç¨20 - and the driver insisted on cash - so you may want to keep some cash with you or else there‚Äôs also a cash machine nearby. 
Went to the rooftop bar on the last evening- it had good vibes and a very good view of the Castle specially during dusk and when the lights came on. cons: No negative feedback that I can think of.
pros: Nice room  friendly staff. Good breakfast cons:
pros: Location beautiful hotel and rooms exceptional staff great breakfast fantastic stay! Will recommend to family and friends! cons:

pros: Everything. The hotel was beautiful rooms were spacious the bedding was luxurious. Lots of nice little touches in the room. I really cannot find any fault with it. cons: Nothing. It was fantastic

pros: Lovely location right in the main square.  The breakfast was included and it was lovely very attentive staff  and Jual who is  wonderful so personable and extremely helpful 
We had an amazing tour of the wine cellar if you are offered to visit by Jual don't miss it  Jual is entertaining and very knowledgeable also we tried some of the hotel wine.
As for the room the T.V. in the mirror wow...wow! if you can see the pictures of the hotel that is what you are going to get if not better. This hotel exceeded all of my expectations. cons: That I only stayed 4 nights I would gladly stay longer at this amazing  hotel
pros: The hotel was very comfortable staff were helpful and the location was perfect. cons: Nothing! It was perfect!
pros: Everything the rooms the staff was very kind breakfast cons: Everything was perfect
pros: Everything üòä cons:

pros: Hospitality was exceptional!! Breakfast is worth every penny!!  This hotel is very very clean. cons: The only bad thing I can say about this place was the lack of iron and ironing board. We asked for it in the next day was taken back. We asked for it back and they took it again for another customer..

pros: Fantastic staffwe had to leave at 6 am to catch a plane and the even made us breakfast before then cons: Unfortunately we only arrived at 6pm and had to leave at 6 am not enough time to enjoy this wonderful hotel and Lisbon

pros: The place is amazing   beautiful and very comfortable the staff is so dedicated as if you were the only guest..( the hotel was fully booked) best location I would recommend it for any stay in Lisbon. cons:
pros: Everything is perfect cons:

pros: Great location.  Very friendly staff. Spacious room. cons: Thin walls. 

Limited choices for beakfast and room service.
pros: Good location in old town. Nice large room and bathroom. Nice touch with the turn down service and little gifts. Nice breakfast selection. cons:

pros: We booked 6 nights and the experience was perfect.
It starts with a smiling and pleasant welcome. The location is ideal literally walking distance to most sites and the metro.
The breakfast is very good from the champagne to the fruits.
The room is spacious with a wardrobe and drawers
The hotel is intimate and you feel a personal relationship with all the staff members. The hotel manager introduced himself and sent us invitations for wine tasting and more...
All our requests were answered positively and immediately.
We received the local liqueur a bottle of wine chocolates and a bottle of water in the room every day.
This is a real boutique hotel we do not doubt that we will return cons: For us a walk-in shower is better than a bath
pros: Excellent location and incredible staff. Loved everything about the stay. cons: Breakfast variety can be a little better

pros: Great facility and good size rooms cons: A steam Iron and a board would be nice to have in the room . I‚Äôm certain you‚Äôd given it to me if asked  but having at the room is more that I‚Äôm accustomed to at the hotels of this level

pros: Very beautiful place to rest and enjoy the center of the city. The best was the customer service. Thanks to everyone for the hospitality specially to the manager Joao. Very comfortable bed !! cons:
pros: Great location  great staff giving 5 star service everyday. cons: No issues could not have been better
pros: Breakfast was very good. Staff are wonderful. Extremely helpful. Complimentary treats daily in your room was a very nice touch. cons:
pros: location was just perfect. Room was very spacious. cons: I wish there was a gym.
pros: Excellent cons: Nothing
pros: Huge room with wonderful service and delicious breakfast. Very clean and the location couldn't be better. cons:
pros: Beautiful hotel in a prime location. Comfortable room and breakfast was amazing cons:
pros: Staff were really welcoming and very helpful cons: View from my room was at the back of the hotel onto another hotel

pros: Perfect central location in the city for getting to all the sites and public transit. This was a four star hotel that acts like a 5 star experience. All of the staff were eager to help with what ever you need 0r wanted cons: The hotel is located in a pedestrian ally. Therefor you could not get taxi / Uber in front of the hotel and had a short walk to meet them. Not a big issue.
pros: Location staff and cleanliness cons: N/A

pros: Excellent location in the city center. We could get anywhere on foot and come to rest in the middle of the day. Spacious room. Very good breakfast. Friendly staff and happy to help. Highly recommend cons:
pros: Very comfortable rooms in a good location cons:

pros: The rooms and bad are really comfortable modern good interior very clean.
The location of the hotel is really good the breakfast was delicious and the stuff is very helpful and nice. cons: First we landed in a room in which you could hear and feel the subway passing under the hotel. This is not a problem if you have a deep sleep but for us light sleepers it made it difficult to sleep. 

Luckily the hotel stuff helped us moved to a quieter room they were very accomodating and extremely nice.

pros: Excellent location 2 mins walk from Rossio metro and just below the castle. We walked everywhere from the hotel. Gorgeous room and spacious stunning bathroom ü§© 
Crisp and meticulously clean room. Gorgeous treats from hotel delivered to room every evening (bottle of port natas petit fours..). cons: Nothing at all!

pros: The staff particularly Andressa Marienna and Aerlindo were very helpful assisting us with our requirements.  They provided us with information about the city helped us with transport and ensured that we enjoyed our stay.  The room was clean and had all the amenities of a 5-star hotel.  Breakfast was excellent.  We would definitely recommend this hotel. cons: The hotel entrance is not accessible by car but is only about 2 to 3 minute-walk from the nearest taxi drop-off station.  Not a big problem but good to know if you're carrying several large pieces of luggage like we did.
pros: Everything just to our liking cons:

pros: From the moment we walked into reception it was apparent the hotel was immaculately kept very clean and a very nice ambience. cons: If I am being picky it would be for some additional breakfast options although what was available was very good quality
pros: The room was great The breakfast was very nice. Great location. The staff was very friendly and helpful cons: Nothing
pros: The location and the bath products and the breakfast cons: The luggage store was not very secure
pros: The hotel was in a great location and good value for money. cons: The hotel does not have lots of facilities but we knew that and it is by its name a Boutique hotel.

pros: Hotel was very customer-oriented.  Rooms are beautiful and the bed was the most comfortable I‚Äôve ever slept in - super luxurious!  I love that they provided champagne for our anniversary and also complimentary gingjia and port wine different days in your room.  Breakfast buffet was worth it if not included; lots of options and extended time period compared to other hotels.   Location was close to all the main plazas. cons: Nothing

pros: late check in was handled well. Room was a good size with everything you could need. Location is superb for central Lisbon.
Every night a special treat was left in our room free of charge which was a nice touch.Staff were really helpful and very friendly happy to chat and give good advice. cons: unfortunately when we arrived there was a problem with the floor in the lobby so we couldnt use the dining room or bar in our hotel and had to use those in the sister hotel around the corner. The wine cellar was not open at all during our stay  which was one of the reasons we booked this hotel. That was disappointing.
pros: The hotel staff went overboard in service. Brought up trees and port wine every day. Had a nice welcome gift too. Turn down service was a nice touch with chocolates. cons: Nothing
pros: Cleanliness comfort consistency of service and location! cons: Can‚Äôt think of a thing!

pros: Perfect location many sitesshops & restaurants in walking distance. Hotel was very clean and modern. Great breakfast. Staff were friendly polite and very helpful. cons: Rooms with the king bed were a bit tight but the bathroom was big and spacious.

pros: Breakfast very good and nice choices.
Entire hotel staff was very helpful and friendly.  As two females traveling in unfamiliar surroundings we felt very comfortable. cons: A little bit of a discount on our room cost as we stayed five nights.  Otherwise everything was great!  Would love to come back.

pros: Fantastic location in the middle of the city centre. Staff were always very polite welcoming and helpful with recommendations and directions. 
Spacious room with a large bathroom and wardrobe space.  Large comfortable bed. 
Highly recommend and we would love to stay here again if we returned to Lisbon. cons: Nothing
pros: Excellent location. Very friendly and helpful staff. cons: Nothing.
pros: It was clean friendly people cons:

pros: The young and delightful staff were eager to please. The manager Jo√£o went out of his way to make sure our stay was perfect. Our room was well appointed and very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent. A lovely small hotel experience. cons: While the location was central to the castle and Alfama it was a bit further from the more trendy areas.
pros: Great location very friendly staff clean cons:

pros: What a lovely hotel with great service and wonderful breakfast.  We liked the location very much and were able to catch a taxi easily to Lisbon sights. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was quite large and comfortable. cons: We liked everything!
pros: Exceptional staff with lovely rooms. Good location to attractions. cons:
pros: Beautiful room. Helpful staff nice breakfast. cons: Area around hotel a little sketchy.

pros: A new hotel in an excellent location. Staff could not be more helpful. cons: The room had a very modern look but downside was the relatively small size of the room. Would have been nice to have coffee/tea making capability in room.
pros: Location.  Size of the room.   Lots of space.  Very nice bedding.   Turn down service.  Breakfast. cons: Nothing.

pros: Gorgeous 
Exceptional Staff
Convenient location
Perfect cons:
pros: Great location and staff super friendly. Roof top access is the best perk! cons: Shower blinds could be better so you can‚Äôt see directly into the bedroom!
pros: It‚Äôs a beautiful property and the staff is so welcoming and helpful cons: Nothing everything was great

pros: The service was brilliant so friendly and attentive. The breakfast in the mornings is perfect and the room was really high standard and lovely touches like a welcome and leaving gift! Location is great and would definitely recommend this hotel! cons:

One comment I can make is the observation that the breakfast area is very small (some people had to wait to be seated) and is not a buffet style one had to order items separately and the options were basic not much variety when compared to other hotels in a similar category. This is not something the actually detracted from our experience.

Breakfast room is a bit small but far nicer than the average breakfast buffet room you usually see in hotels. cons: TV was a bit weird (behind the mirror) also small by today's standards for such a large room. But I did love the array of media inputs for the TV to support devices. I marked the facilities down one step as the carpets need replacing. Still many steps above some other hotels though.

pros: Location absolutely brilliant on a quiet side street but 2 minutes walk to the square with all transport links. 
Large supermarket on the same block too. 
Breakfast was very good good choice & staff extremely helpful. Everything is served to your table. Breakfast very busy at peak time but no different to other hotels at peak time.
Reception staff extremely helpful too & they remembered my special request made at booking months before so they‚Äôd obviously checked our booking. 
Very clean & comfortable & with a lovely boutique vibe inside. Wooden interior shutters help to block out the light & add to soundproofing from the double glazing. 
Liked the TV incorporated into the giant mirror in the room. 
The staff delivered a welcome gift & a leaving gift to our room. Lovely local food & drinks. Such a nice touch! cons: Difficult to think as everything was so good!
We would have liked a kettle for hot drinks in our room but think this must only be available in more expensive rooms or suites. 
I also requested sensitive skin bedding/towels due to allergies but the hotel laundry didn‚Äôt appear to have any suitable detergents. The staff did remember though & told me at check in that they had requested non fragranced detergents. 
Some hotels now use all anti allergy detergents due to the increasing number of people with similar allergies.

pros: The Portugal Boutique Hotel is a stylish and centrally located hotel in Lisbon. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated and the bathrooms are huge. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and the breakfast is excellent (and not a buffet!). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Lisbon

The hotel is located in the heart of Lisbon just a short walk from Rossio Square the S√£o Jorge Castle and the Tagus River.
 The rooms are all individually decorated and spacious with some even having balconies with city views. The bathrooms are also very spacious and come with bathtubs and showers.
The staff at the Portugal Boutique Hotel are some of the friendliest and most helpful I've encountered. They are always willing to go the extra mile to make your stay enjoyable.
The breakfast is served in a bright and airy room and includes a variety of Portuguese and international dishes. There is also a good selection of coffee and tea.
Overall I had a wonderful stay at the Portugal Boutique Hotel. It is a great choice for anyone looking for a stylish and centrally located hotel in Lisbon. cons:
pros: Great location and comfy bed. cons: Bed too big for the room so their wasn't much walking space.

Eggs cooked to order but rather bland. You can hear and feel subway noise in the rooms but it wasn‚Äôt so bad as to keep me awake at night. I‚Äôd recommend a room on a higher floor if possible.

pros: Amazing hotel with super friendly and helpful staff. Located in the city center. Big nice rooms. Worth every cent paid. Highly recommended. cons:

pros: For a city centre hotel the Portugal Boutique Hotel was modern and roomy.  The hotel was located in the old town centre close to the main shopping areas with many restaurant nearby and perfectly situated for exploring. It was less than a 30 minute taxi ride from the airport (‚Ç¨20). Trams and buses are only short walk away. We had a great time staying here. The staff were very friendly and helpful and gave us some greta aides for sightseeing whilst we were there. It was my wife‚Äôs birthday whilst we were there and they made a real effort to make it memorable and enjoyable. We had a great time. cons: There was nothing that we didn‚Äôt like about this hotel.
pros: Good location clean and comfortable room cons: Breakfast was limited

pros: The hotel is very well decorated/designed and smells very good. Everything is clean and seems new. Excellent location. I didn‚Äôt find that it disturbed my sleep or took away from the quality of the stay but those sensitive to noise/vibration may be negatively impacted.

A big thank you! cons: The only thing I would suggest is bigger tables for breakfast. At times it felt a big crowded on the table. The outdoor dining area was a good compromise but it was a little chilly to eat outside in the morning.

one minute walk to the central square to get taxis and hop on hop off bus . 5 minutes to the train if you go to Sintra for a day trip. cons:

pros: The location is close to train bus metro and tram for touring Lisbon. The hotel is beautifully appointed and the staff was exceptionally accommodating at every point of service. Attentive without being intrusive. The room was quiet very comfortable with large bath temperature/light control comfy bed/linens Delta espresso machine and mini refrigerator. The TV is in the large room mirror- special touch. Breakfast was excellent and served at our reserved table. We felt warmly welcomed and cared for throughout our stay. Reception was always available to provide for example restaurant/Fado recommendations or patient assistance with map navigation and transportation options. A note of welcome with a personal bottle of Port and 'thank you for staying' gift of a Portuguese bottle of liquor on the evening before our departure- examples of that extra touch of hospitality that separates a 4-star from a 5-star hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Lisbon! I would definitely stay here again. cons:
pros: Excellent. Was exactly what was needed. Attention to detail excellent. Service excellent. Nothing was too much trouble. cons:

pros: First the staff is exceptional.  From the time we checked in until the time we left we were treated like royalty.  I have never had a hotel experience like this one and it will be hard to find another.  I was celebrating my 65th birthday and was treated with a bottle of champagne chocolates coconut cookie bites and a bottle of port wine.  Over the top.  The front desk staff made it a point to get to know their guests.  They were always friendly and ensured all our needs were met.  The same can be said of the breakfast staff.  Each morning we were greeted cheerfully by the hostess and again she made sure we were getting everything we needed or would go the extra mile to meet those needs. She even remembered our breakfast choices from previous days. We looked forward to the delicious breakfast and service in the dining room each morning. Great way to start our daily activities.  Upon leaving the front desk booked our transfer and ensured our safe departure.

The hotel is modern and clean.  The fragrance they use in the common areas is calming and spa-like.  The attention to details adds so much quality to this boutique hotel.  

The location of the hotel is perfect.  Out the door and around the corner to catch Tram 38 or within walking distance of so much of central Lisbon. Restaurants shopping museums everything is close by.

The experience at this hotel has set the bar for my future travels.  Again we are most appreciative of the staff and the care we received. cons: The only thing we had issue with at the hotel was the tub/shower combo.  It was quite high and a challenge for us to get in and out of safely.  There is a grab bar and we just had to be cautious not to slip or fall on our way in/out.  Also there is a door stop in front of the toilet that kept the door from hitting the toilet.  We tripped on this stop several times when the door was closed.  It is in an awkward place - but can't see how it could be remedied.
pros: large room great breakfast a shower and a tub very nice place we will be back cons: having to leave
pros: very modern and clean. comfortable and spacious rooms. Great location and still quite. staff really helpful throughout stay. Included breakfast was lovely cons: nothing

also we were out from 9am until 2:30pm and the room didn‚Äôt get cleaned which was unfortunate.
pros: beautiful boutique hotel in a great location cons:

She always greeted us with a smile & kind words & is most definitely an asset to your beautiful hotel. cons: Nothing negative to say about this hotel. Location parking reception room & breakfast were all wonderful!

pros: This hotel is excellently situated very close to Martim moniz and Rossio metro stations not to mention Tram 28 and countless bus stops making it perfect for access anywhere in Lisbon and beyond. It is very well run breakfast was conducted a-la-carte while we were there that did mean you had to book a timeslot the previous day.Nice little touch they sent half a bottle of Port and 2 pasteis  de Nata to our room on the day of check in. We also got a free upgrade to our room which made our stay even better. Smiley doorman and lovely staff all round cons: Did not do my research properly and did discover on the day that this hotel is in fact on top of the underground. It did not bother us to be honest and it kind of became 'white noise' so not necessarily a negative from my point of view. But if you are a light/ jumpy sleeper needing perfect quiet you may have to reconsider if this is the right hotel for you. All in all an amazing stay.

pros: The hotel is located in the Lisboa downtown in a pedestrian area so it is very quite. From there you can easily reach every spot by foot. The room is very comfy and big everything was perfect in the right way. The bathroom is very big and some glass doors allow you to share the toilet in privacy. The breakfast was very good with a  big choice of different food and drinks. The staff was super they also offered us very special sweets and drinks of Lisboa as a room service. Btw even I was born in Italy I tasted one of the best espresso ever tried abroad by a room coffee machine. The mirrored TV screen is something very impressive. The quality of everything is very high and nothing is left to chance.  Many thanks to the italian speaking hostess which was very kind and helpful. cons:

pros: The staff is perfect very welcoming and helpful.

The room was very clean comfortable and beautiful cons:

pros: Nice hotel in a fantastic location on a quiet pedestrian-only street. We walked everywhere from the hotel and also very easily got Ubers when needed. The hotel and restaurant staff were very friendly and accommodating. Very comfortable bed. The included breakfast was good and as expected. cons: The only ‚Äúcomplaints‚Äù to share are that the rooms are heavily sprayed with perfume which I didn‚Äôt love breathing in. Also we could only control the hot temperature in the room not the cool AC and we were hot at night. This may have been due to the time of year that the AC was deactivated? Overall really enjoyable stay.
pros: the staff is excellent and professional. breakfast is very yummy.. they served pastel de nata a portugal dessert treat. the location is perfect you dont need to climb. i love it. cons: n/a

pros: Probably one of the best hotels we've stayed in abroad if not the best and that's mainly due to the staff working there  the most courteous and friendly we've ever met  they couldn't do enough for us . As for the hotel it's a lovely modern hotel in the heart of Lisbon surrounded by some nice little bars and restaurants and a very short walk from the terminal for tram 28  i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling to Lisbon . cons:

pros: Lovely boutique hotel located in the heart of Lisbon. Literally walk out the door at everything within easy reach! The staff are so welcoming and go that extra mile to make their guests feel at home. cons:

pros: Fantastic hotel and staff¬† 
My wife and I stayed at the Portugal Boutique Hotel for three nights as a 60th birthday present for my wife.
We stayed in a large beautiful room which was spotlessly clean.
On arrival we were left little custard tarts and a small bottle of port in our room. 
On our second night when we arrived back at our room we had a fantastic surprise when the hotel management had left us a bottle of sparkling wine in an ice bucket and chocolates with a beautiful hand written note wishing my wife a happy birthday. 
I cannot rate the staff highly enough so helpful and courteous from receptionist too the breakfast room staff.
They had a nice selection of food which was served to you at your table even sparkling wine. The staff always had a smile for us in the morning. 
Once again thank you Portugal boutique hotel for a beautiful and relaxing stay We look forward to returning and would recommend this hotel¬† to anyone. 
¬†
¬†
¬† cons: Nothing it was perfect

The staff also bump up the price of the travel card. you can pick them up much cheaper at any station.

pros: Excellent  location really pleasant and clean rooms great breakfast  but the thing that made this such a great place to stay were the staff. All of the staff were incredibly friendly helpful and generous with their time and advice. cons:

pros: We liked everything about our stay. Friendly staff and nothing was an issue and so friendly. Room upgrade was supplied and bars brought our room.

pros: Location is perfect. Room was big. Bedsheet very soft and towels as well. They also offered a little bottle of porto wine and cherry liquor. Bathroom very spacious. All clean very well. cons: The underground is under the hotel so in the room there was a little noisy. Also the pavement of the room was wobbly.
Also it was not convenient to have to book a time for breakfast every morning usually it should be possible to go at anytime.

pros: the hotel was excellent rooms and bathrooms and well designed! staff are excellent. little welcome and goodbye gifts left for you staff cannot do enough to help you cons: the bed was quite hard the pillows too high overall didn‚Äôt have a good sleep once while there‚Ä¶ a shame as everything else was fantastic

pros: Amazing location. Every member of staff was so friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom were very comfortable and absolutely spotless.  Breakfast was simple but delicious especially the fresh orange juice and cakes. The first night of my stay I was unexpectedly given a welcome lovely plate of pasteis and a small bottle of port which I thought was so nice and really appreciated! cons: The street facing rooms are quite loud which I didn't mind but should be noted if you're sensitive to noise.

pros: The location is the best in a quiet alley (no need to climb uphill to go downhill) but convenient to every well by walk/tram. Bedding are very comfy with plenty of pillows. Can easily ask for water kettle or pot of hot water as they don‚Äôt supply the kettle in the room. cons: The bath robe is a bit smaller in size and breakfast got various bread we can‚Äôt finish (but maybe others who love bread would like it a lot)

pros: Everything about this hotel was 10/10! 
Grea staff great room great breakfast great location great house keeping! cons: We liked everything about the hotel.

pros: We enjoyed our stay.  The hotel is in a convenient location to shopping restaurants and local transportation.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Breakfast  was delicious.  The room and hotel is clean.  I would stay here again! cons:

pros: location was perfect could walk everywhere if you chose to right next to Rossio metro. Lovely helpful staff (spoke perfect English) and spotlessly clean. Bar and restaurant at the hotel closed when we were there but we made use of the rooftop bar and lounge bar at the (connected) hotel next door lounge bar was reasonable and roof top bar was amazing. although pricy
pros: very modern and clean cons: no gym

pros: Excellent! Super clean! Very good location delicious breakfast and welcoming staff. Large bathrooms quality products. Cannot wait to be back. cons: Nothing: rooms could have kettles for hot beverages/coffee.

I intend to recommend the hotel to my friends and there is no doubt that I will stay there again in the future. cons: the wifi was limited and did not allow me to chat via WhatsApp and did not allow me to open some of the sites I tried to browse.  Too bad.

Better coordination with private transfers next time to/from hotel.
pros: Location comfortable room friendly staff. cons:

pros: The staff at this hotel are friendly helpful and genuinely thoughtful going above and beyond! The room was pristine large and had very thoughtful details throughout during the stay (including some delicious local treats). Fab breakfast with a great variety of sweet/savoury baked goods eggs hot/cold meats fresh seasonal fruit and natural yoghurt. Location is perfect for a short or long stay. I stayed here upon recommendation from my parents & friends who have stayed here over the years and my stay (altho short due to being delayed arriving) exceeded expectations. This was my first time in Portugal and I am really looking forward to returning! cons: Nothing!
pros: Location staff and the upgrade was a pleasant surprise cons: Nothing
pros: The location was really good it was near to everything cons: We could feel the vibration of the metro each time it passed and the bathroom can get very cold the floor was freezing
pros: Attention to detail! Staff makes you feel like a guest! cons:

pros: Very friendly staff excellent location comfortable beds and very good breakfast. I will definitely stay here again when I am in Lisbon. cons: Kept knocking on my door with chocolates wine etc. I just came off a 14 hour flight and was not interested in the disruptions.
pros: Great location amazing staff and service cons: Nothing
pros: The hotel is beautiful and well decorated. The location is extremely central and the star are exceptional!!! cons:
pros: Everything. Although the surroundings do not look very safe the location is excellent the hotel is beautiful very clean friendly personnel. cons: I did like everything.

pros: Well located near major attractions shopping and Metro stations. Yet tucked away from the crowd. The hotel gave us little treats (egg tarts wine welcome drinks petit fours) for the New Year festivities. The room we had was so comfy. cons: Nothing not to like about.

pros: The staff are wonderful and go out of their way to make sure guests are happy. My son came down with a stomach virus and hotel staff were so kind and helpful with preparing special food for him finding us a Dr who did housecalls and even scouring pharmacies to find us the medicine the Dr had prescribed. The breakfast was amazing and included smoked salmon and mimosas every day!  Also eggs bread cheese charcuterie fresh fruit/veggiesetc.  Can't understand why anyone would complain about this.  Hotel is central to almost everything and walkable.  Room was decent size and clean. cons: The bathroom had a slight sewage smell even though hotel tried to fix it. This is common in Lisbon especially in older buildings in the Baixa and wouldn't stop me from booking here again.  Hotel is located near the Mouraria neighborhood which can be dodgy at night but again no biggie for me.  I felt the subway but only barely  - didn't prevent me from sleeping like a baby during my stay.  Bring earplugs if you're sensitive to noise.  The amazing staff and comfy beds make up for these small issues
pros: Wonderful friendly staff. Super location and beautiful hotel. So helpful for information and guiding you to your tourist destination. cons: No complaints üëå
pros: Excellent location. Staff went above and beyond. Really great touches throughout our stay. cons: The pillows were not so comfortable but that‚Äôs a personal preference.

pros: Hotel central location in easy walking distance of many of Lisbon's attractions bus and tram stops and eateries. The staff were absolutely exceptionally courteous and helpful. Amongst the best we've experienced. cons: Maybe the breakfast coffee could have been stronger but we're nit-picking.
pros: Breakfast cons: No gym

pros: The hotel was at the perfect location for our needs.  Our room was clean and large.  The restroom and shower in the room was my favorite from my whole trip.  It was spacious and also clean.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious with fresh juices. We had a wonderful stay. cons:

pros: Very clean friendly staff good buffet breakfast. Location is excellent. cons: Couple of small things in the room could do with some attention but minor and wouldn‚Äôt stop me going back to the same hotel or room.

It has a huge bed but there little room at the foot of the bed. It is probably all to do with the construction of the hotel.

pros: I stayed here with my son and our experience was truly exceptional. The rooms were comfortable and the ambiance made us feel instantly relaxed. However it was the staff that really made our stay unforgettable especially Diogo. His warmth and genuine care shone through and he took a special interest in my son's journey offering words of encouragement before his competition and celebrating with us after his success. Diogo's support truly added a personal touch that meant a lot to both of us. We look forward to coming back! cons: The breakfast selection could use a bit more variety to enhance the morning experience

The staff were friendly and always ready to help with any questions. The breakfasts which were included were delicious and varied. The hotel‚Äôs complimentary treats were something special: local drinks fresh desserts and incredibly tasty sweets.

Overall this is the perfect place for those seeking comfort and excellent service during their trip to Lisbon. I will definitely return and highly recommend this hotel to everyone! cons:

pros: The rooms are absolutely Elegant and beautiful: double height ceilings Separate shower and bathtub double sinks toilet and bidet. The location was very central. We could walk to everything. We left our car in their parking facility at a neighboring hotel. cons: Nothing!

pros: The hotel is centrally located next to Rossio Square. The room was exceptional with great amenities that included an abundance of soft towels great toiletries and an excellent bathroom with an oversized shower and a bidet. The sheets were high end and the bed super comfortable with a turn down service topped with a chocolate treat. The staff were super friendly and most helpful including those who served the lovely breakfast. Overall this is a wonderful place to stay. cons: During this visit which was the second over the two weeks we were in Portugal there was nothing I was unhappy with.
pros: Spacious well appointed room cons: The shower wasn't powerful enough

pros: Breakfast is OK good enough to start the day 
Big rooms and  bathrooms. 
Very comfortable beds and great pillows. 
Everything was cleaned very well daily.
Highly recommend cons:

pros: The Portugal Boutique Hotel is one of my favorite hotels. The staff were friendly and accommodating and went out of the way to make us feel welcome. Each night we had a tray of treats waiting for us.  One night they provided a small bottle of Ginjinha the most iconic drink of Lisbon dating back to the 13th century. On our last evening we had a lovely personalized note thanking us for our stay. The room was spacious and quiet - the wonderful shutters helped to keep it quiet and dark (we actually overslept the first morning it was so comfortable). The bathroom was outstanding with both a shower and a bathtub. Breakfast was superb with many choices (and oh that fabulous orange juice) which you could enjoy either inside or outside on their terrace (which we did). I could not have asked for a better location. It was within walking distance of all that we wanted to see. If we ever find ourselves in Lisbon again we will absolutely stay here again Thank you for a wonderful few days and nights! cons: The only thing that could have been better is that we had been able to stay an additional night or two! I can't think of a single thing that needed improvement! Wonderful hotel.
pros: Clean bright fabulous location super helpful staff. Loved everything cons: Nothing
pros: Great location very friendly staff comfortable room cons: Nothing worth mentioning

pros: The breakfast was great and the service provided by all the staff was excellent. The amenities linens and quality of the towels was first class. The support and attention to all requests was exceptional. cons: Not really anything to complain about.

pros: AMAZING staff who warmly greeted us and were available to assist in any way. Our room was luxurious and we were treated with sweet & savory treats each day. Wonderful breakfast and close to transportation and sights. cons:

pros: For my wife and I the best experience was Hotel during our visit and most definitely one of the best hotels we have stayed in. All staff members were excellent but 3 stood out to us the most:

Carlos works as a manager for the breakfast service and was incredible. He would always greet us well and go the extra mile to make sure we were well looked after. He made us feel like family and each time we saw him it was a delight to interact and learn about the Portuguese culture. 

In addition we were doing a trip to Sintra where we saw one of the breakfast team staff members on the train (I wish we had taken his name for this review). They could have easily ignored us but it was clear the level of respect they had for themselves and their job that they smiled and greeted us on the train when they didn't have to. 

Jo√£o the Hotel Manager was great too. The hotel offer a view of their wine cellar and you can try their hotel made wines too. We was under the impression that the experience would be around 30-45 mins long but my wife and I had such a great experience with Jo√£o and with his teachings of Portuguese wines and culture that we was there for over 2 hours. It was a great experience and with creating this great relationship with Jo√£o Jo√£o and the team would always go the extra mile to come talk and just share great learnings with us. 

We appreciate that for some people a Hotel may just be a place of sleep but in honesty the experience here was more than that for us. Everyone was truly great and just being able to interact with the staff on a more personal level you do really get to experience more than just place to sleep. 

Great Hotel great team and great experience (also in a great location too). cons:

pros: The hotel was a real find in Lisbon. The rooms were spacious beautifully appointed and very comfortable.
The breakfast spread was simple but delicious and plentiful and the staff very accommodating.
The hotel's location was excellent and as out room faced the interior courtyard was very quiet.
Access to the sister hotel's rooftop bar was a bonus as it has excellent views of Lisbon and the amazing sunsets.
The best thing about the hotel was the staff. The hotel manager made our group feel very special by inviting us to a private wine tasting. The reception staff were very knowledgeable about the city. One example staff of going above and beyond was when we advised them of our very early departure they had breakfast packs ready for our party of eight and also switched on the coffee machine early to offer us coffees before we left. cons:

pros: Great location to see many Lisbon sites by foot or take a trolley  bus underground train. Very good buffet breakfast. The hotel is modern and staff are wonderful. Beds are comfy. cons: Noisy - downside is that you can hear the underground rumble noise of the transit train all night long .  Sleep was an issue for us due to city noise and the train.

pros: Very centrally located - Martim Moniz for Tram 28E Praca  da Figueira - for tram 15E to Belem Rossio - for day trip coaches - all within 5 minutes walk. 
Staff were excellent - very patient and articulate. Special mention for Alexandra Joao Anonessa Mariana and the Brazilian guy in the ground floor Bar - they always seemed to go the extra mile to make you comfortable.
There is a welcome drink on arrival a Ginjinha drink on the first evening and another Port drink on the last evening before departure - all complimentary! Breakfast was good. Taxi from the airport took ‚Ç¨20 - and the driver insisted on cash - so you may want to keep some cash with you or else there‚Äôs also a cash machine nearby. 
Went to the rooftop bar on the last evening- it had good vibes and a very good view of the Castle specially during dusk and when the lights came on. cons: No negative feedback that I can think of.
pros: Nice room  friendly staff. Good breakfast cons:
pros: Location beautiful hotel and rooms exceptional staff great breakfast fantastic stay! Will recommend to family and friends! cons:

pros: Everything. The hotel was beautiful rooms were spacious the bedding was luxurious. Lots of nice little touches in the room. I really cannot find any fault with it. cons: Nothing. It was fantastic

pros: Lovely location right in the main square.  The breakfast was included and it was lovely very attentive staff  and Jual who is  wonderful so personable and extremely helpful 
We had an amazing tour of the wine cellar if you are offered to visit by Jual don't miss it  Jual is entertaining and very knowledgeable also we tried some of the hotel wine.
As for the room the T.V. in the mirror wow...wow! if you can see the pictures of the hotel that is what you are going to get if not better. This hotel exceeded all of my expectations. cons: That I only stayed 4 nights I would gladly stay longer at this amazing  hotel
pros: The hotel was very comfortable staff were helpful and the location was perfect. cons: Nothing! It was perfect!
pros: Everything the rooms the staff was very kind breakfast cons: Everything was perfect

pros: Hospitality was exceptional!! Breakfast is worth every penny!!  This hotel is very very clean. cons: The only bad thing I can say about this place was the lack of iron and ironing board. We asked for it in the next day was taken back. We asked for it back and they took it again for another customer..

pros: Fantastic staffwe had to leave at 6 am to catch a plane and the even made us breakfast before then cons: Unfortunately we only arrived at 6pm and had to leave at 6 am not enough time to enjoy this wonderful hotel and Lisbon

pros: The place is amazing   beautiful and very comfortable the staff is so dedicated as if you were the only guest..( the hotel was fully booked) best location I would recommend it for any stay in Lisbon. cons:
pros: Everything is perfect cons:

pros: Great location.  Very friendly staff. Spacious room. cons: Thin walls. 

Limited choices for beakfast and room service.
pros: Good location in old town. Nice large room and bathroom. Nice touch with the turn down service and little gifts. Nice breakfast selection. cons:

pros: We booked 6 nights and the experience was perfect.
It starts with a smiling and pleasant welcome. The location is ideal literally walking distance to most sites and the metro.
The breakfast is very good from the champagne to the fruits.
The room is spacious with a wardrobe and drawers
The hotel is intimate and you feel a personal relationship with all the staff members. The hotel manager introduced himself and sent us invitations for wine tasting and more...
All our requests were answered positively and immediately.
We received the local liqueur a bottle of wine chocolates and a bottle of water in the room every day.
This is a real boutique hotel we do not doubt that we will return cons: For us a walk-in shower is better than a bath
pros: Excellent location and incredible staff. Loved everything about the stay. cons: Breakfast variety can be a little better

pros: Very beautiful place to rest and enjoy the center of the city. The best was the customer service. Thanks to everyone for the hospitality specially to the manager Joao. Very comfortable bed !! cons:
pros: Great location  great staff giving 5 star service everyday. cons: No issues could not have been better

pros: location was just perfect. Room was very spacious. cons: I wish there was a gym.

pros: The rooms and bad are really comfortable modern good interior very clean.

This is not a problem if you have a deep sleep but for us light sleepers it made it difficult to sleep. 

Luckily the hotel stuff helped us moved to a quieter room they were very accomodating and extremely nice.

pros: Excellent location 2 mins walk from Rossio metro and just below the castle. We walked everywhere from the hotel. Gorgeous room and spacious stunning bathroom ü§©

Breakfast was excellent.  We would definitely recommend this hotel. cons: The hotel entrance is not accessible by car but is only about 2 to 3 minute-walk from the nearest taxi drop-off station.  Not a big problem but good to know if you're carrying several large pieces of luggage like we did.

pros: Hotel was very customer-oriented.  Rooms are beautiful and the bed was the most comfortable I‚Äôve ever slept in - super luxurious!  I love that they provided champagne for our anniversary and also complimentary gingjia and port wine different days in your room.  Breakfast buffet was worth it if not included; lots of options and extended time period compared to other hotels.   Location was close to all the main plazas. cons: Nothing

pros: late check in was handled well. Room was a good size with everything you could need. Location is superb for central Lisbon.

The wine cellar was not open at all during our stay  which was one of the reasons we booked this hotel. That was disappointing.

pros: Cleanliness comfort consistency of service and location! cons: Can‚Äôt think of a thing!

Breakfast is crowded! be sure to put your name on the time sheet and get there early otherwise no place to sit down.

One comment I can make is the observation that the breakfast area is very small (some people had to wait to be seated) and is not a buffet style one had to order items separately and the options were basic not much variety when compared to other hotels in a similar category. This is not something the actually detracted from our experience.

Breakfast room is a bit small but far nicer than the average breakfast buffet room you usually see in hotels. cons: TV was a bit weird (behind the mirror) also small by today's standards for such a large room. But I did love the array of media inputs for the TV to support devices. I marked the facilities down one step as the carpets need replacing. Still many steps above some other hotels though.

pros: The hotel location is superb central to all places of interest. Just seconds from Praca de Figueira where you can access buses metro and organised bus trips. The rooms are stunning modern clean and have every comfort. pros: I liked the room.  Very comfortable and nicely decorated.  Excellent shower and air conditioning.  The room service was also excellent in that they gave us sweets in the afternoon with a small bottle of port.  Breakfasts were wonderful‚Äî hot or cold choices served at your table.  Also can eat breakfast outside in their garden terrace.  Location is also great‚Äî right downtown in the center of town. cons: Closet space was limited.

pros: Quiet spotlessly clean and very comfortable.
Great location.

pros: Location friendly cons: Breakfast you must reserve breakfast time First time we waited 40min for eggs next day after waited for 45min we left didn‚Äôt even had paid breakfast at hotel.

pros: This is such a great place to stay when visiting Lisbon! The staff are welcoming friendly and attentive. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms are spacious comfortable and important for a good night's sleep quiet.
The hotel is centrally located so handy for walking to the various areas of the city or for the Metro service if you want to venture further out.
The staff were superb: the desk staff breakfast service the cleaners ... great people and the hotel should be proud of them. Lisbon is an amazing city to visit and the enjoyment of our own visit was enhanced by our stay at Hotel Portugal. cons: Everything was fantastic.
pros: Location staff breakfast cleanliness. cons: Occasional sound of railroad trains

pros: Location absolutely brilliant on a quiet side street but 2 minutes walk to the square with all transport links. 
Large supermarket on the same block too. 
Breakfast was very good good choice & staff extremely helpful. Everything is served to your table. Breakfast very busy at peak time but no different to other hotels at peak time.
Reception staff extremely helpful too & they remembered my special request made at booking months before so they‚Äôd obviously checked our booking. 
Very clean & comfortable & with a lovely boutique vibe inside. Wooden interior shutters help to block out the light & add to soundproofing from the double glazing. 
Liked the TV incorporated into the giant mirror in the room. 
The staff delivered a welcome gift & a leaving gift to our room. Lovely local food & drinks. Such a nice touch! cons: Difficult to think as everything was so good!
We would have liked a kettle for hot drinks in our room but think this must only be available in more expensive rooms or suites. 
I also requested sensitive skin bedding/towels due to allergies but the hotel laundry didn‚Äôt appear to have any suitable detergents. The staff did remember though & told me at check in that they had requested non fragranced detergents. 
Some hotels now use all anti allergy detergents due to the increasing number of people with similar allergies.

pros: The decor of the room was beautiful. The breakfast and staff were fantastic! You couldn't ask for a better location. It was walkable in every direction! cons: The only downside was the size of the room. It was extremely cramped.
pros: EXELLENT LOCATION ALTHOUGH ON PEDESTRIANS ONLY ALLEY AND COULD BE A PROBLEM WITH LUGAGE. cons: BREAKFAST SERVICE.

pros: The Portugal Boutique Hotel is a stylish and centrally located hotel in Lisbon. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated and the bathrooms are huge. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and the breakfast is excellent (and not a buffet!). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Lisbon

The hotel is located in the heart of Lisbon just a short walk from Rossio Square the S√£o Jorge Castle and the Tagus River.
 The rooms are all individually decorated and spacious with some even having balconies with city views. The bathrooms are also very spacious and come with bathtubs and showers.
The staff at the Portugal Boutique Hotel are some of the friendliest and most helpful I've encountered. They are always willing to go the extra mile to make your stay enjoyable.
The breakfast is served in a bright and airy room and includes a variety of Portuguese and international dishes. There is also a good selection of coffee and tea.
Overall I had a wonderful stay at the Portugal Boutique Hotel. It is a great choice for anyone looking for a stylish and centrally located hotel in Lisbon. cons:
pros: Great location and comfy bed. cons: Bed too big for the room so their wasn't much walking space.
pros: Location cons:

pros: The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful in giving me the lay of the land and telling me where (and where not!) to eat! The room was huge and very comfortable and the Pasteis de Nata and cherry liqueur in the room was a nice touch. cons:
pros: Location style comfort bathroom cons: If you have a car there is no direct car access due to pedestrian street but there is an okay work around thru neighboring hotel

The hotel staff gave me good advice on how things would be affected by all the extra visitors. I felt cushioned from the crowds while I was in the hotel. cons: Breakfast was nice but not exceptional. Eggs cooked to order but rather bland. You can hear and feel subway noise in the rooms but it wasn‚Äôt so bad as to keep me awake at night. I‚Äôd recommend a room on a higher floor if possible.
pros: Room rituals cons: View from window

It was less than a 30 minute taxi ride from the airport (‚Ç¨20). Trams and buses are only short walk away. We had a great time staying here. The staff were very friendly and helpful and gave us some greta aides for sightseeing whilst we were there. It was my wife‚Äôs birthday whilst we were there and they made a real effort to make it memorable and enjoyable. We had a great time. cons: There was nothing that we didn‚Äôt like about this hotel.

pros: The location is close to train bus metro and tram for touring Lisbon. The hotel is beautifully appointed and the staff was exceptionally accommodating at every point of service. Attentive without being intrusive. The room was quiet very comfortable with large bath temperature/light control comfy bed/linens Delta espresso machine and mini refrigerator. The TV is in the large room mirror- special touch. Breakfast was excellent and served at our reserved table. We felt warmly welcomed and cared for throughout our stay. Reception was always available to provide for example restaurant/Fado recommendations or patient assistance with map navigation and transportation options. A note of welcome with a personal bottle of Port and 'thank you for staying' gift of a Portuguese bottle of liquor on the evening before our departure- examples of that extra touch of hospitality that separates a 4-star from a 5-star hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Lisbon! I would definitely stay here again. cons:
pros: Excellent. Was exactly what was needed. Attention to detail excellent. Service excellent. Nothing was too much trouble. cons:

Many thanks to all who made our 3-night stay so special! cons: Can‚Äôt think of anything‚Ä¶ bathroom could use a soap dish.

pros: First the staff is exceptional.  From the time we checked in until the time we left we were treated like royalty.  I have never had a hotel experience like this one and it will be hard to find another.  I was celebrating my 65th birthday and was treated with a bottle of champagne chocolates coconut cookie bites and a bottle of port wine.  Over the top.  The front desk staff made it a point to get to know their guests.  They were always friendly and ensured all our needs were met.  The same can be said of the breakfast staff.  Each morning we were greeted cheerfully by the hostess and again she made sure we were getting everything we needed or would go the extra mile to meet those needs. She even remembered our breakfast choices from previous days. We looked forward to the delicious breakfast and service in the dining room each morning. Great way to start our daily activities.  Upon leaving the front desk booked our transfer and ensured our safe departure.

The hotel is modern and clean.  The fragrance they use in the common areas is calming and spa-like.  The attention to details adds so much quality to this boutique hotel.  

The location of the hotel is perfect.  Out the door and around the corner to catch Tram 38 or within walking distance of so much of central Lisbon. Restaurants shopping museums everything is close by.

The experience at this hotel has set the bar for my future travels.  Again we are most appreciative of the staff and the care we received. cons: The only thing we had issue with at the hotel was the tub/shower combo.  It was quite high and a challenge for us to get in and out of safely.  There is a grab bar and we just had to be cautious not to slip or fall on our way in/out.  Also there is a door stop in front of the toilet that kept the door from hitting the toilet.  We tripped on this stop several times when the door was closed.  It is in an awkward place - but can't see how it could be remedied.
pros: large room great breakfast a shower and a tub very nice place we will be back cons: having to leave
