pros: We loved everything and recommend this place highly. Easy to walk all over the old town. Evening atmosphere looking over the Tejo and the old town terrific. Staff just great and welcoming. cons:

pros: Location of the hotel is in the central area of Alfama district and is close to all the good foods and restaurants. View from the hotel terrace is great with lots of sunshine the whole day. Breakfast had lots of selection of fresh bakeries fruits and cereals and the staff was very friendly. Overall it was a very pleasant stay for us. cons: The room is a bit small with very limited space for luggage.
pros: Small quaint hotel great staff. Near to attractions cons:

pros: The best of the best in everything! Great location close to all main sightseeings but inside the street. Polite and caring personal speaking good English.
We will come back for sure! cons:

pros: Incredible experience at Memmo! We were charmed and fell in love with it. Little details were in every corner and even the smell of the hotel is exquisite. The level of customer service is unparalleled. We felt welcomed and treated extremely well from the very first moment we arrived until the last one when they were calling a taxi to take us to the hotel. 
The breakfast experience was wonderful with all the staff bending over backwards so we could enjoy ourselves. The room was clean comfortable cute romantic bright airy‚Ä¶ we loved it! The lotion body wash shampoo everything was top notch.
The location was PERFECT right in the heart of Alfama which is one of the most romantic historic charming and intriguing neighborhoods we‚Äôve ever visited.
All in all this trip to Lisbon was magical and our stay at Memmo was a big part of it.
Obrigado to all the beautiful staff at Memmo we can‚Äôt wait to visit again. 

Jesus Villanueva & Gerard Sanchez 
Dec 19-23 2024. cons: It was perfect.

pros: The property's location amenities customer service and breakfast were exceptional.  The room was clean the staff provided helpful service and the hotel's proximity to numerous attractions was ideal.  Bianca delivered outstanding service contributing significantly to a flawless stay through her helpfulness and respectful demeanor.  All staff members provided exemplary service. I plan to return next summer and will specifically request Bianca's assistance; her continued employment is highly recommended as she is a valuable asset to your team. cons:
pros: Very conveniently located the staff were all so nice and helpful. The breakfast every morning was amazing. cons: Nothing
pros: The staff is amazing cons: Thee most beautiful view of Alfama

pros: Location could not have been better excellent views from the terrace. The breakfast was more than adequate and the staff were so nice and helpful. Great value for the price! cons: Glass Bathroom door bathroom was a little small but still manageable.
pros: Friendly helpful staff and location cons: No room cleaning during stay.
pros: Brilliant location with a cosy atmosphere and lovely staff cons:

pros: The location of the Memmo Alfama is excellent with tremendous views across the Tejo river as well as across the roof tops of the old town. The terrace with the swimming pool are charming and the breakfast is outstanding. All in all this is a super boutique hotel which will not disappoint you. cons:

pros: Terrace and bar area - informal breakfast cons: Minor detail really - but we were in Room 1 and the door into the public toilet could do with a soft close mechanism as it bangs sometimes.
Fortunately it was lightly used so didn't really disturb us - but would be an easy fix
pros: The outside deck and terrace offered great view and was a wonderful place to relax. cons: Could have done with a bit more cupboard space in the room.

pros: Beyond the gorgeous property and stunning views the staff was extremely kind and accommodating to me during my entire stay. From start when I arrived early to finish when they helped me book a car to the airport and everything in between I am forever grateful to the people who made my stay in Lisbon SO extra special. I didn't have air conditioning and they were quick to resolve my warm room. I was greeted with sweet little candies as a welcome when I arrived and the staff was always available for a recommendation and a hello every morning. I appreciated how clean and sunny my room was and it was perfect spot for my holiday. cons:
pros: Loved it! cons: Loved all of it!  Must stay here again!

pros: Lovely quiet hotel with the opportunity to enjoy the views from the terrace.
The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
The hotel was spotlessly clean.
Super breakfast including a continental buffet of cold meat & cheese crossant & pastries fresh fruit & yoghurt cereals and a freshly cooked breakfast to order. cons: I would prefer more traditional breakfast seating rather than the low sofas chairs and tables.
pros: Amazing location and view! Loved our stay! Breakfast on the terrace was unbeatable cons: Not all of the front desk staff‚Äôs experience was in line and expectations of the hotel price tag.:

pros: The Hotel is really nice situated with a perfect view and walking distance into the Alfama old City.
People are really nice in the Hotel and always friendly. cons:
pros: The position overlooking the Tagus. Pity about the Cruise ships spoiling the view! cons: Nothing
pros: Phenomenal -- the room the breakfast the common spaces the terrace the staff the thoughtful design touches the location. cons:
pros: The staff is outstanding . The view at the rooftop is absolutely amazing! Facilities are great! Loved it cons:

pros: Position views and staff cons: Very small rooms on top floor and very restricted views. Price reflected the position of the hotel the staff and the views from the terrace  but not the size of the rooms!
pros: Hotel with the only roof top terrace in old Lisbon. Has a better view than the tourist viewing point at the top of the hill!! cons: Nothing
pros: Everything. Beautiful. Crystal clean. Fabulous people/service! Location literally everything. cons:

pros: Breakfast was brilliant & Monica overseeing proceedings was exceptional. We loved the view from our room.  Amazing!  Roof top bar staff brilliant! Compliments to housekeeping who had very high standards.  And then on to reception - the jewel in the crown.  Again exceptional!  Leonardo showed us around  & explained all areas of the hotel.  Cannot remember all names of those on reception (so sorry) but you were all wonderful!  Today my husband phoned the hotel to make some enquiries about making a booking for next year. He spoke to Arielle (we had met before).  What an outstanding young woman - so so informative beautiful command of the English language & above all a genuinely lovely person.
Last but not least the brilliant young man who was responsible for the cleaning of the communal floor areas.  He would always stop work to allow guests to continue their travels.  Always with a smile & great courtesy.
Huge thanks to you all. cons: Feel guilty finding any fault - bathroom was a little compromised (cleanliness excellent) & a little surprised by how small the pool was (now I‚Äôm sounding like a complete diva!). Totally understand that land is at a premium in cities such as the gorgeous Lisbon.
pros: Lovely hotel with friendly view delicious food&drinks and very friendly staff. The view from the rooftop is amazing! cons:
pros: The view the service the amenities‚Ä¶ we loved everything about it! cons:

pros: Loved the building and the location. Staff was very friendly. Loved that it included a walking tour with Manuel very interesting. Manuel let a great tour loved learning about the Alfama district one of the oldest in Lisbon. Just excellent especially on our first day of the trip. A wonderful introduction to Portugal. Breakfast was well prepared. cons: Nothing
pros: Gorgeous views and upscale accommodation cons: Pool was more for looks than use
pros: Great location rooftop bar with fabulous views very nice and helpful staff. cons: Room a little small

pros: The hotel is a bit hidden within Alfama which gives the accomodation its charm. It has a very relaxed atmosphere and everyone there is super friendly. The view from the terrace and the pool is absolutely amazing. Just sitting on the terrace and enjoying a glass of wine while taking in the breathtaking view was one of our favourite things to do in whole Lisbon. cons:
pros: Staff were universally helpful and friendly. Lovely terrace with pool and view cons: Room was slightly small for the price. Friends had a bigger room so it‚Äôs just pot luck

pros: The hotel was beautiful with an amazing view and facilities. The location was fantastic. cons: I enjoyed most things. The bathrobes were too small. The rooms were also a little on the small side.
pros: Absolutely loved our stay! The rooftop tapas drinks and pool were the perfect respite from the heat in the city. Highly recommend! cons:

pros: Lovely design. Great staff and good facilities. The food- breakfast and lunch were great too. cons: The only thing was not having enough shade around the pool area and the ability to lounge there. They were having issues at the time and hopefully will be resolved soon.
pros: Staff were excellent and location was very good cons: Nothing it was great

pros: Beautiful hotel with lots of character and history. Great location. The outside area and views were amazing would highly recommend. The bar staff were very friendly and the service was great. cons: I had one of the small rooms which was beautiful but next time I would like to have a larger room.
pros: The best hotel experience I have ever had. cons:

pros: Great location close to the tram and other tourist stuff that I panned to visit. The staff was super friendly. cons: Navigate Lisbon‚Äôs narrow streets is always a challenge we arrived via Uber but the driver did not know he would be able to make a turn in front of the hotel so we had to walk with our bags this narrow street to get there. I did not see any vegan options on the menu (breakfast).
pros: Great breakfast. Great location. Loved the pool and outdoor terrace and view. cons: Nothing
pros: Fantastic location and hotel facilities. Staff are extremely professional and attentive. Very impressed with the hotel definitely would come back again. cons:

pros: Very good service attentive staff tasty food (breakfast tapas) and cocktails. Great design of the hotel and a pool with the amazing views of the old city. We also enjoyed a free guided tour of Alfama cons: Nothing

pros: Location is amazing views from hotel has to be the best in Alfama. Breakfast was very nice and the staff are outstanding. I was very impressed with the service throughout Lisbon would definitely come back. cons: Pool could have been bigger üòâ
pros: The staff was excellent- professional friendly and helpful. We had wonderful recommendations and assistance. cons: We had to leave
pros: Incredibly thoughtful staff and wonderful facilities.  Great walking tour each morning.  Live fado was wonderful! cons:
pros: Great location. Fantastic roof top restaurant. Breakfast was fantastic. Service great! cons: Rooms are very small.

pros: Helpful staff amazing location and rooftop has AMAZING views (as did my bedroom window!) I would definitely stay again. Free walking tour happens at 10am everyday. cons: Service on the rooftop can be hit and miss sometimes but not bad - I think they just get busy and forget a few things but they're always apologetic if so. The doors when they close automatically do slam so I was woken up a few times by other people closing the door.

pros: The hotel has a very cozy and comfortable vibe where the staff is very friendly and helpful. This extends to the ambiance on the outdoor decks and in the ‚ÄúLiving Room‚Äù where guests felt comfortable striking up friendly conversations with other guests. The best compliment would be that though there is much to see in Lisbon as a guest I would have been equally happy to remain at the hotel during my stay. cons:

pros: The pool patio was a lovely place for a drink. It has a great view of the city and feels far removed from the very busy streets of the Alfma neighborhood cons: Taxis were reluctant to drive into the driveway of the hotel

pros: What a great little hotel! Beautifully designed all the staff are incredibly warm and helpful and will go out of their way to help. The rooms are small as are many European hotels in old city centers but very comfortable. The terrace is stunning. I come to Lisbon often and sitting in the terrace doesn‚Äôt make you feel separated from the city.

Food is great and the gym is beautiful spacious and well appointed instead of an after thought. 

Will definitely stay here again. Can‚Äôt stress enough how wonderful the entire team are running the hotel. cons: Not much to dislike!

pros: Everything about our stay at Memmo Alfama was exceptional from the greeting at check in to the views from the roof top bar. We booked a terrace room which was lovely with doors opening onto our own little private seating area - and the view was breathtaking! We ate at the hotel on our first evening and the food was excellent - as were the breakfasts each morning of our stay. The staff team were without exception friendly welcoming and really efficient and worked hard to make our stay enjoyable. The location of the hotel was perfect - we walked everywhere and found excellent restaurants within easy walking distance. We would definitely stay at Memmo Alfama again and have already recommended it to friends. cons:
pros: Amazing location very welcoming staff cosy rooms with a nice view and overall good vibes. cons: Nothing.
pros: Great location and lovely bar area. cons: You can't really lie by the pool in your swimmers as you would expect if there is a pool.
pros: Roof top location decor breakfast staff! cons: Nothing
pros: Beautiful views and the best spot for breakfast in Lisbon cons: Nothing
pros: Location amazing views staff pool area catering. cons: Repairs in the pool area while visiting the hotel. We were compensated though.
pros: Location overlooking water and bar with a view were favourites.  Staff friendly. cons:

pros: This was a great boutique hotel with extremely friendly interested staff and a warm welcoming atmosphere. We were helped with our bags before we even got to the hotel. It is located right in the heart of Alfama minutes from the Se (Cathedral) and on the #28 tram route (the classic Lisbon tram route). The bed was comfortable and the room pleasant. Facilities were very good: small pool gym various terraces. Breakfast was very nice indeed with a range of options including items to order outside of the buffet. There was coffee and tea available in their lounge for most of the day. There was entertainment on one evening too. Staff went out of their way to help. cons: Not much. The view from the room (third floor) was obscured by a wall just outside the window! Perhaps a bigger choice of things to eat on their evening menu. And something to sit on in the bedroom!

pros: The property and location is amazing!  We checked in they took our bags and then took us up to the beautiful patio/bar/pool area.  The views of Alfama and the river cannot be beat from the patio.  We spend each evening enjoying wine from the patio.  
They did an excellent job of cons: Uber/Bolt drivers have trouble finding the little alley the hotel is located thus we had to walk about 100M to the hotel entrance.  This could be challenging for someone with mobility issues.
pros: Outstanding staff - very warm and accommodating. They make you feel like a special guest. The terrace is delightful and a great place for a nightcap. cons:
pros: Everything but particularly the outdoor bar/restaurant on the top that had gorgeous views. cons: Nothing
pros: Everything! Excellent location superb services. Will come back again cons:

pros: reception staff are excellent and the whole place has a really good vibe the view from the rooftop is excellent and we really enjoyed the whole experience. we would definitely return cons: our room wasnt the best

pros: The hotel was really lovely in a great location - has a gorgeous rooftop bar that overlooks the area of Alfama. The hotel is really modern and chic and rooms are very lovely. cons: Cleaning service was a bit slow - we went out at 9am and came back at 3:30pm and our room still hadn't been cleaned. Breakfast is expensive for what it is.

pros: Loved the location quiet and food and rooftop
Patio!!! Never felt crowded. Loved the calm energy and quiet atmosphere. Felt very private. cons: Found a dirty rag on the floor when we arrived.
Pillows were the real downside I thought they were the lumpiest pillows I‚Äôve ever had in a hotel.

pros: Beautiful property tucked away in a hidden spot - charming! Excellent staff nice rooms. cons: Breakfast did not start promptly at 7:00 as advertised and we had an early start in order to catch a plane. This meant we had to grab what we could and run.
pros: Beautiful cons: Everything
pros: Excellent location great view and very quiet for such a busy district. The staff were very friendly and attentive without being intrusive. cons: Nothing not to like.
pros: Great location staff and the pool bar was amazing during the day and late at night! cons: Nothing!

pros: The hotel was very unique. I loved the tour of the boutique hotel before being escorted to our room. The old bakery brick oven the spectacular views the infinity pool service food & variety of beverages. And the staff & other guests were very friendly. Overall relaxing vibe! I can‚Äôt wait to go back! cons: Coffee beginning at 6am?
pros: View over the rooftops of Alfama from our window in room 31. Extra seating space in room 29. cons: Loved everything!

pros: Location 
View from terrace
Breakfast cons: The lights in the room were confusing 
Couldn‚Äôt find outlet for hair dryer
pros: The breakfast was varied and you can order a hot cooked meal. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was large enough and convenient cons:

pros: Great location for exploring and tucked away so It is not noisy. The roof terrace has amazing views and nice place to relax. Staff really friendly. Drinks & tapas on the terrace recommended. cons: Rooms a little small & glass walls to bathroom a bit  dangerous especially at night when easy to walk into them !
Plunge Pool is more for decoration -so don‚Äôt expect to swim laps but very pretty. Not an issue in March anyway
pros: Location room cons: The lighting in our room
pros: It is my third time staying in this hotel and I can‚Äôt wait to stay there in my next visits cons:
pros: The location was amazing. cons: The climate control wasn‚Äôt working in the room but the management were amazing and went out of their way to rectify the problem.

pros: The staff was top notch. Ines Isa Bianca & Arielle and everyone was kind attentive and engaging. Ines really want above and beyond to help us hire a photographer for a couple/maternity shoot when our photographer cancelled same day. Breakfast on the terrace was our favorite and we enjoyed the space of our room and view. If you want to be in the city center and walking distance to St George and other things to do this is the place to be. cons:

pros: Roof terrace was fantastic. Best view in Alfama  . cons: For older people  the lower tables and chairs ar breakfast can be awkward. More traditional dining furniture would be useful but probably not in keeping with the boutique trendy nature of hotel.
pros: Excellent breakfast   Nothing too much trouble. Wonderful view   Heart of the old town. Could walk everywhere cons:

pros: Welcoming and friendly staff nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was excellent. Room was very great. cons: Bed was a king size but not very comfortable. Would have been good to have 2 chairs in the bedroom so we could spend more time in there.
pros: Very good services and the breakfast was very nice and nicely presented. cons: The pillows were uneven and lumpy but a minor problem.

pros: Lovely stuff. Beautiful facilities with great design details. Brilliant location: in the heart of Alfama but tucked away so that it felt very quiet. Breakfast was beautiful: lovely food and a very nice room. cons:
pros: Great location wonderful views but most importantly such friendly and helpful staff. cons: Nothing
pros: The location the views the breakfast options the terrace bar and the staff cons: Room was a bit small for us
pros: Architectural design cons: Small sized rooms but still nice
pros: Great views.. Perfect location..Great staff.. Cozy hotel..They set up private and personal tours also.. cons:
pros: Stylish design great position roof top bar amazing cons: Nothing all amazing
pros: Cozy and stylish place with an incredible view. Excellent service friendly and responsive staff. Worth it! cons:
pros: Staff were super friendly and helpful. Centrally located but tucked away in a peaceful corner. cons:
pros: View beds and breakfast! cons: Access to the hotel is a bit uncomfortable.
pros: Everyone was so warm & welcoming. Extremely helpful. Genuine & efficient. I was treated to wine & birthday cake for my 60th birthday. All the staff made my birthday very special. cons: Nothing.
pros: Very good. cons:

pros: Lovely welcome good breakfast great genuine smiley service. Complimentary Portuguese custard tarts and walk off the locality. Comfy bed great views especially from the the bar and the best location for exploring Central Lisbon. cons:

pros: Location and staff were excellent. cons: The room was smaller than expected for the cost. A Terrace category room does not have a view from inside. You can step outside directly to the roof top bar area from room 12. It I would not call that a view room.

pros: The pool was a welcomed feature after an afternoon under the sun. cons: The hotel is located down a long narrow alley. Sometimes your taxi could not get down it due to parked vehicles. It's a long roll on the cobblestones with your luggage.
pros: Amazing staff: so friendly & helpful. Great location with beautiful views of the port & of Alfama cons: Nothing-a lovely place
pros: Everything cons:
pros: Nice small hotel in central hidden away Almafa location. cons: Not easy to find but worth the search.

pros: Location view service food quality unlimited self serve drinking water and coffee free special events everything worked as intended in the room and the cool interior design of the property. cons: Obscure entrance/gate long 100m walk through alley from the street tiny wash basin uphill walk back everyday.
pros: Clean modern funky cons: You have to get up out of bed to turn off the lights (card key) before sleep. I know that‚Äôs customary for European hotels and energy efficient but annoying.
pros: Great location and cool vibe.  Staff was friendly and helpful!  Food on property was amazing. cons:
pros: Staff were exceptional lovely breakfast nice bar and great terrace cons: Nothing really

pros: There can be no finer boutique hotel in Lisboa! Perfect location in Lisboa. Loved the architecture + design. The view was spectacular. Sitting on the terrace for a before dinner drink (and one night for an after dinner glass of port) is a must. The staff is exceptional is the terrace lounge. And exceptional front desk staff also - they helped us with restaurant suggestions and reservations. Always professional and kind. Wish we had included breakfast option - not sure why we did not. cons: Would loved to had a bigger bed. We are used to a king-sized bed. However the bed was very comfortable.

pros: Lovely and comfortable hotel.  Room was nice enough but the real bonus was the roof deck with a lovely view of the river comfortable seating and nice bar.  Really special. cons: room was small and had no view.

pros: The staff make this beautiful hotel exceptional. There is always someone happy to help you like I√±es Jaime Lucas and Domingo. The reception staff were also super helpful. 
We took a large terrace room which tbh isn't that large but had everything we needed and was spotlessly clean! The soundproofing was amazing and this was needed when we had a thunderstorm and when the stupid cruise ships overuse their PA systems! 
I loved the sustainable feel of the breakfasts including refillable glass containers for yoghurt milk and juice. Small amounts of a selection of foods were refilled often reducing waste and √† la carte was included in the price. 
There is a super well stocked bar also available on the terrace weather permitting which is lovely to just hang out when you need a break from the bustle of the city.
 Alfamma is a great little part of town which despite the odd tourist trap still had authentic people flavours and sounds. 
I would definitely return and wouldn't hesitate to recommend to family and friends. cons: The invisible steps in the pool!
pros: View from the bar over the old part of the city. Comfortable beds and good rooms. cons: Looking over Cruise liners

pros: Great hillside location and the totally stunning rooftop bar with amazing views. Young staff were upbeat and helpful making restaurant booking for us.Room stylish and quiet. Hotel decor lovely. cons: Our room was small- a little more space for our suitcases would have been good.Room was cleaned late in the day 3-4 pm . We wanted to have a rest during that time so it was a nuisance to have to wait.
pros: The location and views were amazing! cons: The patio bar was lovely.
pros: Stunning roof top views over Alfama and the Atlantic. Super comfy beds. Excellent staff and great breakfast cons: Kettle did t work and tea/coffee offering poor
pros: Great position easy access cons:

pros: Main hotel terrace with views over the Tagus. Service was exceptional. Food was great. Location was ideal! cons: The room was barely large enough for two people with two suitcases. Granted the room size was mentioned but we won't stay there again because of the tiny size. Too bad. Also there was no lighting inside or near the closet so you couldn't see what you were looking at or looking for.

pros: Loved the rooftop pool and bar this was such a nice spot to finish the day with a glass of wine. The staff was also kind enough to treat us to a bottle of wine and chocolate cake for our honeymoon. Great hospitality! cons: The room was just a little small wish there was more privacy for the bathroom

pros: Location 
Helpful staff
Free tour
Terrace cons: Breakfast not included
pros: Lovely place perfect location cons:

pros: Hotel design was great the location and view are stunning! Nice pool area for drinks or to get some sun. Food menu is limited not many vegan options but otherwise all good. cons: I think they could offer more sun lounger type chairs - something more comfortable for hanging by the pool.
pros: Modern and the terrace was very nice. cons:
pros: Everything cons: Very expensive but however worth it
pros: Everything - the pool area was lovely cons: Nothing

pros: Location was brilliant. Staff very friendly. Beautiful terrace to drink and food with amazing views cons: The top floor rooms have no views or much daylight‚Ä¶ there is a wall in front of the window. Disappointed. Be aware of the tricky narrow street approaching the hotel
pros: Appreciated that we could drop our bags early and the valet parking was complimentary. cons:
pros: Beautiful views from hotel with a lovely bar and pool - able to relax and catch the view. The rooms were nice but nothing to write home about. Decent breakfast though wasn't included. cons:
pros: reception breakfast terrace cons: a double bed for the room with 2 people which we preferenced online would have been appreciated instead of the single bed we got

pros: The location was perfect. Very central for many of Lisbons tourist sites. The hotel terraces were incredible with amazing views over the River and the city. The hotel is like a sanctuary. cons: Nothing
pros: Design of the hotel and that is new and well located cons: Breakfast and cleaning
pros: Location is great although Uber/bolt drivers struggle cons: Room size is tight
pros: Location design and staff cons: N/A
pros: Very stylish location fantastisch verw√∂hnen very nice staff cons: all perfect

pros: I had stayed in 2018 and loved it so couldn‚Äôt wait to find the the excuse to be back. Some 10 people were there in the end to attend the same party.
I love the style and the non hotel vibe like I was a guest at somebody‚Äôs beautiful house. cons: Like anywhere else prices have gone up.. so I couldn‚Äôt even say it‚Äôs a negative
pros: The pool and views from the terrace cons: Stay longer
pros: Fantastic hotel and amazing staff cons: Shower tray had a base that was uncomfortable on the feet! Trivial comment to say least.

pros: The staff!! Also breakfast the view our room the pool and did I mention staff?! So nice. The room was perfect not huge but exactly what we needed and the bathroom had this big lovely shower and great design. cons: It is a bit rough getting there with a rental car if you‚Äôre new to Lisbon driving a little dead end tiny street but then we‚Äôd arranged for valet parking so the staff met us helped guide us in and then took our car away and parked it for then duration which was awesome.

pros: Stayed here with my mum on a getaway with her and we had the best time. It‚Äôs in alfama which is a beautiful area in Lisbon and we spent many nights on the rooftop having cocktails enjoying the stunning view . cons:

pros: I loved everything about it! Most comfortable bed with air conditioner. Beautiful terrace with amazing view. Greats food and drinks. Super friendly staff. It‚Äôs a hotel perfect for relaxing. Pool is not very big but that‚Äôs what you expect from a Boutique hotel and it had perfect temperature and it‚Äôs great to enjoy a drink in it. cons:

pros:  cons: The only comment or recommendation I have is that it was difficult to get a Bolt or Uber to drop us off at the hotel. Because the street is so narrow we typically had to walk up the hill a ways and get a ride from there. We only used Bolt or Uber during our stay when we arrived at the hotel and left it. We walked everywhere else!

pros: The attention to every design detail. Having a modern space that appreciates its classic vintage surroundings. Room was small but so well-appointed it didn't matter. cons: Limited 'closet space'. 20 minute wait time for a drink at the pool bar.

Coffee wasn't freshly made in a pot instead...   overall was pleasant.

pros: Hotel and  staff were excellent! Our room was very nice. Breakfast was good. Lara hostess extraordinaire was exceptional! She arranged for us to attend a Fado evening at the hotel and gave us dinner and lunch recommendations for our time in Lisboa. The Fado troupe were exceptional!! It was our first experience. I'd recommend to anyone to see it. cons: Not a thing.

pros: Food was amazing service exceptionally friendly and helpful location and rooftop terrace absolutely perfection. cons: The glass partition between the bathroom and room felt less than ideal although the curtain did provide privacy.

pros: Artistic & high quality design throughout the terrace with a pool and far reaching views over the rooftops of Alfama and the river.
Room thoughtfully provided for: kettle for tea & coffee making very quiet fridge stocked with drinks port & Portuguese pastries gratis on arrival. Bathroom had a magnifying mirror facecloths shower cap toiletries power shower‚Ä¶
All staff were charming helpful and friendly and nearly all spoke English.
Delicious breakfasts with fresh fruits and juices yogurts homemade granola omelettes etc cons: We booked a 3 night stay over my husband‚Äôs birthday which co-incided with Good Friday. Lisbon and nearby Sintra were very busy over Easter. We‚Äôd like to return to memmo Alfama again and book a longer stay outside of school/public holidays.

pros: Beautiful location with rich history. The staff was very friendly (esp. the hostess with the short hair). The walking tour of the neighbourhood was great (props to Fred). cons: The main courses we had were really disappointing. Portions were small and the meat was dry. Fortunately our server offered us free drinks in exchange.
pros: Great location trendy architecture very helpful and friendly staff cons: Room size a little small

pros: Excellent location great staff and the room was superb.

However we overcame this and had further good relations with the individual for the rest of our brief stay.

pros: We stayed in three different great hotels in different areas in Lisbon. The hotel is beautiful from check-in to the rooms and  being in the heart of Alfama is great. You can jump off Tram 28 to this hotel just as it starts to get super crowded. The selling point of this place is the view and sitting on the patio having dinner and drinks at the property. We always ended our evenings here as it was romantic enjoying cocktails and dinner with provided blankets. the Amenities of the room are good but was one of the few places that charged for provided drinks/snacks in room. The Price for breakfast is too pricey for what is offered but enjoyed a short walk to Antu Alfama.  We had a fantastic stay and would recommend staying! cons:

pros: Memmo Alfama is a special hotel hidden at the end of an alley in Lisbon's most beautiful neighborhood. The property is stunning and the juxtaposition of minimal modern design with centuries old buildings is remarkable. The rooftop is great the breakfast is generous and the rooms are comfortable and meticulously clean. The property is also quiet given its position away from the main road. The staff were very accommodating. I'd definitely stay at Memmo again! cons: The wifi was very poor. The average download speed was between 1-2 mbps in both the common and private areas. You won't be able to make video calls or stream video.

Breakfast was lovely but disorganized. Not enough staff and every morning something different was missing. But it's hard to complain given the setting.

The pool is gorgeous but not really useable (unless you want 20 people sipping cocktails watching your every move)

All fabulous comfortable luxurious super clean and of course beautiful. We appreciated the architecture of the hotel and the well placed picture windows which give you views of the beautiful city. Also sampled some of the tapas - delicious! cons: Breakfast service each day. They were short on staff. It was really difficult to get cold milk for the amazing cereal selection (strange but true!). We had to go and find staff (literally wait outside the kitchen until someone appeared) to get things like milk extra water or coffee which was a bit frustrating. Especially as I‚Äôm six months pregnant! If they had some dedicated breakfast waitstaff to look after guests that would be a huge improvement.

pros: Loved the breakfast

pros: Great hotel. location and staff.  Quite an oasis of tranquility in the middle of busy Lisbon.  We did not know what to expect as our taxi drove into an alley to drop of off and it was the perfect experience at the end of our travels.  The staff was attentive and ready to assist specially the team that manages the breakfast service.  We  enjoyed the terrace and its outdoor spaces. It was hard to leave. cons:
pros: Location breakfast interior and facility especially the pool area. cons: Long waiting time for drinks and food in the restaurant

pros: It's a lovely hotel in a great location. Great breakfast beautiful views from the roof deck. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was small but probably standard for Lisbon. I'd definitely recommend the hotel. cons: Unfortunately there's a rodent problem on the roof deck. Both nights we saw either a rat or large mouse cross the deck. Other than that the setting is lovely and the view amazing.
We also were given incorrect information regarding train service. We were assured by reception that there was no need to purchase train tickets to Coimbra in advance. We got to the train station and train was sold out. We had to wait 2 hours for the next train.
The free walking tour was not great. The guide did not read his audience. We finally had to leave after 1.5 hours when the guide kept us at the entrance to a public toilet to talk about a mural. Well-intentioned but not enjoyable.
pros: Very good breakfast great location beautiful view from the roof bar cons: Too small room and bathroom pool more for design purposes slow service in the bar

It was really good fun and gave us lots of information we would have missed otherwise.  We ate dinner in the hotel on two nights of our stay and the food was very good.  The room was perfect and we enjoyed the swimming pool. cons:

I‚Äôd recommend this location to anyone and would jump at a chance to visit again! cons:

Such a beautiful relaxing atmosphere overall! cons: I wish our room were bigger as it was hard to even figure out where to put our suitcases. That said That‚Äôs not something they can easily change nor did it really matter in the end because there is so much to do out and about and the outdoor space at the hotel is so inviting that we really didn‚Äôt spend much time in our room. I do think they could upgrade their pillows though! They were lumpy and uncomfortable. That would be my only suggestion.

pros: Say something ideal and Memmo Alfama could be synonymous with ideality. Everything is perfect here: location view to the river bells ringing from a neighbouring cathedral friendly stuff and unexceptional breakfasts. cons: Everything was just perfect

pros: The hotel staff was exceptional! Starting with the front desk people- they were so helpful and knowledgeable. They assisted with difficult questions like where to get a Covid test! 
The bar/dining staff was also exceptional! I was traveling solo and my Christmas Eve Dinner was to die for! I think it was like 8 courses and non-stop Prosecco! Incredible evening. I didn't feel alone at all. The staff made my holiday very enjoyable and very special! cons: Nothing!
pros: Great location beautiful view from our room convenient rooftop bar/restaurant cons: Room was quite small especially if traveling with a friend (versus as a couple)

pros: Breakfast was simple but it worked. Views are obviously divine . Bed was comfortable and room was clean and quiet. cons: As a Portuguese tourist everything seems tailored for the foreign tourists. I was spoken to in English most of the times. Weather was poor and this hotel doesn‚Äôt have the amenities to stand on its own without the balcony/terrace. Room was very small.

pros: Monika who worked in the restaurant was very friendly helpful and kind. The property was well maintained. The breakfast was very good. The patio areas were great. cons: It was very expensive for what we got - a very small room AC that didn‚Äôt work much at night no matter what we did to it and no view. The rates advertised on the internet were much less than what we paid.

pros: The hotel itself is really nice good location (Alfama is the most touristy part of Lisbon but it‚Äôs very convenient) and the rooftop pool is amazing with good cocktails and a great view. Most of the staff is really friendly and accommodating. cons: The room we booked (in a group of 5 rooms) was easily the worst room of the 5 yet we paid the most on Booking. I asked if there was a better room and they insisted rather vehemently it was the better room although the bathroom was the size of one on a small airplane (you could touch the toilet from the bed) and had no deck (unlike the other rooms) and was much smaller. And the AC didn‚Äôt work. I asked if there was a way to get a better room especially since we paid so much but the woman at the front desk continued to gaslight me and argue in a really confrontational manner. I‚Äôm not someone who complains often so I was polite and genuinely surprised she was so adamant about it. That said many other people on the staff were very friendly and helpful.

pros: Large terrace with spectacular views & bar service and tapas. Comfortable bed with nice linens. Rooms were clean w/ some a welcome pastry & a nice personal cash snack/drink bar. Walkable location to active area! cons: Rooms were small w/ glass w enclosed bathrooms; concerning when getting up at night particularly.  
Windows have a wall blocking any view with light coming in only through the top; strange & feels quite closed in.
DJ playing loud rock & roll in evening on terrace; don‚Äôt fit the ambiance of the lovely space. 
We were leaving @ 7:45 & felt like we were asking a big favor to get a coffee before departure. 
Uber drops you down the street w a bit of a walk that your suitcase wheels will not like. ;)

pros: Location overlooking the river. Staff were very nice. cons: The cruise ships dock in front of the hotel spoiling the view  loud tannoys from the ships. Rooms are very overlooked by the terraces. Did not want to use the pool because pigeons and seagulls would drink and wash themselves in it. Very difficult hotel to find the hotel need to give better instructions. Hotel very overpriced no coffee machine in the bedroom no netflix no bbc news channel. The hotel was very geared up to their American clients. The hotel is situated in a very unclean area of Alfama.
pros: Location is nice Reception Staff is friendly. cons: Bar Service Lot of noise in the room we took Hard to Park

pros: The location was great in the middle of the old town and also 25 minutes from the airport. The receptionist Isa Garcia was extremely helpful and really took great care of us. The barman Jaime was so hopeful and nice. Some other staff members were nice too but I felt that sometimes they weren‚Äôt coordinated. cons: 300 Euros per night for the room. Very small room. No coffee machine. Kettle available but due to the incredibly tight room there was no place for placing the kettle to make a drink. 
They have a coffee machine in the living room of the hotel but only after 10 am.
We didn‚Äôt have breakfast at the hotel as found the cafes outside much better quality.
pros: Nice common areas: rooftop living room and dining room. cons: Overrated and Overpriced. Not so welcoming. Elevators not working. Too expensive for what you got.
pros: The location was great cons: Our room was dreadful it was tiny and dark suitable for one person

pros: This property has great design boutique small rooms with a great location easy walking distance with a lot to see and do places in Alfama Baixa and Chiado. There was one person who made our stay turn around was Monica who went out of her way to make our stay enjoyable. cons: The staff was indifferent to Me and wife. We waited 6 hours in a waiting room at the hotel after an international flight from the US. We requested 2 beds and received a full/queen size in an extremely small room with for advanced reservation. Multiple people who came after us were placed in their rooms far in advance of us. It was only after I requested our room were we finally accommodated. by the staff who knew our request upon arrival know we were waiting onsite. In comparison our last 2 nights in Lisbon we stayed at the Intercontinental for the same price and received 5 star treatment with breakfast included and accommodations with an excellent staff location and exceptional customer service.

pros: good view - in historic section - close to everything cons: the seating in the breakfast are was for small children- chairs too low- tables too low- very uncomfortable - I get the vibe they were going for but it missed the mark
Also- i don‚Äôt understand the in- room bathroom with the curtain thing‚Ä¶. my husband had quite a good time opening the curtain while I was in the shower‚Ä¶. it was pretty funny‚Ä¶ however I don‚Äôt understand - why not just have a solid wall separating your bathroom from your bedroom?
pros: location cons: The room doesn‚Äôt have blinds and the bathroom wasn‚Äôt clean
pros: The location cons: Didn‚Äôt offer early booking
pros: The rooftop was beautiful cons:

pros: it‚Äôs in the historic and charming Alfama district of Lisbon. it has easy access to some of the highlights of old Lisbon. The young and enthusiastic staff offer exceptionally friendly service. The hotel is stylishly constructed in the ruins of an old bakery. cons: The pokey ‚ÄòMansard‚Äô room is hugely overpriced at $419 AU per night with a ‚Äògoal-cell‚Äô window without a view. There is only daylight through the top quarter of the window. you have to take two steps up from the floor to see over the blank parapet wall. This outrageous charge does not include breakfast. we have travelled around the world and have never been ‚Äòscammed‚Äô so outrageously.. The architecture only ‚Äòworks‚Äô for the superior rooms with a view.
pros: location cons: small room noisy air conditioner no view pricey

pros: good view from terrace bar cons: service appalling. had to wait excessive amount of time to be served and even though reminded the waiter we still weren‚Äôt served our entire order on first night. subsequent visits no better

pros: Breakfast: great selection of hot and cold options
Room: clean and with natural light throughout the day
Pool: next to the bar and restaurant
Bar: nice relaxing quiet environment
Reception staff: Couldn't be more helpful kind and approachable. They all went above and beyond to find us bookings and recommendations for restaurants and spa treatments. cons: Bar and restaurant staff: Although helpful most of the time we did get the impression that sometimes they didn't want to serve us. The orders were also either wrong or things were missing from the orders and most of them time the service was very slow. I would recommend making sure you repeat the order a few times or make sure they write the orders down. 
Pool: The pool was right next to restaurant tables and there were no lounger area next to the pool so you have to walk past people having a quit intimate sophisticated lunch when going in and out of the pool. There were 4 loungers available but they were downstairs and not close to the pool which forced us to sit on restaurant chairs and sofas to sunbathe. I think the pool area needs to be redesigned as the lay out made the experience uncomfortable most of the time we were there.

pros: pool bar area view location cons: rooms were tiny! hardly any storage for a couple. some staff friendly and some were painfully slow and rude. had to ask for the room to be cleaned multiple times

pros: pretty made most of its space cons: the parking is inconvenient & FAR! valet was never available to help you had to walk a ways and wait on a line to get your car. The hotel does not show you the outside bec it is located down what seems to be a residential back alley way.

pros: Location Staff cons: The room is extremally tiny.
no space for luggage. the only tiny closet is totally useless because of the three(!) huge bath robes take all space in it. Bathroom has no shelves or hooks for toiletries or even towels.

pros: Pleasant day staff. Great location cons: Night staffs was very slow (no one was at the desk when I arrived at 10pm) and didn‚Äôt pick up reception phone. No milk in the room for coffee. Would have expected
A Nespresso machine and more snacks for this price. Also
A bigger room. It was tiny.

pros: The deck of the hotel gave you the opportunity to relax in the sun. Location is great to walk around and see most of Lisbon. Room was fine for what we paid. cons: The whole reason we booked this hotel was for the pool. The pool was closed and no communication on that before arrival. It was disappointing. They also had to move us hotels to their other location the first night which was annoying.

pros: The manager was extremely helpful after we found that our reservation had been cancelled without notification cons: The per son on desk duty when we arrived for a 5 night stay to find that someone (NOT US)had cancelled our reservation was not helpful until we really pushed.

pros: Liked the deck to the hotel. We wanted somewhere relaxing to sit and relax in the sun in btw exploring the city so that was great. The hotel staff was accommodating and helpful. Overall good ambiance and vibe of the hotel especially for the price point. cons: The rooms are not sound proofed to the hallway. We could hear all sounds in the morning which made it tough for us to sleep.  We had an issue with our reservation getting switched to the other memmo and confusion.  The staff was accommodating (not their fault of renovations) but I had asked twice if the pool was open during our stay and it was confirmed twice. It was empty and closed when we got there which was disappointing given that was the main reason i booked the hotel.
pros: Absolutely beautiful property and in walking distance of so many great sites. Rooftop bar was great with amazing views of the city! Will definitely be back! cons:

pros: This was the perfect starting point for an incredible trip to Portugal. Beautiful rooms and facilities stunning pool and deck wonderful breakfast and a really great walking tour to get you oriented. cons:
pros: The staff and the design of the hotel. cons: Nothing
pros: The staff were exceptional. Breakfast was fab too. cons: The glass panels in the bathroom.

pros: Beautiful view and wonderful staff-especially Pedro -the GM ! Free walking tour offered which was excellent! cons: The rooms are very small but clean -Very confusing & hard to find entrance to hotel -the hotel sent an email of directions the day after I was already there( not helpful) No parking if you‚Äôre driving but they do park your car off site . In Lisbon we ended up using Uber or Taxis
pros: the location and view cons: the room felt very enclosed which is fine for one night. The music was very irritating.

No recomiendo acercarse a la entrada dado que est√° en una calle de dificil acceso estrecha y en curva. Es mejor dejarlo en un parking cercano e ir luego andando.

pros: Piscina de bordas infinitas em frente ao melhor e mais tradicional bairro de Lisboa cozinha e cocktails impec√°veis staff muito simp√°tico. Uma estadia 5 estrelas cons:

pros: Apesar de n√£o ter muita variedade de produtos a qualidade dos mesmos era boa lamento s√≥ n√£o ter nenhum funcion√°rio a servir pelo menos os caf√©s cons: acho que para o pre√ßo que se paga por noite os produtos do mini-bar deveriam estar inclu√≠dos lamento s√≥ o facto de no ato da reserva mencionar que o hotel tinha estacionamento e quando cheguei verifiquei que o estacionamento seria num parque a 500m ou 800m a p√© e com um custo acrescido de 15‚Ç¨
pros: Excelente arquitetura do hotel. Quartos com vista linda da cidade. Caf√© da manh√£ muito bom. cons: N√£o consegui deixar o quarto na temperatura desejada. Ficou frio.

pros: Las vistas desde la terraza y la decoraci√≥n del hotel. cons: Las habitaciones son muy peque√±as y la relaci√≥n calidad precio.
