Always welcomed us when we returned and got the elevator as soon as he saw us. The room was beautiful. The bed was perfect and the AC worked well. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it. cons: There is really nothing to complain about the hotel during our week stay.

pros: As soon as we stepped in to the hotel we noticed the lovely calming scent. You will smell this through the whole hotel. Orange type of fragrance and it is so nice. 
Staff was really lovely and helpful. Room is amazing! Amazing bed bathroom enough space. Rooftop is nice place to chill and order drinks and food. cons:
pros: Restaurant cons: A bit far from the center.
pros: The interior decoration and the location ! cons: Breakfast could be better !!

pros: Hotel is beautiful lovely finishing touches. One of the nicest places I‚Äôve stayed. cons: Staff were a little slow at getting drinks and serving but I think it was their laid back nature that‚Äôs my only fault.

pros: Breakfast was the winner at this hotel. So many selections and made to order hot items. Rooms were nice too. Quiet and in a good spot of the city. Away from the busy location but 10 to 20 min walk to anywhere. cons:

pros: our room was beautiful large and very clean
exceptionally large selection at breakfast
we spent our 25th wedding anniversary in Lisbon and were surprised by the attentive hotel staff with a small cake and sparkling wine in our room - we enjoyed that very much thank you! cons:

pros: The view the bar at the terrace the room decoration the quieter location the comfort of the bed. cons: The service was very bad. Staff from the reception was not very friendly and at the bar they were a little bit nicer but not enough for a 4* hotel. As a solo traveler I didn't feel much welcomed.

pros: Very stylish hotel.
The room was big the bed very comfortable
great breakfast
very helpful staff. cons: nothing

pros: The hotel was very good and the staff were excellent. The room was clean spacious and very comfortable with an excellent bathroom shower etc. Breakfasts were first class. cons: There were no toilet facilities at lobby level. The nearest were on the third floor. Members of the public could use the small but excellent roof top bar which on one occasion denied us access as it was full.
pros: beautiful decor and big room cons: nothing

pros: Great location.
Friendly staff.
Lovely room.
Reception always smells great.
Lovely touch with complimentary sweets and cakes in reception.

overall a great hotel cons: You are only given a bottle per guest of compliment water on your first day of arrival in your room all other days it is to be paid for.

When we reported an issue with the coffee machine in our room to reception it was never resolved.

The roof top bar had private functions which meant it wasn‚Äôt always available to hotel guests.
pros: the decor is so charming cons: our roller shade was broken and the bolster pillow had a huge rip in it
pros: Nice hotel with pretty decor. The location is the best part it's not far from anything but not in the middle of all the touristy and crowded streets. cons: NA
pros:  cons: Wish the upstairs bar area stayed open much later. The only reason I booked this particular place was to enjoy a drink on the patio and it was completely full the whole time.
pros: The staff was really friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious and we loved interior as well as the location. Make sure you go have a drink at the rooftop bar at sunset! cons:
pros: Staff was so accommodating room was comfortable clean quiet and charming. Location very central. Rooftop bar was amazing! cons: No complaints we loved it!
pros: trendy and boutique hotel lovely atmosphere x cons: nothing

pros: This is an extremely clean and beautiful location situated in central Lisbon. The staff is most courteous the food is amazing and this will be our go-to hotel from now on during our stays in Lisbon. 

During our stay it was our son‚Äôs birthday and they brought up to the room a bottle of champagne and a cake. It was a very nice gesture. cons: N/A

pros: Absolutely beautiful hotel - I am obsessed with azulejos (blue tiles) so this was perfect for me.
Gorgeous reception rooms and huge bedroom with beautiful bathroom.
Very close to a major metro station and as it happened the terminus for the sightseeing buses which was extremely handy.
Very friendly staff.
Great breakfast and they even provided a little birthday cake for me on my special day.
Great value for money.
Loved it here - will return without doubt. cons: A long walk from the centre but we knew this already so that didn't bother us at all.

pros: Buffet breakfast was outstanding. Our deluxe room was very nice including extremely comfortable bed very effective 
and quiet aircon good coffee maker plenty of clothes hanging space. We were on floor level 9 which was quiet at all times. The staff were great wherever we had contact with them and always keen to help. cons: Although the standard and selection of the food at breakfast were superb and the staff were really good some improvements could be made to the organisation such as where extra crockery and cutlery are located and advising guests on entry about the procedure. We were disappointed to find that the rooftop bar closed at 10.00 pm (Saturday). The hotel is well located for the park the metro and bus routes but a bit of a distance from the main tourist attractions although some people may prefer that.

pros: Great location with friendly and attentive staff spacious rooms and a beautiful roof top bar! We didn't eat at the hotel but drinks were lovely and not too expensive. The view from the roof top bar was stunning and the rooms were clean spacious and a lovely interior. Staff were extremely helpful particularly one of the door men (we didn't catch his name) who gave excellent recommendations of things to do in the city guided us to the bus stop and helped us find the most direct route on public transport. Excellent stay and would rebook if back in Lisbon. cons: Our only criticism of the hotel would be that the roof top bar was closed 2/4 days we were there due to it being booked out externally for events. Not a huge issue as lots of other beautiful roof tops in the city and plenty to do during the day but would be nice if hotel guests got priority!
pros: Lovely hotel with extreamly friendly and helpfull staff. And we loved the breakfast! cons:

pros: Very pretty clean hotel.  Bar on top had fabulous view and the restaurant in the lobby was very charming and food very good.  The room had thoughtful touches and the bathroom amenities were of a very good quality. cons: Garage was very tricky to get to but that is just because of the position of the building.  Also it was odd to have the WC two floors up from the restaurant.
pros: friendliness of staff cons: no take out option from the restaurant although you can get room service
pros: Best service beautiful hotel incredible location cons:
pros: This hotel has all the extras! Such a fabulous rooftop bar great breakfast staff were very friendly. We really enjoyed our stay! cons:
pros: Absolutely loved our stay the rooms are gorgeous the views from the rooftop bar are amazing. The staff were also lovely. No complaints about the hotel. cons:
pros: The Staff were friendly and very helpful  amazing breakfast. Very clean room. cons:

pros: The most stunning hotel
Amazing location
The friendliest staff 
Amazing customer service
Great food and the ROOFTOP!!!! Gorgeous!
Rooms are clean fresh and chic cons:
pros: the hotel was so clean and even had a beautiful scent as you entered cons: no faults

pros: Lovely decor throughout. Spotless. Friendly & helpful staff at all levels with excellent recommendations for dining & sightseeing. Thank you Rodrigez. Away from the hustle & bustle of the old town but only a 10 minute 5euro taxi ride away. Comfy & quiet rooms with all you need for a good stay. Eating lunch or having evening drinks on the rooftop terrace were memorable. Highly recommend staying here. cons: Breakfast seemed expensive. We have smaller appetites so ate in a local bakery. The roof terrace was a little smaller than expected so be prepared for a short wait at busy times. Its worth it. Service was a bit slow but cocktails were excellent
pros: very friendly room was lovely cons:
pros: loved the terrace bar and the staff were so friendly! cons: nothing
pros: Design rooftop terrace cons: on our arrival the girl was not helpful at all we were very disappointed
pros: Fantastic breakfast. Nice bar area. Room was clean and spacious. Bonus of a bath as well as shower. Helpful staff. Would recommend this hotel cons: -
pros: The interior is stunning!! The stuff is very kind a really nice place to be. Loved the breakfast. cons:
pros: roof terrace friendly staff good quality suite breakfast. cons: rooms let in  a little too much light at night

pros: Everything. From professional friendly staff to the beautiful room and public space design.
The bed is so comfortable that it makes you lazy. cons:
pros: Good bathroom and superb bed cons: View from room was limited but not without some effort by hotel to provide some greenery
pros: Beautiful hotel with amazing staff! cons:
pros: Lovely clean hotel with great rooftop bar cons: A little out of the centre but a pleasent 20 mins walk
pros: Very clean and nice siazed room. Staff were all great and helpful. Will recommend this hotel to others traveling to Portugal. cons:

pros: the rooms were clean and kept in good shape. staff was friendly. cons: we booked it mainly because of the rooftop bar and the view (after all this is what they are advertising it with). after arriving we found out that the rooftop was closed due to a private event and we couldn‚Äôt access it. therefore in hindsight we could have booked a much cheaper but equally clean room further downtown. 
it was not worth the money if the USP is not accessible.

pros: I love the decor of this hotel as well as my room which was beautiful.  The hotel breakfast as divine!  Truly a treat to stay there. cons: Nothing they can control but there is construction next door which did start early and was a bit loud one morning.
pros: Very friendly staff who made every effort to please. cons: Outside construction was a disturbance.
pros: One of the most friendliest hotel staff i got to meet. This is coming from an avid world traveler who stayed in many many hotels. cons:

pros: Very clean exceptional breakfast for the most part very friendly staff. Antonio at the lobby was specially helpful and anxious to help. cons: Was charged room service for an item I requested that I was previously given to understand there would be no charge. At checkout it was explained that had I requested through Reception rather than Room Service there would have been no charge. Given that this was not clarified before I believe the charge should have been waived.
pros: Location comfy bed helpful staff. cons: Building works going on in a neighbouring property roof terrace was a 'smoking corner'.
pros: Very smart decor. Bedroom and bathroom very nice cons:
pros: Great Hotel. Friendly staff. Beautiful room. Great breakfast.  Will book again when visiting Lisbon cons:
pros: rooftop bar nice rooms tastefully furnished cons:
pros: staff friendly hotel amazing location perfect cons: nothing
pros: Basically everything was great. From the moment we arrived to when we checked out. cons: The sound from the plumbing was a bit too loud for my taste.
pros: The Hotel was lovely but more than that the staff was the best absolutely brilliant service friendly helpful  and polite. cons:

pros: Good stay with easy access to the airport and the spectacles. The inside of the hotel is very impressive traditional portugeese design inclusive the restaurant rooms and the lobby. The breakfast is varied and nice the waitress and the head of the room are kindly and friendly. cons: The housekeeping staff work without paying attention and logic.

pros: The hotel looks amazing. I really liked the little cakes on arrival. 
The bed is really comfy and the heating wasn't too much (we stayed in February). The bathroom is huge and the shower is amazing. We didn't have breakfast but I did see it and there was a wide variety. The terrace is lovely... smaller than I thought from the photos but it is really nice up there. cons: There's only a mirror in the bathroom so only one person can get ready at a time. There are skinny mirrors on the doors but you can't really do your makeup in them. The hotel is a bt out the way from the 'main' area but we knew that when we booked it.

pros: Staff was amazing always gentle nice and thoughtful! Food was amazing they chef is brilliant. Also breakfast is really good! cons: We can‚Äôt say anything we dislikes only thing was that the rooftop bar was closed but it‚Äôs winter so it‚Äôs not their fault at all! As I said great hotel!

pros: Great hotel - friendly staff and service nice rooms. Would definitely stay again.
The breakfast buffet was awesome. cons:

pros: The Suite was perfect. Clean spacious stylish and all round a perfect experience.
The staff was beyond welcoming and helpful. I'm so impressed with this hotel I want to go back already. Definitely stay with them. cons: We loved everything.
pros: The temperature of the room was incredible. cons: Nothing in particular.
pros: We enjoyed the design atmosphere extremely friendly staff. Favorite location. Can‚Äôt wait to comeback here in March. cons: It was a little bit dirty and seemed like there was too much dust.
pros: Didn‚Äôt have breakfast got good breakfast outside much cheaper cons: More English speaking TV channels

pros: The design. I absolutely loved the decor and how the hotel was setup. Very Portuguese but modern. cons: If I had to make one suggestion it would be to broaden a bit the restaurant/bar menu to include more mainstream choices.
pros:  cons: Breakfast was good but expensive and hot dishes were mediocre.
pros: Rooftop bar has amazing views cons:
pros: We really enjoyed our stay at H10 Duque de Loule! the location was great the staff was amazing and everything exceeded our expectations. cons: Everything was perfect!

pros: Clean Cozy Kind staffs (except only one staff) cons: Room size is not enough  a little bit frustrated
Location is far from the main place for tourist 
Breakfast is so expensive for the quality 

Here's one thing that I disappointed. There's one staff  Vanessa. I met her when I had a breakfast. When I ordered she showed up her bad feelings. She looked like the busiest person in the world. When I asked something to her she didn't care about me at all. That's why I have a bad feeling about this hotel.
pros: decor cons:

pros: The room was excellent after a free upgrade. The breakfast was truly fabulous in terms of variety and quality. The location is a bit far to reach the main tourist attractions on foot but great for transport connections. cons:
pros: Clean and functional cons: Too expensive for the facility provided.

pros: Beautiful rooftop bar
Good selection at breakfast
Aesthetically very beautifully decorated
About 50% of the staff were nice cons: Due to a technical issue we were unable to have the room we had paid for for the whole stay (we booked and paid 9 months in advance) we were downgraded and only found out about this when we arrived (despite receiving multiple confirmations by email previously). The staff did comp breakfast offer to refund the difference and we had the room we had booked for the second night of our 2 night stay but it was very stressful and some of the staff we dealt with were very unhelpful. 
Cot provided was not very good (sheets on it too small travel cot that kept folding in on itself at one end - not ideal). 
Spotlights outside windows and insufficient curtains / blinds so the room was not dark at night. 
Breakfast service was terrible cold food and took a long time to get hot drinks.

pros: The hotel is lovely and in a good area. We had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant and the food was excellent.
We had a beautiful Deluxe Double Room. Very happy when we saw we were on the top floor. That was a big mistake. cons: Our room was on the top floor which at first we thought was nice but also on the top floor is the rooftop terrace bar. Our room was so NOISY. On our first night there was a private function going on and the noise was terrible. Then you have the noise of all the people leaving walking straight past your door talking very loudly and continuing to be very loud whilst they waited for the lift. Then after that you have the crash and banging of the staff as they clean up and they were also very loudly talking as they were leaving. This then happened again on the next two nights of our stay when guests were using the terrace. We didn‚Äôt expect to pay approx ‚Ç¨800 for 3 nights and not be able to get to sleep before midnight because of the noise. Not a good idea to have the guest rooms right next to the roof top bar.

pros: Beautiful interior cons: We booked a family room because we were traveling with two small kids. I sent a message in advance that we needed two rooms together but in the end they gave us two separate rooms and far from each other which was very inconvenient and we did not get enough sleep at all that night so we had to go to the children through the corridor. When checking out they calculated an additional breakfast for children although it was already included in the price of the room. The cost of children's breakfast on the booking website is 15 but they charged us 20 since a different price was written on the hotel website. In general we were not satisfied the staff did not try to help

pros: The property is very nice. Lovely lobby and rooftop bar. cons: My room was on a floor under the lobby and felt like a basement. The room stayed pretty warm even with AC turned down as low as allowed.

pros: 1. The staff at the reception are very nice and helpful.. they helped us at managing our stay in the city. 
2. The shower pressure is very strong which is satisfying after long walks in the city. cons: 1. The most annoying part that really made my stay uncomfortable was the black mold in the shower area. It was completely uncomfortable to use the shower with noticeable molds in the shower head and the walls. This has to be continuously maintained as it affects overall health. 
2. During our 4 nights stay there was only one elevator that worked the other one was under maintenance for the whole time.. i never seen an elevator that takes this long to fix! Imagine the pressure having one lift
3. The hairdryer was very sticky and dirty i don‚Äôt think it has ever been cleaned .. 
4. Our window was next to a very busy bar we hear the shouts and the noise while they watch football matches üòÖ 
5. The lobby area is always hot and not air-conditioned.

pros: It was very clean cons: The hotel staff weren‚Äôt that friendly and the breakfast dining staff were horrible.  They didn‚Äôt greet you when we came down for breakfast.  They only said ‚Äúroom number? ‚Äú. Service was very slow when ordering from the menu and they were still putting things out when the dining room opened.  They had the same things every morning so was very boring. The best part was the cleaning.  Room was cleaned nicely every day.  One of the main reason we booked the hotel was for the rooftop bar and it was closed for renovations. Probably would not have booked if knew this ahead of time.
pros: Pleasant stay didn‚Äôt quite live up to its rating. cons:

pros: I like the general atmosphere of the hotel. It was for me the second time that I stayed in this hotel. As I travel for business I'm "easy" person. Sleeping taking a taxi having breakfast checking out. For me the hotel lies at a perfect place. cons: Second time I stay in this hotel. Last time it took a while to check out. Now it took some time again to check-in and out. In a business travel form it should be more fluent. For example receiving the invoice already in the night instead of waiting at the desk.

pros: The style of the hotel is very special cons: The bedspread was marked. The sink was leaking water and the hotel staff refused to change our room so we had to wait until the next morning. It's true that they fixed the sink the next day but I still can't understand why they refused to change our room when the hotel wasn't fully booked. Oh and we didn't receive any apologies or compensation.

pros: The bed and shower were great. Front Desk stafff was very kind as well and answered all of our questions. Location is good but it is a 25-30 minute walk to the city centre. cons: We were not informed prior to our stay that the rooftop bar was closed due to renovations for the whole 2024 winter season and it was one of the main reasons we stayed at the hotel. Additionally one of the biggest issues is that you can hear everything from the room next door from people going to the restroom to snoring and talking.

pros: Great decor. cons: Wifi doesn't support calls so do not book this hotel if you need to be working from your room. No irons so - again - if you're here for work it's not quite the place to be. Make sure to ask if the rooftop - the main banner image on the website and a cited amenity - is actually open. We booked for that reason only to arrive and find out it was closed for renovation.

pros: Design is very stylish.   Very nice in a local Portuguese retro style. cons: Window in our room was broke.

Next day the lighting in the bathroom was partly broke and had to be repaired.
We in particular reserved a table for dinner in the Portoguese restaurant of the hotel in the morning at the reception.
When we wanted to eat in the evening there was no reservation.

Although the intererial design of the hotel is really nice and - since it is obviously a very old building - the outer walls of the house are almost 50cm thick and solid the building internally obviously underwent a complete make over. As a result the wall are extremely thin and over no privacy with respect to guests from the neighbouring room. Normal conversation from that room could be heard in detail luckily in a language we did not understand dto. for the modest sound of an alarm clock which woke us up together with the sleeper next door and hammering against the wall during the night from our room neighbour complaining that my husband was snoring.

All that is of course unacceptable for a freshly renovated 4-star hotel..

pros: V comfortable bed great views nice bathroom cons: Room was nestled between groups of loud people (two different groups - which staff weren't v helpful with). No kettle. Restaurant food nice but empty restaurant and yet they put the only other couple right next to us.

pros: Nice staff comfortable foyer good beds lovely tiled bathroom  clean and friendly cons: Roof terrace not open! This should have been clearly stated on the website.  We specifically chose this hotel because of the roof terrace. Also soundproofing is not great between rooms.

pros: The property looks gorgeous! The location is great and the reception staff were friendly and useful. cons: There was a leak in our bathroom above the shower. We ordered breakfast in the room through room service. They forgot half of the things that were listed on their menu (cold cuts cheeses). But worst part was the fact that they advertised fresh orange juice and they sent up one that clearly came out of a box. When we called them to inform of the error they lied and insisted it was freshly squeezed that morning. Eventually they sent up freshly squeezed orange juice and you could see the difference even in color. It‚Äôs disappointing when people cannot admit their mistakes and they are trying to insult your intelligence. They offer you free coffee & tea  in the room but no water for the coffee machine (a bit ridiculous). Housekeeping came into our room without knocking we were lucky that both of us were fully dressed by that point. I will go back to Lisbon but I will not be staying at this property again.
pros: Room was very clean and pleasant.  The bathroom was very nice. Very comfy room bed etc. cons: The rooftop was closed. No pool.  The location wasn't THAT close to the main tourist area downtown.

pros: Lovely hotel great staff cons: They need soundproofing! It was uncomfortable having to hear the conversation of the couple in the next room even worse with the couple on the other side when they went to bed!

pros: Location. cons: The restaurant was unavailable on the Sunday night due to a private party booking.  Staff should have informed me of this event as part of the booking process.  This meant the only option was to order some snacks in the bar area but most of this area was shut off due to the party.  The snacks were cold the service poor and the area to eat was unavailable due to the private party booking.

pros: Staff were friendly and the welcome drink was a nice touch. cons: There was a lot of mould in the shower so it didn‚Äôt feel clean. Not many good restaurants/bars in the area so had to keep getting a taxi into town. Rooftop bar in the hotel was closed for refurbishments which was one of the reasons we booked so would have been good to know that was happening when booking. Our room was directly opposite the window of a bar where people could easily stare in so it didn‚Äôt feel relaxing sitting in the window seat either and mainly had to have the curtains shut. There was also a power cut on the last night whilst we were getting ready for dinner which was inconvenient.

pros: Bathroom at least spacious. cons: The first room we had had a broken sink (clogged) and a broken TV by which I mean remote didn‚Äôt work so we couldn‚Äôt turn the TV off. The lady who checked us in didn‚Äôt even bother to ask whether we like a bathtub or a walk-in shower. Nevertheless she gave us a room with a bathtub that was not even properly cleaned. You can clearly see yellow stains on the tub. By the way this is a four star hotel.

pros: Terrible breakfast. No whole milk for cereal and scrambled eggs and bacon combo poor two half strips of bacon and hard eggs that needed to be cut with a knife. Good location near elegant Liberdade area. cons: I stayed twice first for over a week then returned for one night. On the first stay room was fairly large. On return the holel gave me a tiny room where the bed was 2 feet from the wall. It has an awkward l-shape where most of the room was a corridor. Folks who book should be careful not to get one of these tiny rooms.
pros: Great location close to the city center cons: Room was very small. No early check in.
pros: Comfortable bedroom cons: Location and view and facilities not matching such a high price.

pros: The hotel itself is bright and beautifully designed. The staff is lovely upon check in--offered free champagne/sparkling wine and treats when we arrived which was very nice! Buffet breakfast has a great selection and even includes bottomless sparkling wine which I thought was great for the price! cons: We were staying at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary. Upon check-in the room we were given was smaller (and more disappointing in terms of layout/design) than the room we had initially booked online--this wasn't going to ruin our stay but when we got to our room the A/C unit was not working properly and our room was very hot (it was 85F and humid outside so we would have liked a room to be able to cool down in). Upon letting the front desk know about the A/C they offered to have someone come up and take a look. After going out to dinner and coming back to the room the A/C unit seemed to be working and our room was much cooler (yay!). The hotel had a bottle of sparkling wine delivered to our room for our anniversary (very kind!) but we decided we wanted to wait to drink it a different night since we were very tired when we arrived on our first day -- when we left to go out and explore the city the day the cleaning crew came and removed the brand new (completely unopened) bottle from our room. When we asked the hotel about what happened to our sparkling wine no one could give us a clear answer. Overall the hotel itself was beautiful but not worth the value.
pros: Prefer H10 Seville which we came from. cons: Rooms need updating.
pros: Location cons: My room  no view it was like being in a dungeon  constant noise all night
pros:  cons: Totally overpriced for almost 350 euro a night i‚Äôve got the worst service I could ever imagine. Definitely overrated as well this hotel does not worth a four-star title AT ALL.
pros:  cons: Not customer-friendly only interested in making a quick buck
pros:  cons: To be honest a bit disappointed comparing the price. Reception ladies never smile the hair dryer is different to handle due to the short wire. Room is pretty small.
pros: Location comfort breakfast & service. cons: Met expectations.
pros: The breakfast bar! cons: The terrace was closed for private events

pros: The location and the staff cons: I booked this restaurant to enjoy the scenic view but there was private events the two nights I was there and never got to enjoy it. Also very noisy through the late hours and early morning. It is not as fresh looking as I‚Äôm the photos. It‚Äôs worn needs updating

pros: Beautiful room good bathroom cons: The rooftop bar (one of the hotels key selling points) was closed for a private event on Saturday night. 

I don‚Äôt think this was reasonable as the hotel was full of guests who wanted to use this facility. 

If this happens I believe guests should be given prior warning (so they can choose whether to stay or not) or a discount on rate offered.

pros: lovely room spacious with a comfortable. bed.  We stayed on valentines night and guests were left a rose and chocolate on the bed which was a very nice touch. cons: The hotel. were fitting new carpets and the work started at 8am in the morning.  The hotel staff sought to blame it on the two building sites next to the hotel but it was. clear the noise was coming from inside the building. It looks like the. building works next. to the hotel will be going on for some time and I said to hotel staff that. they should make guests aware in advance there may be noise and disruption from the sites one of which is literally next door.
pros: The rooms were clean. cons: Walls are very thin so noisy and you can hear people in the hallway and rooms next to you.

pros: Good clean very nice staff cons: Very loud the room is not soundproof bad smell in the holway (like fish)
Not VFM.
pros:  cons: Most staff need to be trained to primarily communicate in better English and to secondly be able to deal with emergencies in a professional manner.

pros: -The staff were very helpful and professional.
-Breakfast was amazing.
-Design and decorations were very good. cons: -internet speed was terrible the whole 6 days of our stay. we could hardly open an email or download an image (Download 6mbps and download 4)
-bathroom ventelation was not working
pros: Interior cons: Staff service! Service is at a very poor level!!! Ruined vacation ü§¨üò° we moved to another hotel.  I do not recommend this hotel!!!
pros: location cons: the room was not clean enough. I made reservation half a year ago but got the room with no view on the ground floor.

pros: It was nice to be greeted with little pastries in the lobby and either cava or water. cons: Didn't have the breakfast as there were no options for continental breakfast.  You had to have a buffet breakfast.
The superior room we stayed in was disappointing!  It was very stark in its furnishings and looked very different from the photos!!
The room was right by the roof terrace so it was noisy with a queue of people outside waiting to go on the terrace.

pros: The hotel is very well located and bright. The staff are very helpful. The room 709 was comfortable and clean. cons: At the time of our stay much construction work is being completed outside the hotel to the back. Our room 709 I could hear drilling grinding and hammering in the morning.

pros: The quality of the breakfast was very good but could take up to 30 minutes to get eggs to order the only way to get hot food. cons: We lost 1/2 day touring Lisbon due to hotel issues. The front desk was so slow and incompetent we spent over 4 hours checking in trying to get checkin documents and checking out. They collected  payment upon checkin but did not record. I was only able to leave without paying again by producing credit card receipt that they made copy of.  I did end up paying city tax twice to get out. After 1st night we were told to pack our bags to change rooms because front desk put us in wrong room. I traveled for 30 years on business frequently and this is the worst front desk I have experienced. I almost never comment on stays. I have to believe Lisbon has better hotel options for the amount H10 charges.

pros: nice room cons: from the 3 days we had a broken shower for 2 days and cold water for two days. when we reported this and wanted to make a complain we didn‚Äôt receive a solution but we received the comment that we can talk to the manager. when checking out the manager spoke with us on the phone and told us in a very unfriendly way that we need to pay our bill or else they will call the police.

pros: Beautiful decorated rooms  reception area and lounge area. cons: Ask 2 days in a row to have a bulb replaced in our bathroom. It was never replaced b4 we left. Served drinks in extremely dirty glasses at the bar lobby area.
pros: The room was good but would have liked a better view. It looked over a side street. Breakfast good. Convenient location. The staff was polite and very helpful. cons: A room with a better view.
pros: Wonderful and very accommodating staff. Exceptional room. cons:

pros: Beautiful restored hotel. Rooms look over the square with art nouveau balconies. The included restaurant breakfast was so elegant and made to order. Lovely! Early stop on 28 tram fur a tour of the city. cons: Love it
pros: Everything was perfect! cons: Nothing!

pros: A wonderful art nouveau building full of historical references and with stylish rooms. Exceptionally friendly staff. Rich variety of healthy food for breakfast. We would like to return here. cons:
pros: Location style service personnel cons: Room beautiful but without a closet. Still manageable but a closet would be preferable.

pros: Really nice and comfortable rooms especially the bed! The bathrooms were large and modern. The team working at the hotel went above and beyond to help. The breakfast included was delicious and had lots of options! cons:
pros: Reception Staff were fantastic! Knowledgeable welcoming friendly and efficient. cons:
pros: Everything cons:

pros: Stylish comfortable excellent hotel in a quirky building a little like the Flatiron in New York. Great location just outside the main centre of Lisbon all very walkable. On the famous 28 tram route cons: Nothing
pros: I loved everything about my stay here. The staff were warm welcoming and made it feel like a home away from home. Given that the stay was over Christmas it was truly appreciated. cons:
pros: Fantastic and very friendly staff excellent room design and perfect details in the stay great restaurant and tasty breakfast..definitely going back again! cons:
pros: Everything cons: Nothing
pros: Location cons:

pros: Had a lovely stay for my birthday with my partner. We were greeted by Andr√© and was sat down with a welcome drink and were given recommendations on what to do and see whilst we were there. We also got a free upgrade and were given sparkling wine for my birthday. Unfortunately we had to swap rooms as the aircon had an issue but they were exceptional in dealing with this. One of the best hotel experiences we have ever had. Would highly recommend! cons: Nothing to note. Wish we could have stayed longer.
pros: Modern lovely hotel. Room was small but perfectly formed with nice shower room. cons: Location is nice enough close enough to the main sites but the square it sits on is a bit rough.

pros: We had an amazing 3 night stay at 1908. Breakfast was delicious with great selection. The restaurant within the hotel was also very good. The location was just what we wanted not far from the city centre and we loved everything about this hotel. The staff were exceptional nothing was too much trouble and they went above and beyond to meet our needs. Would definitely stay here again! cons: Nothing.
pros: Staff super friendly and helpful breakfast excellent room very clean with the confrortable bed. cons:
pros: Friendly staff easy check in held our luggage sine we arrived early awesome included breakfast. cons: Robes in room too small. Full size bed felt small.

pros: Great room on the corner of the building.  Superb shower too :)

Very nice breakfast & excellent & very helpful staff cons:

pros: The hotel was modern and stylish in a beautiful historic building with lots of old school charm.

The Infame restaurant was better than any other we tried in Lisbon and the breakfast was perfect. But most of all we want to mention how amazing the staff were. The manager Andre helped us to arrange a day trip out with one of the hotel‚Äôs recommended local guides Antoinne. We would highly recommend doing this as it helps you to explore the area around Lisbon including the coastline and Sintra. cons: The location is a little secondary and at first glance appears slightly down at heel but it is well located next to a nice square and the city centre is walking distance or a short cheap taxi.
pros: Staff cons:
pros: Everything cons:
pros: Great breakfast great staff clean and beautiful room cons:

pros: hHospitality was amazing. If you want to enjoy something stylish and historical this hotel for you!
Exceptional breakfast btw cons:
pros: Everything was nice but especially the staff..so kind and helpful. The girls at reception were the best I‚Äôve come across! cons:
pros: The staff was very friendly giving us welcome drinks and helping us out immediately upon arrival. The room had a great vibe and amazing views! cons:
pros: Great property made even better by fantastic staff. cons:
pros: Andre made our stay memorable. cons:
pros: The staff could not have been more helpful. Really added to the pleasure of the trip..  Great breakfast included. cons:

pros: An absolutely fabulous experience
Superb group of colleagues operating this lovely hotel They all contributed to male our visit something that we will remember for ever cons: nothing
pros: Great location with the city center a 10 min walk away or a 2 min walk to the metro station. Amazing and really helpful staff which really helped us feel at home. cons: Nothing
pros: Superb accommodation. Outstanding staff attention to detail. cons: Great rooms excellent breakfast and perfect location.

pros: Friendly staff and a well-appointed room. Close to some lovely restaurants and shops away from touristy areas. cons: Uber drivers may ask you to walk across to the other side of the main road for pickup and drop off but it was not a big concern for us.

pros: Lovely restored hotel. Excellent food in restaurants and very helpful staff. Close to tourist transport hub including no 28 tram. cons: Surrounding streets don‚Äôt match the ambience of the hotel.
pros: Excellent breakfast and location. Staff service outstanding cons:

pros: Location staff Andre in particular  so helpful
 Breakfast decor cons: Nothing
pros: Ok for a short stay cons: Surrounding atmosphere

pros: I like it that they made the place look
very interesting. We find it charming and i do appreciate the staff who were all genuinely attentive and always offering services with a ready smile. The bed is comfortable the sheets fresh the little details like slippers post cards and dnd signs leave a smile on our faces. We are very happy with the food and this is the only hotel that gave us complimentary wine welcome drinks and 10% discount at Infame. Andre‚Äôs welcome made so much difference by making us feel at home. The decor has it‚Äôs own charm and it didn‚Äôt disappoint as we were truly excited with what we saw in the reviews plus the virtual tour. Will definitely recommend to others. cons: The location didn‚Äôt feel safe. That‚Äôs the only downside.

pros: The hotel interior was perfect
Friendly staff all know English perfectly
The location was great cons: The room was small
pros: Great building lovely staff. Love the history. cons: Our room rate wasn‚Äôt competitive- our fault for not shopping around.
pros: Shower pressure quiet room breakfast. cons: Price
pros: Manager Andre Pinto cons:
pros: Location great cons:

pros: Excellent hotel where the staff were extremely helpful and friendly the valet parking worked perfectly Nice welcome and departure drinks  good buffet breakfast and large comfortable rooms .

Location is good for exploring Lisbon   very easy straight drive from airport trams and metro easily walkable. Area itself is a little down market  but lively and busy cons: Nothing really  but the bread and rolls selection for breakfast could have been better.

pros: The front desk staff were super charming and very helpful from check-in to check-out. My room (307) overlooking the square was the perfect size for the solo traveller. Very well equipped and comfortable. Great location for walking into central Lisbon or hopping onto the metro. cons: There wasn‚Äôt anything really negative to say.
pros: Great breakfast for all tastes from healthy granola to bacon and eggs. Very quiet despite being in a noisy area. Staff very helpful and friendly. cons:

pros: Breakfasts were excellent huge variety from buffet selection. Cooked items eggs/bacon etc also available as standard. Staff always friendly attentive and helpful. Stayed 5 nights in room 211 on second floor generously sized comfortable bed large bathroom with lots of thoughtful extras. 15-20 minute walk to the centre or Ubers very inexpensive to use. 
A very special thank you to Andre and Mafalda front desk ambassadors extraordinaire- knowledgeable nothing too much for them to do. Andre organised a day trip out of Lisbon with a superb guide. He also pretty much planned out our schedule for interesting days in Lisbon. BRILLIANT! cons: Nothing to say.
pros: The Manager Andre was exceptional! cons: Modern decor

pros: We loved this hotel! We were only stayting for 1 night after 2 weeks of traveling before flying out the next morning. I was so happy we booked here! We were impressed the moment we walked through the door - the entire hotel is so beautiful and the staff were extremely kind and welcoming. We felt very "taken care of" which is always a great feeling when you're exhausted! The complimentary breakfast was also delicious! One of the best hotel breakfasts we've had. Highly recommend! cons:
pros: Location. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Great service. Great breakfast. cons: No deficiencies.
pros: Great location! Beautiful view of the castle! Trendy and modern. Very large room! cons: Nothing

pros: It was a special occasion and from arrival to departure the staff could not have been more helpful. We were given room 311 which was the room with a separate living room in the top of the dome. We also had a lovely welcome gift to mark our special occasion. The staff were knowledgeable about getting around and nothing was too much trouble. It was all clean and the breakfast which was included was lovely with a contintal breakfast choice and a menu to order from also. The hotel has a small paved area outside which has some outside tables. The hotel is on a busy part road but it is still fairly quiet. The area of town is up and coming and so not as polished as the other more popular parts of Lisbon but everything is walkable within 25 minutes from the hotel. I would definitely go back and recommend the hotel. cons: My one and only criticism would be that due to arriving before our room was available and as we had a booking on the otherside of the river we didn't arrive back to our room until late and we didnt get to drink our complimentary bottle of sparkling wine. When we went out the next day we had intended to drink it whilst getting ready for dinner but found it had been taken by the cleaners even though it was unopened. We didn't say anything as we were getting ready to head out. But that would be my only criticism. Plus the main room had been cleaned but the living room area had not been cleaned at all with the glasses and bottle if wine we had bought back from the restaurant still there until we left the hotel.

pros: The hotel is located directly in front of the best restaurant in all of Portugal according to all of the locals and according to food magazines. It is also located right next to a small courtyard/square with wonderful restaurants. They‚Äôre open til 1:30 in the morning. Josephine‚Äôs was my favorite- try their tea with fresh cinnamon sticks ginger orange lemon and mint. Outrageous. The hotel has a wonderful staff and an excellent breakfast included with your stay. Bottles and bottles and bottles of cold complementary water at your disposal. Massive bathroom with wonderful products.  Our room had two humongous French doors that looked out into the courtyard. The bed and the sheets were very comfortable. The linens were white crisp fresh and new.  They also welcome you with slippers and a very nice touch.  Diogo greeted us and answered our every question kindly and generously. He sent us a map of the area on WhatsApp which was very helpful. The hotel is a short five minute walk away to the world famous Tram 28.  The building is absolutely gorgeous. The next time I am in Lisbon I am sure I will be returning to Hotel 1908. cons: The courtyard had many rats running through it all night. I was afraid to enjoy the courtyard.

pros: Very cool very stylish great location easy walk to the main part of town some cool restaurants and bars in the neighbourhood too.
Andr√© (hope I spelled it right ) was an absolute rock star.  His maps and suggestions for places to visit were so good but not as good as his restaurant recommendations.
We would never have found the places he sent us without him.  He truly made our stay in Lisbon very special.
All the staff were so friendly and smiling cons: Not a thing
pros: Really cool boutique hotel in great central location. Fabulous room with good facilities. Awesome staff and nice restaurant below. Would stay again cons:

pros: Property is beautiful. Rooms are modern yet warm and inviting. Best thing about the hotel are the people who work there. They are welcoming warm attentive and extremely helpful and accommodating.  The concierge team is the absolute best. Thank you for upgrading our room without us asking for offering us a very very late check out (an extra half day). The food at the restaurant is amazing! I picked this hotel based on a Cond√© Nast review and it exceeded all my expectations. Thank you Andres and team for making us feel at home away from home. cons:

pros: 1908 Lisboa was one of the best hotels I‚Äôve stayed in. The staff was very communicative ahead of my visit. They went above and beyond to help me plan a surprise proposal to my partner. Our room was superb with a beautiful balcony that we enjoyed daily. The hotel location was perfect for getting around Lisbon. I highly recommend this hotel! cons:
pros: Andre the concierge was wonderful.  He made our trip easy with his wonderful recommendations and suggestions.  He truly was interested in making sure our trip was memorable. cons:
pros: Lovely rooms very clean. Nice vibe in the communal spaces. Delicious breakfast. Friendly staf. cons: Nothing. We loved our stay.

pros: The hotel was charming the staff were phenomenal (really can‚Äôt say enough about them) and the breakfast was excellent. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff go out of their way to make one‚Äôs stay perfect! cons:

pros: The staff at 1908 Lisboa are lovely and great with recommendations.
Our room was an excellent size and very comfortable. cons: Nothing really.
It‚Äôs out of the main tourist area but we knew this beforehand and the walk is very easy!
pros: The hotel was beautiful and the staff went above and beyond to make our experience excellent! cons:

pros: A beautiful boutique hotel situated closeby to the main tourist area. A couple of supermarkets within 2-minute walk plenty of restaurants and takeaways in the neighbourhood. 

On arrival I was allowed early check-in Katarina at front of house was very welcoming. The room was beautiful. I was welcomed with drinks and sweet treats brought to my room. 

Breakfast was of a great standard with good coffee and a plentiful buffet as well as ala carte options.

I was also assisted by Mathilde at reception who was extremely helpful. cons:

pros: Above and beyond help from all the staff- I booked the wrong date accidentally and when I showed up exhausted at almost midnight without a current reservation Diego at the front desk got us a room for no added price- unbelievably hospitable. They safely kept a bag for me and had fabulous breakfast welcome drinks and beautiful views. Beautiful lobby and thoughtful unique decor in all the rooms and common spaces. cons:
pros: Historic building with beautiful architecture and artsy modern touches. Great location. Clean and comfortable. cons: Nothing. It was perfect.
pros: Amazing staff and breakfast. Lovely room. cons: The location was okay but worth the value.
pros: The decor was fantastic and the staff was exemplary cons:

pros: The hotel was in a beautiful building. The person who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our welcome cocktails in the lounge while the attendant put our bags in our room for us. After our drinks he offered to take us up to our room and show us around. The room was smaller than expected but had everything in it we needed like bedside lamps/tables small desk with coffee station mini fridge and a small bench/cabinet to set our luggage. The bathroom was also nice with a rain shower head lovely shampoo conditioner body wash with a heavenly spa like scent. Breakfast was also very nice with a large spread of pastries fruits yogurt with lots of different toppings meats/cheeses freshly squeezed orange juice plentiful coffee and made to order egg dishes. cons: the location was a little sketchy with several deserted buildings nearby some boarded up some under construction. Several empty storefronts also.  It is across the street from Cervejaria Ramiro where we had dinner reservations. It is close to an alley way with ton of ethnic foods especially Indian foods/shops just down the road. Easy walk to some decent eateries.

pros: Everything was beyond expectations after our awful experience with the hotel in Porto 
I loved the staff to death; they were humble friendly helpful smiling polite every staff in all shifts were very good people cons: The room in the 4 floor 
The bead was twin beds connected to be king bed 
And the AC was fan we were almost die of the lack of oxygen in the room
But our previous room was in the 3 floor and it was perfect in everything

pros: Comfortable room with a great breakfast in an interesting area. Andre was exceptionally helpful and professional on front desk. cons: Towels were a little old and hard. No milk in the room for tea and coffee.Staff at breakfast were not very attentive about topping up secondry tea and coffee and clearing away used plates and cutlery etc
pros: Great room friendly and proactive staff nice restaurant. cons: N/A

pros: We were given an upgrade by Andre who was the Hotel Manager and we both had to say he exceeded all our expectationsparticularly on arranging trips around the city of Lisbon and advising us on the places to visit!
He was also charming and courteous and we intend to return next year cons: There was nothing we disliked whatsoever!!!
pros: The staff was superb cons:

pros: Loved the look of the hotel outside & in! Rooms 206 &306 were super very spacious - food was fab  great selection at breakfast also the evening dinner was very good on the outside patio!  Reception very helpful with information around the area ! cons:

pros: Trendy. Nice layout. Great breakfast. cons: While the front staff was fluent in English and eager to help there printed directions always managed to get us lost. I think this is a fault of Lisbon more so than the hotel. 

Our one dinner was mediocre.
pros: Extremely friendly staff who had great recommendations! cons: I liked everything perfect stay.

pros: Very clean and all staff  so nice and friendly . Andreas on reception couldn‚Äôt have been any better-advised on everything and spent lots of relaxed time answering all our questions about where to go and what to do to make the most of our holiday. cons:

pros: Greeting on our arrival was brilliant. Breakfasts were lovely. Staff were very friendly and helpful cons: The first room we were put in. Faced a busy road and the shower was awful. But for the other nights the room we were swopped to was perfect. The area outside the immediate vicinity of the square was not too good.

pros: The staff were very accommodating and friendly. The rooms were very comfortable and clean.
There was a good selection on the breakfast buffet. It was easy to walk or get the Metro from the hotel to anywhere in the city. cons: The cooked breakfasts could have been better. 
We arrived back from a full day out to find our room was unlocked luckily nothing had been taken and reception did fix the issue as soon as we informed them.

pros: My stay at the hotel was generally enjoyable with excellent service a clean and comfortable room and a great location near local attractions. The available facilities also enhanced my overall experience. cons: There was a consistent issue with breakfast particularly with how eggs were prepared. Improving this would make the morning meal more satisfying.
pros: Staff were excellent and couldn‚Äôt be more helpful and friendly cons: Need a mirror in the room!
pros: Staff were super helpful ! Lovely breakfast and good rooms cons: Difficult to park nearby but hotel helped us with that and parked car for us

pros: The design of the hotel is stunning and contemporary. The bedroom was lovely and spacious and loved the windows! Breakfast was amazing! Great selection and delicious! Reception staff were amazing! We got an upgrade which was a lovely surprise and their knowledge of the area and they were able to sort out ideas and routes for sightseeing. The WhatsApp message service was brilliant! cons: Facilities in the bedroom were a little
Lacking. There were no teabags or milk for a drink but when we asked for some the staff were straight on to sorting it out for us. Breakfast was delicious but service was slow.

pros: Gorgeous boutique hotel surrounded by great restaurants and bars - but you won‚Äôt want to go to any of them - the Infame restaurant at 1908 Lisboa is superb and we just couldn‚Äôt go past it to eat anywhere else! Must try dishes are the cod and the hummus!!! Ask for a room on the pointy end of the building (111211 311 etc) - they are amazing with their three huge windows and enormous bathroom! About 200m walk to Intendente subway station which connects you to everywhere or any easy 10min walk down to the main mall. Highly recommended! cons: Not quite in the centre of the tourist hotspots but quite nice to be able to get away from it all the same!
pros: Very nice staff! Silent airco good beds superb breakfast cons: We had an issue with the airco but the staff did everything to fix it asap and offered an upgrade

pros: The most impressive thing about this hotel is the staff. I had my wallet stolen within about 30 minutes of arriving. Andre my hero was there to help out with everything. I wasn't sure how I was going to pay for the next 6 days of my trip in Portugal but Andre had me PayPal him some euros and the hotel gave me the cash. The entire team went above and beyond to help me in my time of need. Additionally the hotel was very nice the breakfast was delicious and the location is great. cons: Nothing.
pros: friendly helpful staff great breakfast. Very Arty decor. cons: Nothing negative about my review. Staff service and premises were all excellent.
pros: Clean comfortable extremely helpful & friendly staff. Perfect location right in the centre of Lisbon. Delicious breakfasts cons: Nothing!

pros: 1908 Lisboa Hotel is an architectural gem and our room overlooking the square was beautiful spacious and very well-appointed (an unexpected upgrade from our booking).  Every part of this charming hotel has been thoughtfully designed to delight.  Resto and lounge were wonderful.  Welcome drinks were appreciated as were the tarts in our room.  Even unloading our luggage (in dedicated space) and parking which can be v challenging in the city was convenient and seamlessly handled.  The most outstanding feature of the hotel is the staff - every single team member was so friendly happy and helpful.  Andre who assisted with plans for a walking tour of Lisbon for our last day might have the most welcoming smile in the world.  He is a treasure.  Would not hesitate to book again. cons: We loved everything about the hotel and location was surprisingly convenient.  If I was a solo woman traveler would be cognizant of some typical urban issues as in any other major city.
pros: Very clean room very delicious breakfast. cons:

pros: The location is great. It‚Äôs a nice central spot with lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. The hotel itself was super clean and nicely decorated. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was very spacious and had a great view of the city. Overall a very welcoming place & wished we were able to stay longer! cons: Nothing.
pros: Very stylish hotel in the heart of Lisboa. Excellent  healthy breakfast. Super helpful staff. Great patio. cons:
pros: Restaurant in the hotel fantastic breakfast great location and very nice staff. cons: Size of the room.

pros: The front desk staff were amazing (thank you Mafalda and Sophia): accommodating helpful friendly great energy. Breakfast (included) was fantastic: quality great spread a la carte options stellar wait staff (thank you Luis). Great location: many nice restaurants adjacent and only a 30 minute walk to Alfama and other major tourist locations: on the pick-up route for tourist locations. 
Beautiful building: magnificent heritage exterior yet very modern artsy and aesthetically pleasing interior. cons: The room was a little small (travelled with a friend separate beds).
pros: Everything was fantastic and way above what we had expected. cons: Nothing
pros: Best breakfast ever.  Staff went above and beyond. cons:
pros: Beautifully designed.  Brilliant staff.  Excellent breakfast. cons:

pros: Beautiful building with fantastic design is on the 28 team route it literally stops outside and it's in a square with bars and a fantastic shop cons: It's in an up and coming area that might not suit everyone
pros: very good breakfast cons:

pros: Loved my stay at 1908 Lisboa. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating nothing was too much trouble. Great breakfast. Restaurant was lovely to eat in the evening too. Also loved the quirky bathroom. Well done to all. cons:
pros: Location staff breakfast excellent bed and shutters that absolutely drowned out any street noise. cons: Nothing comes to mind.

pros: Room was comfortable and well appointed.
Breakfast was very good.
Staff were exceptional- booking us train tickets airline check-in organizing taxis etc. Can't tell you how much we appreciated the staff going the "extra" mile for us. cons: The bar area is small and often overcrowded. A pretty minor dislike with all the other good stuff.

pros: Excellent staff - extremely helpful and welcoming. Lots of little touches at the hotel that were hugely appreciated - e.g local pastries and liqueur sent up to room on night one two free drinks at the bar and a flower on International Women's Day! Instant response to queries on the hotel WhatsApp board. Exceptional service. cons:
pros: Absolutely beautiful hotel and incredible staff. cons:

pros: Everything fantastic....staff...breakfast...room...location...nothing was too much trouble cons: Maybe a toaster in the otherwise excellent breakfast room and milk in the room for early morning tea!!

pros: The hotel is situated a short walk from nearly everything you could wish to do on a long weekend in Lisbon not to mention across the road from one of the best seafood restaurants Ramiro!! The staff though were really exceptional so helpful and friendly nothing was too much trouble! cons: Nothing!

pros: Fantastic location. Great staff. Superb breakfast!  
Lift immaculate room and a really good cup of coffee at the end of the day. cons: I really liked everything.

pros: Very nice boutique hotel near the Center of the City. Excellent staff and great breakfast. Although we didn‚Äôt use the hotel restaurant for dinner it was full most of the nights we were there. Renowned restaurant Ramiro is just opposite the hotel. cons: Small technical issues in the bathroom
pros: Building room staff easy access to other locations cons: Surrounding area wasn‚Äôt quite what we expected but okay

pros: Breakfast was first rate.
Location was ok. Our first visit to Lisbon so nothing else to compare it with.
Staff very helpful and knowledgeable. cons: We were very satisfied with our visit.
Returning early next month before we head home.

pros: The breakfast was truly amazing I‚Äôd go back just for that. Also the tiles in the neighborhood were gorgeous. cons: Neighborhood did not feel safe for a solo female traveler. Also my door key never worked so I constantly had to wait 5 min in front of my room for someone to open it.

pros: Our room was stylish comfortable and very clean. We loved the welcoming touches ...Pastas de nata and the Valentine cookies and the bottles of liqueur. 
The staff were outstanding and could not have been more helpful! cons: Our room had a pretty outlook but unfortunately a bar below was extremely noisy until 11:30 pm.

pros: Great breakfast selections and room was very comfortable. Interior design throughout was amazing with a great selection from both the bar and restaurant. cons: Location could have been better but not a far walk from the main shops and tourist attractions. Plus its along good tram lines and taxis are cheap
pros: Everything was great especially the staff. It was like having a team of full-time concierges. cons:

pros: A historical building at the perfect spot for walking all around Lisbon. The hotel's highlight is definitely the friendliness of the staff their love for Lisbon and their willingness to make everything in the city accessible and help you get the most out of your visit! cons:

pros: This was our 3rd time staying in 1908 but its been 4 years since our last stay. The staff have remained so friendly. They really go above and beyond to make sure your stay is as good as possible. We will definitely be back. cons: Nothing

pros: I have travelled to New York Paris Tokyo London Barcelona.  This is the best hotel in the world.  The people in the hotel are fantastic very helpful.  The tips on places to visit transportation were exceptional.  They even booked a restaurant that was full for us on our arrival.  The breakfast was absolutely amazing.  A special shout out to Katrina who our made our stay special thank you.  Can‚Äôt wait to go back ‚ù§Ô∏è cons: Nothing

pros: Excellent customer service throughout our stay. The reception bar restaurant and housekeeping were all delightful. The rooms are exceptionally presented and the food delicious. The bed was one of the most comfortable I‚Äôve ever slept in. A excellent hotel in a beautiful city. cons: No issues at all. Only 1 piece of advice I have is that a plug socket located near the mirror would be handy for my wife to prepare her hair easily.
pros: Quirky decor comfortable bed great breakfast and lovely helpful staff. cons: Nothing
pros: Well positioned for wandering around Lisbon. Close to trams buses and metro. Extremely helpful and friendly staff good breakfasts dinner and wine lists. cons: Nothing springs to mind
pros: The property restaurant and staff are first rate cons:
pros: Its was so clean and beautifully presented cons: Old and traditional with a fresh look
pros: Fantastic stay great staff and lovely building. Breakfasts were excellent. cons:
pros: Breakfast delicious staff outstanding nice room. cons: Location.
pros: Start with the people then move to the breakfast and room and it just keeps getting better. Amazing hotel!! cons: N/A
pros: Great stay in Lisboa excelent location. The room was very clean and comfortable and the breakfast was amazing. Thank you for the hospitality! I highly recommend! ü´∂üèª cons: N/A
pros: Location building ambience cons: N/A
pros: Modern clean and well styled. Great breakfast and lovely staff. cons: N/a

pros: The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I needed to see a dentist on the first day as I had bad toothache and they called a dental hospital for me to arrange an appointment. The breakfast is excellent lots of choice and the food generally (we ate dinner in the restaurant) was excellent with good options for vegetarians. The hotel is also very clean and located a 10-15 minute walk from the sea/central Lisbon. cons:
pros: Very good rooms & excellent staff. Sofia Texeira at reception was wonderful. cons: The bathroom didn‚Äôt have an opaque door. And the room didn‚Äôt have enough cupboard space to keep clothes.

pros: The bed and sheets were amazing. The shutters on the windows create the perfect environment for a good night's sleep.  Comfortable room.  Nice touches including drink on arrival and treats in the room. cons: The breakfast was average - the buffet was limited and the quality of the hot food could be better. Only filter coffee available.
pros: Breakfast was excellent rooms small but beautiful with lots of extras slippers robes toiletries cons:

pros: Everything about this hotel was great. Building is beautiful the staff was great everything I needed was provided very quickly and they were all very pleasant to deal with. Room was really good. Location was good. I have no complaints about my stay. Would definitely stay there again. cons:
pros: Extremely comfy bed and pillows tasty cocktails and rich breakfast the sweetest and most helpful staff. Would 100% recommend. cons: -
pros: Comfy stay with wonderful breakfast & amazing staff. cons: Would have preferred a different neighborhood but this location is very central.
pros: The design and the staff were wonderful! cons: Nothing all was great.
pros: Amazing hotel.  Angela Andre Sofia Luis all absolutely wonderful :-) cons:
pros: Lovely small hotel comfortable bed excellent breakfast great location. cons: Lack of storage in room to unpack and store luggage. Noise from road.

pros: The hotel is fabulous. First the service is phenomenal. The staff go out of their way to ensure that you are comfortable. They offer a concierge service using WhatsApp which is amazing. I was able to request reservations for restaurants and shows through WhatsApp and receive immediate service. On my first day I asked about a museum. The staff put together a map and a proposed tour of sites near the museum. Anything I requested was immediately answered. Next the hotel is in a great location which is walking distance to the major tourist areas. It is close to bus tram and metro stops which make it easy to get around the beautiful city of Lisbon. Further Infame the attached restaurant has amazing food. The daily breakfast was expansive with hot and cold options. I had dinner 3 times at Infame because the food was divine. Last the room was a perfect size with a well apportioned bathroom. My room had a view to the square which I loved. 
I truly enjoyed my 10 day stay at the 1908 Lisboa Hotel and plan to stay there again when I next visit Lisbon. I have been encouraging friends and family to visit Lisbon and stay at this hotel. cons: The storage could be a bit larger.
pros: Very clean super comfortable bed and pillows. cons: Everything was perfect
pros: Super attentive and knowledgeable staff.  Beautiful rooms with many creature comforts. cons: Liked it all!

pros: Great building we had a lovely room with a balcony looking down the Main Street. Excellent food in the restaurant the pork dish I had was fab. All the staff were helpful smiling and a credit to the hospitality industry. cons:

pros: Great welcome from a very friendly and helpful team who went out of their way to provide us with an excellent stay. The move to a very large and quiet attic room was much appreciated. Fantastic breakfast provided a wonderful start to the day. cons: No complaints.
pros: Beautiful rooms in a beautiful building. Staff were generous helpful and attentive - easily the most welcoming stay of our trip. cons:
pros: Loved this property really trending great service cons:

pros: Everything was exceptional. This was like a city oasis. Staff were phenomenal going above and beyond to be helpful.  Room was comfortable and clean.   Welcome gift was a nice luxury touch.  Good central location. Able to walk to all sights or public transportation. Highly recommended cons: Nothing

pros: The staff were fantastic! Beautiful building with modern facilities throughout. Staff so responsive to our every request & so helpful. Breakfast was incredible - so much choice & need the recipe for that granola! Super comfy bed fluffy towels & great shower. Loved the bars across the road too! cons: Hard to say! It‚Äôs 15 mins walk to the centre of lisbon - which wasn‚Äôt a problem for us at all. And the metro stop is really close.
pros: Very goog breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice decoration. cons: -
pros: the team was absolutely fantastic and went above and beyond and were a great city guide. 100% recommendation cons:

pros: Breakfast was excellent. A very good choice of food.
Staff could not have been more helpful & the communication through whats app to answer queries was very helpful.
Location was quite central & there are a few very good restaurants close by.
I would highly recommend 1908 Lisbon hotel cons: I have no complaints with 1908 Lisboa.
We were unfortunate with the weather during our stay but that is something none of us can control.
pros: The bed was SUPER comfortable the breakfast was amazing.  The staff were all super friendly and helpful and I really enjoyed and recommend this as a great place to stay in Lisbon. cons:

pros: The staff were very friendly.  Angela behind the bar was exceptional:  excellent classic cocktails and super friendly.  Front-of-house moved us to a more quiet room when we complained of noise in the middle of the night. cons: We couldn‚Äôt understand why there were works/cleaning in progress in the middle of the night.  ANyway when we brought this to the attention of the front-of-house we were transferred to a more quiet room.

pros: Stayed here for a few nights at the end of October.  Check in was quick and easy. We got a room upgrade which was a bonus.

Rooms were clean spacious and well appointed.  We had a good view of the city and the castle

Breakfast was a buffet with selection of freshly made food. Was good quality with a wide choice

Also ate in the hotel restaurant one evening.  We were lucky to get a table booking definitely recommended

Close to both Martim Muniz and Intendente tube stations and on the 28e tram route and  well connected for buses.  20 mins to the airport and walking distance to the town.  The area round the hotel would be best described as up and coming with a diverse selection of local restaurants but plenty of good places to eat cons:
pros: 10 out 10. Elegant modern style and feel great genuine service perfect comfort and terrific breakfast.  Hip location fast wifi local welcome plate. Totally recommended. cons:

pros: Fabulous hotel restaurant and bar. The building is very beautiful and is near a Metro stop which is handy. Breakfast was excellent good selection of buffet items and a cooked menu. Room was nice and clean. Staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. cons: A couple of mugs to go with the kettle would have been nice to get our fix of tea!!
pros: Room decor lovely great cocktails at the bar. Breakfast lots of choice. The staff really made the effort and were super helpful and friendly. cons:
pros: Included breakfast was great lot of variety (fresh fruit granola eggs baked goods etc). cons:

pros: We stayed in four different hotels VRBO's in Portugal and this one was the best value!  We loved the size of the bathrooms in the rooms.  We were blown away with the fantastic morning breakfasts.  The staff was amazing and extremely helpful.  We couldn't have asked for better service.
We were a party of 11 adults requiring six rooms. I forgot to book two rooms for an extra two days for some of our party.  The staff made it happen and we found out a secret about the fourth floor.  The hotel usually doesn't book the fourth floor because of the ceiling architecture of the roof makes the ceiling not as tall in some places.  However these rooms are huge and our married children loved them.  The fourth floor is were you find the real value. cons:
pros: Exceptional staff nice amenities in the room fabulous breakfast buffet and the best pasta carbonara I have ever had anywhere! cons:

pros: The service was over and above! I stay in lots of hotels around the world- and the service given by every member of the team in this hotel was exceptional and the best I‚Äôve ever received. I would definitely come back to this hotel! 
The little touches and attention to detail we‚Äôre top rate! cons: I can‚Äôt think of anything!

pros: Very stylish comfortable and quiet very friendly staff who gave us a great welcome and marked a special occasion with generosity we really appreciated it. cons: We had let the hotel know in advance we were vegan and for there to be vegan options which was confirmed at check in. this was a bit confusing on the first morning and we were briefly told all we could have was fruit as all the many bread options contain milk (strange but confirmed to be true). Each other morning we were brought a special dish. The breakfast looks so good shame all the bread has dairy! We appreciated the special attention in the end.

pros: Staff was really really good. They really made every extra step possible for the customer. 
Room itself was quite nice and modern. 

Breakfast was super good. cons: Sadly it was quite noisy since it is in the city center basically and the windows were not soundproof. Neither was the door of the room. Our room was right opposite the elevator so quite a lot of noise from there as well. But luckily there were earplugs available in the reception. 

Room was quite tiny not much room if you are travelling with suitcases etc.

pros: Lovely hotel with great ambiance.Great breakfast and restraunt with outdoor eating and drinking available. High spec on decor and amenities though I was expecting room to be a little bigger with a bit more storage space..fantastic bathroom and air conditioning though. much needed given the 30-degree temp in October cons: Nothing to dislike..
Location ok with easy access to metro but Uber taxis are so cheap and convenient why use anything else as the city is spread out far and wide and trams are packed at all times of day
pros: Friendly staff great breakfast excellent location! cons:
pros: Exceptional customer service cons:
pros: Nice room. Large and clean. Great bathroom cons: A bit noisy with construction nearby

pros: The staff were incredible. Very friendly and welcoming. They gave us a link to a google map of Lisbon with loads of great suggestions on it. Breakfast was really lovely. Hotel location was so good for getting around and access to the 28 tram. Bar also was very good value. Pint of beer for 4 euros! cons: No kettle in the hotel room but not the end of the world!

pros: Location Walking distance from the tourist attraction . 
Friendly staff.
Breakfast is actually worth it cons: Noise might travel through the wall but you can close the windows to limit it up
pros: Very helpful staff and generous breakfast cons:

pros: The hotel was changed from an old building but it is very fashion. The staffs are very helpful.  Sofia and Andre are always smiling and helpful.  Especially Andre he  gave us a suggestion and tailor make a trip route for us to view the Lisbon viewpoint in very short time. cons:

pros: Breakfast was great staff was great. cons: I hated the glass cage bathroom with the curtain. If you opened the room door you could see right into the bathroom. The bathroom also needs a better window treatment‚Ä¶one that allows light in and privacy.

pros: The hotel is a great mix of old architecture and contemporary atmosphere. The team were incredibly friendly and helpful and the room was extremely cozy and super comfortable beds! It is also opposite what is one of the best restaurants in Lisbon so it couldn‚Äôt have been a better stay. cons: Nothing

pros: The location the atmosphere & the over all facilities are 10/10! Everything was exceptional and the rooms were immaculate! The hotel smelt like perfume & the interior design was gorgeous!  The staff are so friendly and welcoming & truly help their guests with all their queries! :) cons: Nothing. I couldn‚Äôt fault the property!
pros: Wonderful staff. Very helpfull and kind! cons:
pros: The staff was very friendly. The room was spacious clean and comfortable . We also liked the arrival gift and the coffee machine. cons: Can‚Äôt say there was anything we didn‚Äôt like

pros: overall the experience I had with the hotel exceeded my expectations cons: Minor repair issues with bathroom (leaking seal on shower drain cover in shower was not attached properly toilet paper holder was hanging loosely from wall)

pros: The room was exactly like what you see in the pictures. The staff were super welcoming and that made us feel special right from the get go. The breakfast was just perfect not too many options but enough for you to find something that you would enjoy. The location was also great it was close to the metro stations which was very convenient. cons: I do wish they had two sinks in the bathroom instead of one and a bit more space to put your toiletries. I traveled with my partner and it was a bit challenging to find enough room in the bathroom for both of us to be in there at the same time.
pros: Help from the staff cons: nothing
pros: The concierge and team is amazing! Also great rates clean and easy to walk to main spots in the city cons: Our view was of construction but hopefully this is temporary üôÇ

pros: I liked everything cons: The only issue I had was the experience with renting the car
My advice if you are going with local rent a car companies read every sentence click to every link as voucher go to terms and conditions where you be surprised by the real price 
Never trust to the price that they give you online
You‚Äôll have additional triple payments while picking the car. It‚Äôs a major problem in Lisbon now
Go with famous trustworthy companies instead. 
Avoid dealing with Drive on holidays and Rentalcars. com

pros: This is a really nice clean hotel within easy walking distance of the Centre of Lisbon. Many positives small touches like free water bottles welcome drinks and treats in the room to the breakfast which was very good with options for most tastes.
