But what  made this hotel stand out was the fantastic staff that really went out of their way to help us with everything from sightseeing and food suggestions to making sure we got an Uber for our onward journey. cons:
pros: Very kind staff and comfy beds :) cons:

pros: This hotel is such a treat. Everything has been thought through and the reception staff were amazing. Treated me like family rather than a customer. Breakfast had an extensive range and everything was delicious. Was warmly received and delighted to find welcome treats in my room. Bed was super comfortable and despite being in a busy area my room was quiet. Overall an exceptional hotel. cons:

pros: Exceptional boutique hotel experience.  The staff went above and beyond.  Andre greeted us and then sat down with us to create the perfect itinerary in detail booked a private tour of Sintra for us (very much worth the price) and answers all of our questions.  The next concierge helped us cancel and rebook our next hotel in Porto since I was getting notifications that the prices were dropping from what I originally paid.  That was so nice of her to do for us.
The breakfast was the absolute best I have ever experienced.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  Fantastic coffee (from the barista) and eggs cooked to perfection.  I‚Äôm still craving their granola and fresh yogurt.
Our room 111 was fabulous.  We had the  curved room with approximately 280 degree views and balconies.  Wait until you see these French doors and high ceilings on the first floor - incredible!  The giant bathtub was another highlight of the room.  
Finally the design and decor is a show stopper.  We were on a bus ride back to city center and my boyfriend was looking at rooftop tile art.  He nudged me and said ‚Äúwow look at that one.‚Äù  I said ‚Äúwow it‚Äôs beautiful‚Äù then 2 seconds later I said ‚Äúhey that‚Äôs our hotel!‚Äù  Don‚Äôt forget to check out all the amazing design details when you‚Äôre there. cons: The only thing I can think of is having some drawer space in the closet for clothes.  There were only hangers.
pros: All was just great cons: A but noisy outside. But it‚Äôs more a question to Lisbon than to a hotel

pros: So a crazy series of events lead to us staying at 1908 Lisboa Hotel. We had orignially booked an airbnb but upon checking into the airbnb we realized that it hadn't been cleaned and wasn't ready for new guests. After canceling that reservation we found the 1908 Lisboa Hotel on short notice. Even though the airbnb situation was stressful I am glad it happened because it gave us the unexpected pleasant opportunity to stay at the 1908 Lisboa Hotel! The staff was super friendly helpful and accommodating. The hotel itself had the boutique hotel vibe that I sought. The decor was unique without being out of touch or over the top. Breakfast was delicious. They had just about anything that you would want. I would stay there again in a heartbeat! cons:
pros: room breakfast and location cons:

pros: The front desk staff were exceptional. They went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and even lent us an iron and ironing board when requested. The breakfast was the best we had among all the hotels we stayed in Portugal. cons: The rooms are very small and it was hard to open suitcases on the floor.
pros: Over the top service staff were hospitable on another level! Modern clean spacious rooms and delicious breakfast highly recommend! cons: -

pros: Room - good size particularly the bathroom. All amenities you could want in the room such as coffee machine slippers bathrobes vanity kit big TV. The shutters shut out any noise and light. The bed was extremely comfortable. 
Catering - the best breakfast I have ever experienced in any hotel. Everything was freshly prepared and included local delicacies and option for a hot meal such as omelette pancakes or eggs benedict etc. Literally there was something for everyone and I am already missing these breakfasts. We ate dinner there on our last night and wish we had eaten there sooner rather than at one of the hyped up restaurants I had booked. Food was delicious - we really enjoyed the crab rice octopus with sweet potato and cheesecake. You can tell there is alot of passion going into the overall catering. 
Reception - outstanding. Andre was a mine of information super friendly. His guidance literally made our trip. Katrina also always had a smile and was super helpful.
Bar - great cocktails and great staff
Location - its very close to get the tram/bus or walk to central areas. Turn left out of the building and take a walk through Intendente to see some of the old tiled houses. Nice cafes like Palma close by and one of the best seafood restaurants in Lisbon across the road (Ramiros). There is a supermarket with pharmacy and ATM across the road too. cons: N/A

pros: Amazing hotel with great staff and comfortable rooms. We even had welcome drinks upon our arrival in the hotel bar and a welcome cake in our room. cons: The location was central but not the best in town.

pros: style and location. breakfast was wonderful. small rooms but comfy. great reception staff. cons: the bar/outdoor cafe had awful wine and rude waitstaff. ended up leaving food uneaten and wine undrunk because they were bad and waiter was unaccommodating. better to go across the plaza or up the road to other restaurants. great breakfast though.
pros: everything was amazing cons: nothing

pros: Approachable and extremely helpful staff who took time to answer any questions we had. The breakfast was fantastic and again the staff couldn‚Äôt be more attentive. cons: Nothing. Although as often when booking with Booking.Com you don‚Äôt get the room with the best view!
pros: Parking was on the street next to the hotel and the receptionist was brilliant at moving the cars around for them to fit ours in. So helpful and friendly. cons:
pros: Very friendly and helpfull staff with very good advice in city trips. cons:

pros: Such a lovely place! The staff was very nice the rooms super clean and the beds comfortable. The whole hotel is nicely refurbished and the breakfast excellent. Can not wait to come back! cons: One can hear the train/metro but this can not be changed by the hotel. The price is not cheap but worth it ;)

pros: the staff was great 
the breakfast was excellent cons:

pros: The staff were very helpful and welcoming at all times. They were the best feature! Our room was quite small. The breakfast was very very good. The neighbourhood seemed a little tougher than we expected. Our room opened to a noisy piazza but once the doors were closed it was quite quiet. It‚Äôs a rather cool hotel but some of us found it a little dark in need of some upgrading perhaps. cons:
pros: The rooms and the ambiance were incredible. cons: Not a thing.

pros: Everything! 
Staff was great every helpful. 
Room was great beautiful bathroom and shower. 
Amazing breakfast. Very nice decoration all around. cons:
pros: Staff and breakfast were outstanding. cons: Noisy at night outside. Neighbourhood was a little rough a street away.

pros: I enjoyed the fact that the hotel was an Art Nouveau landmark. Additionally all staff were exceptionally helpful and went out of their way to make me fell welcomed.  My dinner at the restaurant was very delicous. cons:
pros: Amazing historical building. All the design details in the room. cons:

pros: The staff was very accommodating. We had nice little extras put in our room. 
The breakfast was good and had a good variety of food. 
Not far from the metro we were able to leave our luggage in the lock cupboard whilst we had lunch 2 streets up great recommendations from the reception of the hotel. They then sent us a text when our room was really ( earlier than expected). cons: The little square at the hotel was very nice we could seat and have drinks outside however adventuring further in that area was a bit rough.

pros: Fantastic service really friendly welcome and the staff made it a real pleasure to stay. Very stylish and modern hotel. Welcome snacks and drinks were a lovely surprise. Bed was super comfy too! Wish we were there for more than one night... cons: Would appreciate clearer labelling for allergens at breakfast.

pros: Amazing staff. Made us feel very welcome and not only offered a welcome drink but also shared a google map with all their favorite restaurants and things to do. Advised us on how to best use our three days in Lisbon with so much enthusiasm. They clearly love their city and the job they do and it shows. Highly recommended. Wonderful breakfast and a very nice bar with seats outside. cons: nothing really.
pros: Breakfast was delicious. Location was great nice walk into main parts of town. Just downstairs was a couple great dinner options as well as a bar. cons: Nothing!
pros: Amazing staff cons:
pros: Breakfast was great servers were super friendly cons: nothing

pros: Front desk was brilliant with really helpful staff. Attentive to the needs of the guest and provided some great advise on various locations to visit and some of the best restaurants to eat at.
Breakfast was fantastic with a great selection and in a really nice little restaurant setting. cons: Liked everything at the Hotel
pros: Exceptional staff beautiful old building with stylish interiors and lovely rooms. There is also a great bar and restaurant . cons:

pros: We really enjoyed the stay with the location on a piazza full of activities and live music 
Staff were super friendly and helpful 
Breakfast was delicious with a wide variety cons: Nothing

pros: The reception staff were lovely friendly professional and helpful beyond expectations! The interior decor was appealing and tasteful. cons: I worried re the noise of partying in the square but it didn't bother me at all.

pros: really comfortable room
excellent breakfast
great staff - really helpful and friendly cons:

pros: From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome nothing was too much trouble. All the staff went out of their way to accommodate us particularly Andre who spent quite some time suggesting an itinerary for our stay encompassing all that there was to see and experience.
The hotel was beautiful and unique for us I feel ideal situated as we all enjoy walking. The cleanliness and attention to detail was very good.
The breakfast was excellent and the variety endless we never felt rushed. 
I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone or stay there again if I should return to Lisbon. cons: Nothing not to like
pros: large rooms friendly staff and amazing breakfast! welcome drink and snack upon arrival and very comfortable beds cons:

pros: Very clean room good location friendly receptionist„ÄÇ cons: Many people recommend the seafood restaurant opposite the hotel. In fact it was a very bad experience the noisy environment was like a market. Not recommended to eat there.
pros: This is a rare find; handy for sightseeing very comfortable beds and a great vibe. cons: Ok it‚Äôs just my taste but I didn‚Äôt love the bug art- sorry!
pros: The beauty of the original building in the outside and the modern updated features inside. cons: nothing

pros: The hotel is quaint. The rooms could be nicer. The location and the staff are excellent. The restaurant at the hotel is a plus. I would recommend it to others. cons: Room could have been nicer. I was average. Could have been more plush.

pros: The hotel is a bit away from the tourist area but is easily walkable. The room had a wraparound small balcony which was about 4 feet wide. The hotel itself is very stunning. The staff is very nice and useful. We were able to sit outside at their restaurant with our own food. The delicious breakfast was appreciated by everyone. The valet parking was wonderful and they were able to store the car in a close garage attached to the hotel. We only took public transportation once we checked in. cons: The room was not as large as loud as we had stayed in at other areas in Portugal. However this is a city hotel and is very nice.
pros: well decorated great staff and super comfy bed and pillows cons:
pros: Staff and service level cons: Rooms are too small and location
pros: Room was amazing. Great windows providing large amounts of light. Breakfast had great variety and items were fresh and local. cons: Nothing I didn;t like
pros: The property was beautiful and trendy. It sits in a hip square with cute bars and lots of activity. it‚Äôs about a 15 minute walk to the major sites. cons: It can be a little loud at night.

pros: Fantastic customer service.
All staff were brilliant
Breakfast was the best we've had
Decor was lovely
Location was convenient cons:
pros: Excellent staff cons:

pros: beautiful building  great work arts. clean to the T the beds were super comfortable with mega soft sheets. the staff is what makes this place exceptional they go above and beyond for you. extremely friendly  professional and ready to make you feel at home. this is beyond 5 stars service  really . food was great not many options but if you want them to cook something different they make it happen! thats really caring . cons:

pros: I.liked the staff the bar and the restaurant. The room was clean     spacious and comfortable. The metro station 'Independiente' was five minutes' walk away. There were some pleasant restaurants and cafes in the area. The staff were extremely helpful. cons:
pros: Service was exceptional including concierge service. Great breakfast great location good cocktails in cool building with coll boutique feel. cons: Nothing!

pros: The breakfast is fantastic. Staff is always ready to help. The location is a bit quieter than staying in Chiado or Barrio Alto. Great shopping nearby at Vida Portuguese and Depozito. Rooms are lovely and the whole hotel is sensitively renovated. Oh...and Ramiro is across the street. cons:
pros: Breakfast very basic. Cooked options were available tried 3 of them not very good. Location perfect. Staff great. Room very small. Quite expensive. cons:
pros: the design choices were great .. loved the high ceiling .. a I loved bring in a new neighborhood cons: nothing
pros: Super friendly staff very nice hotel cons: Rooms are quite small

pros: Excellent Staff room cleanliness and food. We highly recommend 1908! Every one went out of their way to accommodate us in every way. Couldn't ask for a better experience. cons: Don't have any negatives about this wonderful place

pros: The ambiance was wonderful from the moment you walk in. The staff checked us in quickly showed us to our room and a welcome drink. They also take the time to sit with you and ensure you maintain communication with them via WhatsApp to ask questions to their staff. They also hooked us with private tours around
Lisbon.  The room is very pretty with a beautiful view. The Bathroom  is spacious and higher end clean. The best part is the included amazing breakfast a spread of pastries and a brunch style menu (fantastic for the traveler). 

Location is off the metro and walkable to all attractions. 10/10 will stay there again! cons: The amazing view becomes noisy from the bar across the street. Solution is to close the window panels that block out light and noise.
pros: The people working there are sooo sweet the hotel is beautiful and also the breakfast ist a+ cons: My room was on the side of the street so it was a little bit loud with open windows
pros: The staff were so nice and lovely cons:
pros: excellent location amazing facilities and clean and tidy with lovely staff cons:

pros: Lovely boutique hotel beautifully and thoughtfully renovated.  Comfortable beds and sound proof windows a must in downtown Lisbon.   But what really made it a 10 was the staff.  Wonderful professional helpful and cheery!  A big call out to Mafalda who was so incredibly helpful throughout our staff.  Thank you! cons: Nothing to dislike.
pros: the design of the hotel comfortable beds with soundproof windows (a must in Lisbon) and most of all such wonderful staff! cons: nothing I disliked!

pros: This place is groovy quirky. A beautiful old building renovated very cleverly. The staff are as good as the best we have experienced. the place is not snobby. It is super friendly for people looking to feel at home. cons: Cannot call it a negative as the hotel is in a developing area but it is close to the centre and it is convenient.

pros: Beautiful building with modern interior design. Rooms are nice and spacious. Very good breakfast. Staffs are amazingly friendly - we didn‚Äôt feel quite well one day and they helped us arrange doctor‚Äôs visit and dinner. We really enjoyed our stay highly recommend it! cons: very minor - the bars beside the hotel are crowded at night so it can get a bit noisy sometimes

pros: Lovely hotel and gracious staff. The breakfast buffet was outstanding. The room was exceptionally clean quiet and attractive. cons: The only drawback and it is minor is that we had to take the subway to and from down central. It is walkable to town central but a hike especially returning. But the subway is a block away clean and easy to navigate.
pros: good location beautiful building and friendly stuff. cons: they put smell spreading machine in all the corredores of the hotel it was hard to breath there and felt very unhealthy.
pros: The staff was so friendly and helpful. I left my iPhone in the cab and they spent an hour helping me track down my phone. All around such a peasant staff. cons:
pros: Friendly staff good location room was spacious with a good view! cons:

pros: the welcome by staff on reception was lovely - very friendly and helpful. the room was perfect spacious and clean. and the welcome of a pastel de nata and drink was a nice touch. staff arranged a complimentary bottle of fizz and cake for my partners birthday which was so kind and much appreciated! cons: the location was a little out of the way but an easy walk down a straight road to most of the main attractions of Lisbon
pros: Beautiful boutique type hotel . clean and very quiet .Stylish rooms . cons: Nothing
pros: beautiful hotel. very friendly staff cons: the neighborhood did not look the safest. strange people hanging around the hotel

pros: super nice building nice and friendly service clean  breakfast great as promised. Well connected to public transport system. cons: not anything to dislike: just be aware that in front of the main entrance there are two nice bars and it may be somewhat noisy until midnight.

pros: beautiful historic building. contemporary styling and artwork inside. helpful and friendly staff make you feel welcome. the bonus though is their restaurant Infame. definitely worth having dinner there at least once! cons: a little further out the way of some busier areas but still a great location.
pros: Staff friendly.  Great location off metro line.Good breakfast. cons: Bed a little soft.

pros: V friendly staff. Amazing breakfast. Room comfortable.

Reasonably easy to walk to/from downtown cons: 2 single bids (badly) stuck together is not a double bed
pros: 5* staff! Very good localization. Nice place to stay. Recommendation! cons:
pros: Very accomodating and caring staff! cons:
pros: everything was perfect! thank you so much. totally recommended cons:

pros: It can be seen that the hotel has been rebuild with a lot of efforts to make it comfortable for the guests. The rooms & beds are nice and comfortable. For breakfast you have all you would need. The location is central and easy to approach.

But high light has been the friendly and very dedicated crew make the stay a pleasure. Special thank you to the staff ! cons: The hotel is located between a main street and a public area with (nice) restaurants/bars so it can be a bit noisy if you have a light sleep.

pros: Super helpful staff. Upgraded to a nice big room with a view. Special Xmas treats - eggnog and a donut! With a little ornament. Great breakfast cons: As I was fully aware sadly no gym. Location just a wee bit out of centre - still walking but it‚Äôs 10 mins to reach the center.

pros: The moment we arrived I knew that this hotel was the BEST choice of all. The staff is kind and professional the room was clean and beautiful and what a great location everything is within walking distance. Couldn‚Äôt ask for more. cons:

pros: Incredible hospitality! Andr√© immediately made us feel welcome and appreciated as guests. The entirety of the staff were warm and accommodating. I will easily recommend 1908 to friends of mine looking to stay in Lisbon. Great breakfast buffet too! cons: Frankly not much.

pros: the restaurant was so good for dinner and the hotel was cute and clean- the guy who checked us in was wonderful i wish i could remember his name cons: location wasn‚Äôt super convenient decent walk to pretty much everything and the room was pretty small
pros: Lovely rooms great breakfast & comfortable beds - everything you need for a short stay in Lisbon cons: Reception wasn‚Äôt always staffed so sometimes tricky to find people to help with queries
pros: beautifully renovated with a modern Portuguese interior cons: rooms on the small side
pros: very nice hotel kind staff at reception nice interior good room not big cons:

pros: The staff at front desk was so helpful and accomodating - took great care of me. The room is very spacious and comfortable amenities were great. Breakfast another highlight. cons: Prices are on the high side of the spectrum but that is Lisbon nowadays.
pros: Love the design of the room restaurant and bar.  we love that it‚Äôs across the street from Ramiro and a very close to A Vida Portuguesa. cons: I don‚Äôt really care for the bug art.
pros: Stylish and comfortable. good lighting. friendly & helpful staff cons:
pros: I loved their breakfast! cons: The coffee pot hard to use and we had a shower that wasn‚Äôt working properly.

pros: The hotel staff is amazing they welcomed us with joy and helped us with several requests. The room is nicely decorated cozy and comfortable.
We would love to come back again :) cons:
pros: lovely hotel - beautiful building great rooms (although not huge) lovely staff excellent restaurant cons:
pros: staff amazing cons: room a little small.
pros: staff was amazing and so welcoming and helpful. Hotel design was also very cool. Lastly breakfast was delicious. cons:
pros: The breakfast was amazing cons: The service at the outdoor restaurant could be better

pros: beautiful design / location / staff /
food / room
*perfect cons: n/a
pros: The rooms were well appointed. The staff obliged everything we requested including booking great restaurants over a busy weekend. Recommend this hotel. cons: I liked all that they did.
pros: great location and the bed was epic. cons: loved everything :)

pros: Andr√© the manager is a wonderful guy.
He's very professional and gave us a wonderful welcome.
The staff is always ready to help and made our stay incredibly easy. cons:

pros: What did we like the most ? Andr√© who welcomed us was P-E-R-F-E-C-T (and speaking French too !). Kind listening to our needs and taking the time for good advices (thks for the restaurant!). Many many thanks again to him !
Also the location of the hotel is very convenient. We managed to do all what we wanted just by walking. And the breakfast is very tasty and diverse. cons: Just one little remark: the temperature in the room was too cold when we arrived. No need to set the climatisation that low ! (also for the environment). But after switching it off was perfect.
pros: the building is amazing to look at and has been decorated in a very unique style. cons: no drawer space - so many of our clothes were left in the suitcase which isn‚Äôt ideal
pros: Great staff and breakfasts.  Rooms were a bit small and Wi-Fi wasn‚Äôt great and kept dropping out. cons:

pros: 1908 Lisboa is a lovely boutique historical hotel with modern facilities centrally located in the heart of the city.  The  staff go above and beyond to ensure your stay is exceptional.  The  buffet breakfast is delicious and there are additional menu options. cons:

pros: Very clean and chic property comfortable rooms with large bathroom great service and the best free hotel breakfast in Portugal. It‚Äôs across the street from a great seafood restaurant. Location wise a bit further from the river but near the historic neighborhoods and castle. cons: A few drug addicts and alcoholics asking you for money in their outdoor restaurant area.
pros: Very helpful personnel at the checkin counter. cons: Access to cable TV and wi-fi could be more simplified and easier to maneuver
pros: Really liked it. cons: Nothing
pros: the architecture and the nice accomodations cons: nothing!

pros: Everything about this gorgeous totally renovated historic  hotel the exceptionally friendly and helpful staff the gourmet food and the overall great walkable position to downtown city and monuments is beyond six  star. Attention to detail and the staff‚Äôs over and beyond service  puts any five star hotel I have stayed in to shame. The staff also know all the hidden gems and restaurants in Lisbon - and they do it with the friendliest smile - we will be back that is a definite. Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to experience Lisbon at this wonderful hotel - great value and the most pleasant experience ever!! cons:

pros: Beautiful building and lovely room. The staff were super welcoming. Really enjoyed the complimentary pastry and liqueur in our room and the complimentary drink at the bar! Great variety for breakfast. Loved everything about our stay! cons:
pros: lovely hotel fabulous staff! cons:
pros: Beautiful hotel with nice rooms great restaurant and bar. The included breakfast was fantastic. Hotel staff was very friendly and attentive. cons:

pros: The staff they are great and they were really supportive to have excellent holiday I would like to send a special thanks to the both Catarina and Tiago without them we would have the same experience cons: the coffee at the bar and the cleaning in the room especially for the towels and the bed can be better
pros: location and hotel itself cons: location can be noisy
pros: staff very friendly cons: the area where the hotel is is not the best in Lisbon
pros: The staff at the hotel are so amazing and thoughtful! The rooms are well appointed and comfortable and incredibly clean :) I would recommended 1908 to my friends and family. cons:

pros: Everything! This is the epitome of great hotel! cons: Nothing. The hotel restaurant bar and staff were all fantastic. The service was phenomenal. They cared and went to every effort to make your stay special and effortless.

pros: I liked everything about this property! Superb building room was fantastic and the breakfast was first class. The staff were also phenomenal. So welcoming and passionate. You could see that they lived and breathed hospitality. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. cons: Only thing I didn‚Äôt like was having to leave.

pros: front desk people were fantastic. communications were excellent. hotel architecture and interior is very smart. the location was just north of more heavily traveled tourist area ... ideal. easy walking distance but quiet. cons:

pros: The breakfast and the dining room/restaurant was exceptional. Really well planned designed and the food exceeded expectations. Especially for an included breakfast! The staff was friendly and helpful! Our first room's AC broke and we were. immediately moved to another room. Complimentary water wine and tarts were a plus. The bed and pillows were scrumptious. cons: I wound't say disliked but if you are sensitive to noise ask for a high floor or a room facing the courtyard not the avenue. There is mild traffic noise in the morning. We were also there for the biggest holiday of the year so there was more noise from the street than usual. The only other slight criticism that cannot be helped is the location - you have to talk a few blocks to get anywhere but the tram and subways are a block away!
pros: Great breakfast cons: Useless town map

pros: Staff were very welcoming and helpful throughout our brief stay.  We spoke very little Portuguese or Spanish but they were all able to communicate in English and were extremely helpful with all our needs. cons: We would have preferred a location a bit closer to Belem or the plaza but those were small issues (and we really didn't know that until we'd been in Lisbon for a bit) so overall this place was great.
pros: Exceptional boutique hotel finished to a very high standard.  Super helpful staff who were very kind on our anniversary. cons:
pros: Amazing building. Modern stylish and clean. The staff went above and beyond to welcome us and provide us with local information. The breakfast was one of the best I‚Äôve ever had! cons: N/A

pros: the hotel is in a great location. the rooms and facilities are excellent. the staff are so helpful and really friendly. breakfast was superb and far passed my expectations. highly recommend cons:
pros: It‚Äôs history decor and accessibility within Lisbon cons: The rooms had limited wardrobes and a/c not properly working in both rooms.
pros: The staff is very nice and very helpful. Room was very clean.  Breakfast is ok. cons: usb wall plug only on one side of the bed

pros: Excellent bathrooms comfy bed with good sheets. 
Good restaurant and bar.

pros: Breakfast was fantastic. We had dinner one night too and it was lovely. cons: Nowhere to sit or lounge inside the hotel.
pros: Beautiful hotel in a fabulous flat location great for proximity to Metro. The hotel staff were the best. cons:

pros: 1.The service given by the staff is simply outstanding. I travel a lot and this degree of service is rare. 
2. The room was spacious modern clean and well maintained.
3. The old building - originally beautiful - was brilliantly refurbished and the interior design is beautiful. cons: The location is not ideal but with Taxis being cheap and abundant in Lisbon it's no big deal.

pros: The breakfast was wonderful. My girlfriend loved it too. While leaving I told the reception that I would have liked cooked mushrooms in the breakfast  and he pointed out that 'cooked vegetables' was on the menu and it contained mushrooms. I wish I had realised that... but not to worry the breakfast was great. Particularly liked the poached Pears which I had for the first time in my life.
The building was such a wonderful Art Deco building. My Girlfriend fell in love with the Building cons:
pros: Delicious rotating buffet options and a small perfectly satisfying and fresh made to order menu. Sparkling water wine coffee and fresh juice buffet. cons: Nothing I loved it here

pros: We loved everything about 1908 Lisboa! The location was central but not close to all the tourist heavy areas. So it was quiet at the right moments. The staff are so helpful and lovely. The breakfast spread is delicious and full of local delicacies including local artisanal cheeses fresh juice pastries bread fruit quiche and more. We enjoyed it so much that we booked another night on our return from Algarve. cons:
pros: Beautiful building good location exceptionally friendly knowledgeable and helpful staff. Very comfortable bed really nice breakfast. cons:
pros: Breakfast was excellent cons: Wifi disconnected when left and did not automatically reconnect when returned.
pros: very nice facilities and great breakfast buffet! cons: a little bit expensive but worth it

pros: The service was great the breakfast is good. The rooms are very clean. Historic building  really well restored and designed.

pros: Lovely staff excellent breakfast with good choice of options.

pros: This property was so much fun--very accessible not fancy but everything was tasteful and nice. Our check-in process started with free drinks and a host spending 30 minutes with us laying out activities for the next 3 days with maps suggestions and even a WhatsApp link straight to him if we were ever stuck or needed advice. Incredibly helpful. But beyond that the property was beautifully executed. Major installations from prominent Lisboa artists across the property wonderful mash-up of old and modern architecture. The bar's drinks were expertly made (best mojito ever) breakfasts were delicious. Everyone on staff focused on making sure we were happy and having a blast. Easily the best hotel we have ever chosen across the European continent. cons: Nothing--we wouldn't have changed a thing. We were very sad to leave.

pros: Staff were super friendly and helpful the room very comfortable and tasteful and the bathroom was excellent too. cons: Nothing really - there was quite a lot of people noise during the night so we had to close our window

pros: Breakfast was excellent. The room was well finished and a nice environment. The loction is a little out of the city but within easy walking distance. The staff were excellent. cons: The resturants opposite were often noisy into the early hours of the morning.  The room would benefit from a little more clothes storage.

pros: Very comfy beds . Cleanliness and decor was lovely . Staff were polite and helpful . cons: Extremely noisy if staying on a Saturday night if facing back onto the square . Music and street noise until 5am.

pros: the nicest most hospitable employees of all time especially Andre! cons:

pros: The staff were brilliant and so friendly and welcoming!

We were given a room upgrade and greeted with sparkling wine and a cake for my partners birthday!

The breakfast was fantastic - very fresh and lots to choose from and they even brought a cake with a candle on my partners birthday and even sang which I thought was fab!

The rooms were brilliant the food and the drinks! 

The hotel was walking distance to a lot of things and it was situated by a couple of cafes / bars which were cool and such good value! 

It was perfect and I would highly recommend staying here and when I return to Lisbon I shall be staying here again!

:) cons: Nothing to not like!
pros: the decor . the rooms where comfortable and clean . staff on reception very welcoming and informative . cons:

pros: What a fantastic place! Great service by every employee at the hotel. Everyone would go above and beyond to help us and make sure we enjoyed our stay. We loved the facilities and enjoyed the free walking tours provided by the hotel. Also enjoyed the free snacks provided in the room and at the lobby specially the soft serve ice cream. They were even flexible when we had to cut our trip short a night due to unforeseen issues and refunded the one remaining night. Would definitely recommend this place. cons: Absolutely nothing!

The list is endless‚Ä¶ food service cleanliness location everything was perfect! cons: Can‚Äôt think of any.

pros: Everything about this hotel is wonderful. Impeccable cleanliness  comfortable beds and delicious breakfast. Special attention should be given to the various perks and gifts for guests. The included excursions were absolutely fantastic. A particular highlight is the hotel‚Äôs restaurant offering outstanding service and incredibly tasty dishes cons: -

pros: This hotel is exceptional.  We loved everything from the gorgeous bedrooms breakfast complimentary snacks and beverages and the turn down service.  The staff were all so highly competent and friendly.  Having the concierge talk personally to us at breakfast each morning to ask who our night had been and help us plan our day was excellent service. cons: There is nothing to dislike.
pros: They went above and beyond to make sure we had a fantastic stay. I‚Äôm considering canceling our next hotel to return to this one. cons:

pros: Location is super and accessible to most of the tourist places in Lisbon. We enjoyed the complimentary walking tour. It was very informative. What makes this hotel special is the people. They are friendly warm and resourceful. We have stayed in many hotels around the world and this hotel is different. It‚Äôs not luxurious but it feels like home. cons: Nothing

pros: I loved everything about this hotel! First and foremost the staff - they work incredibly hard to provide first class friendly service. They go out of their way to make your stay special and cannot do enough for you. By far the best service I have ever experienced in a hotel. 
When we arrived we were given a free upgrade and breakfast package which was a pleasant surprise.
The location is perfect close to the waterfront and to one of the main squares which leads you towards the city centre where restaurants and shops are plenty. There is a tour bus that stops just opposite the hotel. We also did the walking tour that the hotel organises for free which was well worth doing. We were taken to see the Christmas lights and Christmas market and really enjoyed the company of the tour guide.
The hotel is immaculate with lots of nice customer experience touches such as the complimentary sweets and ice cream machine in reception the bowls of fruit and nuts around the hotel the coffee machine and soft drinks in the lounge and the tasting hour each evening. On the lower floors you can see parts of the original wall that stood there centuries ago which they have curated into an exhibition along with other artefacts. 
Breakfast was plentiful and we also ate lunch and dinner here during our stay which were both delicious and good value for money. 
I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. cons: The bed was very large and spacious but the mattress was very firm a bit too firm for me.

pros: An absolutely beautiful hotel full of history. It smells incredible the facilities and rooms are wonderful. So comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Snacks on offer all day the tours were a lovely add on. LOVE the shower what an experience. cons: There's nothing not to like can't wait to go back.
pros: Perfect location in the heart of Lisboa cons: High price and my suite was not fully furnished
pros: The staff is amazing. The location is perfect cons:

pros: The staff make you feel right at home the service is the best I have seen from the reception staff the restaurant staff to the cleaning staff. The rooms are beautiful. pros: Staff was great

The free walking tour was the perfect start to our trip. cons: Everything was perfect. The only minor annoyance we had were the noisy guests in the room next to us who woke us up very early. Not really the hotels fault though unless something could be done about soundproofing the walls!
pros: The breakfast was a highlight. The servers were attentive and friendly. Great atmosphere. cons: N/A

pros: The hotel was beautiful and clean. The access to snacks 24/7 was also amazing. However the best part of Corpo Santo Hotel are the wonderful employees. They treat you like family and make sure you have everything you need. 

We especially appreciated the two complementary tours provided by the staff. We learned so much from S√©rgio on the afternoon tour. He also gave advice about other activities to do in Portugal. 

Ana was an amazing concierge! 

If I am ever in Lisbon again I am definitely returning to Corpo Santo Hotel! cons: There wasn‚Äôt anything of concern.

pros: Location was near the water and easy to walk around town. Close to pink street and Timeout markets.  Staff everywhere to open doors etc‚Ä¶.  Snacks in the foyer and on each floor level was a nice touch cons: Almost overstaffed at breakfast and innundated with food. Slowed down the process on second and third day and had coffee first then ordered from alacarte. Staff all went out of their way to help with anything
pros: The location of the property and the staff really great and smiling ü•∞ the happy hour the snacks worth the money cons: My room was without a view didn‚Äôt like it

pros: Nuno was our tour host at Corpo santo.  The hotel offers free 2 hour walking tours to sign up for at 10:30 and 4:00.  We walked up to the castle he took multiple photos of us.  He was excellent in explaining the history of the hotel and the city.  The hotel is absolutely a 5* in every aspect.  I would give it 10 stars! At 5:30-7:00 is happy hour every day with wine tastings and free cocktail.  The lobby is filled with an assortment of candy an ice cream machine hot dogs and canap√©s and cake slices.  A very convenient location and 5 minutes away from The Time out market.  The room has a window that is sound proof from the outside noise the a/c is excellent our room was very cold the way we like it.  The hotel management knocked on our door twice each day to ask if they could get anything for us.  And at night they fix your bed.  The towels are extra large and nice.  I think the mirror must be fog free.  And the makeup mirror is great. Many English speaking channels on the tv many lighting choices for the room the pillows linens and bed are perfection. Our room had a gorgeous hand painted signed mural on the wall of a scene in Lisbon. They furnish bathrobes and slippers. The bathroom shower is an amazing experience the shower is a rain shower head and there‚Äôs buttons on the wall with your choice of green lights red lights and relaxing music with sounds.  I‚Äôve never experienced it in any other hotel.  And the bath gel and hand lotion from Molton Brown smells so nice I‚Äôm going to find out where to purchase it especially relaxing ylang-ylang.  The mini bar is filled with complimentary drinks including cokes Fanta and sparkling water.  There‚Äôs a nespresso coffee machine and also hot water kettle for tea and Nescaf√©. You also get a complimentary midnight snack available 11:00-7:00a.m. at the reception- soup of the day sandwichescheese and smoked sausages fruits and desserts. cons: Nothing

pros: Everything from the check in to the staff to the free drinks & snacks daily to the free ice cream to the free massages...EVERYTHING was GREAT!!!  This is a WINNER and in our opinion the BEST place to stay when in Lisbon.  We will ALWAYS book here when in Lisbon.  Thank you to all of the AMAZING STAFF here.  And also they took us to the beach one of the days...all for free too.  It's was GREAT!!!!  THANKS!!! cons: EVERYTHING was AMAZING!!!!  WE LOVE EVERYTHING!!!!!!!
pros: very attentive staff. cons:

pros: Everything was just amazing. The staff is super kind and friendly the hotel is so special. I came with my husband and my daughter. Everyone was super friendly and kind. The barman in the hotel let my daughter made a Moctail behind the bar at the welcome we have received a nice welcome surprise and every day the cleaning ladies left us something small in the room. The reception area is also very cool you have lots of snacks and ice cream all the time. Lovely breakfast and very nice spa area. It couldn‚Äôt be better. cons: Nothing

pros: The location was excellent close to restaurants shopping the water and plazas. The staff was extremely nice and ensured we were satisfied with our accommodations. Each day there was complimentary wine tasting and snacks in the lobby. They also provided a welcoming environment for our toddler grandson with a comfy crib a robe slippers and toy which was a nice touch. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. cons:
pros: Great location and nice rooms best hospitality and guest service very nice breakfirst and friendly bar. cons: nothing to mention
pros: Most incredible hotel! The people and service amazing all of them. cons:

pros: You‚Äôve probably noticed from my reviews that most of my hotel experiences are pretty positive but this is hands down the best hotel I have stayed in!

For the hotel itself it‚Äôs in a central location with some pretty good facilities including a spa massage service gym (gym is a bit small but got everything you need) bar with great food and drinks fancy restaurant and to top it off and a really nice lounge area on the bottom floor right alongside the original walls of the city (they discovered the walls when they were excavating to build the hotel!)

Rooms are spacious (ours even had a small balcony) quiet and the beds are super comfortable.
The standout of this hotel is the service. 

The walking tour with S√©rgio was fun and informative and he was genuinely interested in our day what we got up to and how we were enjoying our stay.

Breakfast service was very personalised with Christopher checking in and nothing was too much trouble for him and the staff (bubbles for breakfast is a nice touch!)

And lots of little things such as complimentary snacks and drinks (including daily restocking of the minibars ice cream machine and even snacks on the individual floors!) and attentive staff who were always there to help advise on what to do and where to go for tours or just a night out.

An amazing experience I hope to come back here again. cons: I actually can't fault anything.

pros: From the moment we entered the staff was extremely welcoming and accommodating. Very patient polite and friendly with our boys (5 and 8 year olds) and very helpful to my wife and me. The location was very convenient if you want to enjoy this part of Lisbon. Also the rooms were super clean tidy and spacious too. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip. cons: Nothing. May be a bigger Gym and a pool.

pros: I stayed at Corpo Santo Hotel in Lisbon and everything was truly amazing. The location was perfect with easy access to key attractions. The hotel services were exceptional and the room was extremely comfortable. I loved the complimentary massage and free snacks provided by the hotel. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and the breakfast was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel! cons:
pros: Great location amazing staff. Lots of treats in lobby and delivered to room. cons:
