pros: The hotel staff was excellent. They were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was small but it didn't appear overcrowded. They specialize in service and the service was awesome. Snacks in the lobby and on every floor were free. Ice cream free every day. Free mini bar with soda beer and water was included. Breakfast was included and it was delicious. I can go on about the service. They even give you a free 20 min massage. I definitely recommend this boutique hotel cons: There was nothing that I didn't like.
pros: Superb in every way! Not a detail was missed. Best place I‚Äôve stayed in Lisbon. cons: Nothing.
pros: 10/10 amazing ! There was nothing I didn‚Äôt like - would recommend / and come back to stay cons:

pros: The friendly fun and helpful attitude of the staff is very rare to see in hospitality these days. We used the hotel as a base 3 times this summer. Feels like CSH was our home in Portugal. Every staff member was truly excellent and nothing was too much trouble. Also the hotel goes out of its way to provide value for money with free minibar snacks lobby snacks drinks and free ice cream 24/7. I have not seen this in a jotel before. While other hotels try to squeeze as much money out of guests as possible CSH tries to give as much free stuff as possible. They are your ‚Äúold friend‚Äù in Lisbon.

Other things we loved: good AC soundproofing excellent shower and very comfortable beds. cons: Nothing.
pros: Exceptional staff and inclusions. You won‚Äôt find a better hotel experience for the money. cons:
pros: location staff cons: room slightly smaller

pros: Outstanding and friendly service (front desk dining cleaning). Includes drinks snacks etc. Rooms were comfortable and well cleaned. Central location. cons: There were some smells near lobby area.
pros: Location and staff cons: Air conditioning didn‚Äôt keep the room very cool

pros: Nothing short of excellent. This will be the first time we in our travels that the hospitality and service of the staff of a hotel is going to make it difficult to find a match. To start with the location of the hotel is great the bedrooms beautifully appointed and spacious the minibar is free and let's not forget the table of treats in the hall and in each floor. The free-of-charge walking tours provided are a wonderful way to learn about the city. Special mention to Bernardo and Ana Garc√≠a what a blast! The tour with Ana was such a wonderful way to keep discovering more interesting things about the city. Not only did we learn historical details but also got food and authentically Portuguese shopping recommendations such a great touch! Lena the masseuse who treated me did a terrific job working on all the spots I requested; and Christopher was so kind and accommodating for breakfast always wanting to provide the best experience. Thanks a lot to the hotel it has been a wonderful stay you made Lisbon even more special. cons:

pros: The location of this hotel is perfect. On a square that is not busy and yet steps from all the action and waterfront. The staff is amazing and so very helpful with everything. Super attentive to guests and their professionalism shows - just proud of their hotel. Amazing treats upon entering cocktail hour in lobby every evening was delightful and the restaurant is also very nice. Our room was beautiful and had every amenity plus tons of outlets and USB plugs. Everything in the mini fridge is free the linens and bed were super comfy and room was quiet.  We also took advantage of the spa and massages ( 20 minutes free but you'll want to extend that - and its reasonable and the therapists are great. Breakfast was elegant with loads of choices - there is nothing not to like at Corpo Santos Historical - we would LIVE THERE!!! cons: Nothing not to like everything fabulous!!
pros: Superb hospitality from all staff - catered for all our requests on a special family occasion (anniversary and birthday) . cons: Nothing

pros: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. There were so many wonderful details. The midnight ice cream was a highlight but really countless details made us feel like cherished guests and the location couldn‚Äôt be better. cons: Why do we have to fly all the way to Lisbon to stay here? üòâ

pros: Location facility and extra services like snack in the lobby free mini bar breakfast served at the table etc. It felt very special and unique vs other hotels. Also all staff were kind and their sense of hospitality was outstanding. cons: The shower and bath drain was not too good.

pros: Delightful historic venue with architectural attention to detail a staff that is well-trained and genuinely cares about the guests and several fantastic and fun surprises from check-in to check-out. I will be back for sure. cons: Needed more time to savor how wonderful it was at this property.

pros: Look no further and book this hotel for Lisbon. We did a 12 day vacation in Portugal and this was our favorite hotel by far. The staff is so kind and helpful. They went out of their way to make our vacation enjoyable. The family suite is very large and consists of two separate rooms that are connected by an outside door which allows for privacy. The breakfast is delicious. The location of this hotel is great. There are multiple restaurants within walking distance including the pink street area and time out market (which I recommend). The AC worked great. Also they have tons of free snacks which my kids all enjoyed. cons: Can't think of anything.
pros: Breakfast service and location cons:

pros: This hotel embodies all the qualities of an excellent establishment including a delightful breakfast spacious rooms a convenient location and impressive facilities and service. However what truly sets it apart is the exceptional staff. Their genuine friendliness and kindness greatly enhanced our overall experience. cons:

pros: Fantastic facilities and even better staff! Walking tours with Ana Garcia and Tomas were brilliant we did two tours. We had a fantastic massage the wonderful chap on breakfast was so friendly the gentleman in reception super helpful. Lovely little touches throughout the hotel and our stay. Our older children loved the ice cream machine at reception and the pick-and-mix sweets. We loved the wine tasting! Everything works in this hotel everything was super clean. Breakfast and service exceptional. Would highly recommend. cons: Nothing!! We didn‚Äôt want to leave.
pros: Close to everything. Great amenities such as 20 min massage walking tours happy hours snacks at the lobby. Very friendly staff cons: The noise from the outside

pros: The staff were friendly and d helpful. They were all amazing and I enjoyed their hospitality. The restaurant in the hotel had a great option of food. The location of the hotel is in central of Lisbon which was easier for to walk to the most of tourist attractions. cons: Nothing
pros: Outstanding personal service. Good food. Breakfast service was truly exceptional cons:
pros: Beautiful historical property. Well maintained cons:

pros: 1. Superb hospitality especially from Anna Sergio and Joao. 
2. Plenty of free extras including 24 hr ice cream station and snacks. 
3. Complimentary massage. 
4. Excellent location. cons: Nothing
pros: The staff was exceptionally kind and accommodating cons:

pros: Staff was amazing (helpful kind knowledgeable and made us feel welcome)!  Property and extra amenities (waters wine tasting snacks mini bar etc all included) we first class and staff matched it. cons:
pros: The service was excellent and all commodities as well! cons:
pros: Superfriendly staff alot included like free minibar cookies and fruit on the hallway icecream... cons:

pros: The staff went out of their way to ensure that our stay was excellent. They provided everything we needed and even left us a bottle of sparkling wine in our room on our first evening. The daily tours (free) they provided were also excellent. cons:

pros: Excellent location very good breakfast wonderful and friendly staff. Very comfortable and quiet room. cons: We had a small incident with the shower but it was fixed by maintenance as soon as we notified the front desk.
pros: Beautiful building. Lots of history. Great location. Room was really quiet from street noise due to secondary double glazing. cons: Nothing comes to mind. It was great.

pros: The property is beautiful very well kept an antique building renovated with all the modern necessities . Very clean the staff truly care for the guests. Everyone was very polite caring and attentive . I will stay there again no question !! cons:
pros: Everything! One of the best 5 star hotels I have ever stayed in. Will be our to go hotel in Lisbon next time we come back. cons: There is nothing we didn't like. Perfect stay. Perfect hotel.

pros: A true gem in Lisbon that made for an exceptional stay. The best staff throughout every area of the hotel the accommodations felt like a 5 star experience and all of the added perks made this a truly world-class experience.  Even the location can‚Äôt be beat. Every member of my family loved our stay Corpo Santo. We hope to return. cons: We loved everything about our stay.

pros: I stayed for 4 nights with my friend. The hotel is in a great location. Staff are extremely polite and helpful. Our bedroom was very spacious and clean. We paid extra for breakfast one morning and it was really exceptional. A full basket of gluten free breads and cakes were provided in addition to a large range of other choices. 
There were many extras provided by the hotel: a free 20 min massage historic walking tour lots of free snacks in the lobby and hallways free wine early evening and complimentary bar in the room with beers and soft drinks. cons: I would stay here again due to the staff location and all the added extras. There are just a few things I would love to see improve:
1) The bedrooms are large and spacious but really lacked a ‚Äòwow‚Äô factor for a 5 star hotel. It‚Äôs a very business like room everything completely beige with a very mass produced desk. I‚Äôd have loved more individuality to the room and a more homely feel. It needed some local art on the wall a velvet sofa and maybe some marble. 
2) The room price was high and at this price I feel all the room fees should include breakfast. I would have rather had breakfast included and less of some of the extras such as free sweets and ice cream. 
3) I felt there was some wastage with paper from the individually paper wrapped wooden spoons for the ice cream. Stainless steel spoons that can be reused would be better for the environment. I also needed a spoon in the room for tea and coffee as I didn‚Äôt like the cinnamon sticks provided.

pros: Hotel is in excellent location.  The little extras like free mini bar free bottled water happy hour free snacks all made this hotel special.   But is was the staff that make this hotel exceptional cons: Nothing
pros: Great location and amazing staff. Everyone was so welcoming and helpful. Felt like home away from home. cons:

pros: Our second time to stay here and we still love it! Staff are amazing! Breakfast was superb! Rooms were nice and clean. Bidet was a plus! cons: During our recent stay maybe since its almost summer room rates were expensive.

pros: Entire staff very friendly helpful courteous and professional.  Small buffet with snacks/coffee/ice cream machine (very popular) coffee and water was a nice option.  Breakfast in the restaurant was a great value and very good food and service.  Had a couples spa treatment (20 min included at no cost with the room and added extra time) that was exceptional.  This is truly an historic hotel with a small museum with it's history/articfacts/reading room on the lower level. cons: Very little that I didn't like but we were on the top floor and due to the architecture of the building the ceilings in the room we had were vaulted.  If you are 6'0" or taller just be careful in certain spots of the room as the headroom is a bit lower.  But I would stay in the same room again no question.
pros: #1 staff location free treats 24/7 guest services  manager Nuno is by far the best we have ever come across.. cons: No complaints

pros: The Staff was so helpful and friendly our rooms were perfect! We would definitely stay here again. The proximity to Pink Street was ideal. We LOVED everything about Corpo Santo - the snacks provided gave it that extra special touch! cons:
pros: Absolutely everything from the moment we checked in every member of staff was exemplary cons: Absolutely nothing - Perfect

pros: What a lovely place for our stay in Lisbon perfectly located close to Praca do Comercio and roughly 100 meters to the riverside. Great breakfast with outstanding eggs benedict excellent place for dinner rooms of reasonable size with all what is needed and staff with an awesome service attitude - friendly and helpful ready to provide you with all necessary information and always with a smile on the face. I would never ever go to a different place in Lisbon. cons:

pros: Everything was great. The location was the best you could have you had everything near you. The staff was great and very helpful. Special mention to the cleaning ladies. They were really amazing also the staff at the breakfast buffet was excellent too. I would recommend this hotel to everyone cons:

pros: The people were all amazing.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  The wifi was great and the location was central and easy to get to the water and shopping which was helpful. cons: The rooms were smaller than I thought and I thought there was a living space between the rooms for the junior family suite vs a hallway area.  The pictures provided were not helpful a video would have been better.  We were not able to use the massages do to our schedule so a discount applied to our rooms would have been a nice alternative.

pros: Primarily the staff everyone we came across excelled in customer service. Free snacks and ice cream in reception free mini bar walking tours with the excellent Sergio all in all a wonderful place cons: The fact we had to go home!

pros: Without a doubt Corpo Santo provides the best hotel experience you can find. Their attention to your stay is unmatched providing excellent service from the moment you arrive...The amenities alone make this hotel an exceptional value! cons:

pros: Amenity‚Äôs staff and the interior design were all delightful. The tours they provided were excellent quality.
Breakfast was wonderful variety of foods offered. cons: Loved it all!

pros: The hotel had a point of difference added extras with ice-cream great breakfast excellent staff massage and guided tour made for an excellent stay. cons: The gym was very small although you did offer a free entry into another gym down the road so probably not really a didn't like but to be honest its the only thing I can think of.
pros: Clean cons: Nothing

pros: Excellent location walkable to other major areas and restaurants. Same daily buffet breakfast served at your table with option to order from a menu. A free morning and afternoon two hour walking tour offered daily highlighting major historical sights and history. Complimentary snacks in the hotel lobby floor lobby and complimentary hot and cold beverages in the room. cons: Room refrigerator was not cold enough to keep beverages cold. House keeping did not replace small face towels.

pros: Very monumental style which you‚Äôll love once you check in! Old but filled with love and passion of staff. Once you checked in you will not want to leave or choose another place for next time visit. cons: The only small thing that we disliked was the weird noise that emerged right from somewhere of wall where the bedhead is. It occurred every single night and not been able to figure out wha was causing it leakage or something else‚Ä¶ it was a bit disturbing during night time since all the lights were out and quiet a little leaking sound would sound very disturbing! Yet this was the only shortage of all; everything else is 2 thumbs up.

pros: The entire team at Corpo Santo is friendly and 100% focused on the guest experience.  The team clearly love their work and love to share Lisbon with their guests.  We were impressed by the free daily walking tours the food and drink offered to guests at no extra charge and the incredible location.  The spa and gym were also terrific and very much appreciated. cons:

pros: We stayed at the Junior suite and it was lovely clean and very comfortable!
The location is great! The hotel offers a free mini bar and all kind of snacks in the lobby all day long and it‚Äôs so nice!!! cons: The Lobby and front entrance is designed quite outdated the seating area outside needs a refreshment. But that was the only thing that bothered me.

pros: What a nice experience at this hotel. Comfortable room and bed complimentary drinks in mini bar in room free wine tastings and snacks in the afternoon and very friendly staff. 
Free ice cream sweets and snacks every day cons:
pros: Everything was perfect. cons:
pros: The service is excellent and the rooms spacious and comfortable. Really wonderful hotel and experience! cons:
pros: The staff were exceptional! cons: Nothing
pros: Friendly at all levels with great food in restaurants cons:

pros: From the moment we arrived we greeted a warmth welcome in the reception and it was Reginaldo who look after us so well.The restaurant staff was so friendly and professional breakfast and dinner were outstanding. Very surprised when someone brought us a bottle of bubbly  and chocolate strawberries all little free treats are always available it's absolutely wonderful.We enjoyed the sauna spa turkish bath and free massage by Jessica again outstanding and I met Annabelle who is so very friendly and welcoming. Without a hesitations we would recommend your hotel top ranking in hospitality and facilities. Thanking you once again for everything you have done for us.from Mr and Mrs Brian Jones cons: We like everything and enjoying the kindness and hospitality they showed us.

pros: WE stayed here April 2024 and Hotel is superb in all aspects of our trip. Upon checking in to our 12 day stay to checking out everything was perfect. All colleagues were professional and treated us with class.  I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Your close to everything and main attractions aren't far. The everyday 24hr snacks in lobby were great! The Bistro restaurant was very good and it's nice to have great food in your own hotel.
The massage services were very professional on lobby floor level and you even get 20 min free on 1st visit.
The room had great views and being there for the 50th Anniversary for Portugals freedom allowed us to see/hear everything.  Comfortable beds and decent tv w many channels. Free snack bar in room. Everything wad superb! 
The concierge went out of his way to find me a Portuguese pastry but when he failed he had the kitchen make me some. How great wad that!!! cons: I'd say my only complaint is each morning they have complimentary breakfast which was good but the colleagues working don't have a system down. One day I'd get bread offered and next day I'd have to ask. They seem to not work together and I'd have to ask for a refill or an item table next to me was given but I wasnt.

pros: What I particularly loved about this hotel are the extra services they offer to the guests.  They clearly have the guest in mind -- from the free walking tours to massage to snacks at the lobby -- certainly going beyond the extra mile.  The staff was wonderful very engaging and would have always something to talk about with the guest not stiff but very naturally friendly.   The location is not in the very busy part of Lisbon but a very short walking distance to the site so it's very nice to wake up in the morning to some quiet time.  

We got a large room more than enough space to open our two big luggages and additional shopping.  It had a small balcony that looks out to the street I enjoyed having my coffee from there in the early morning just as the city is about to wake up.  The bed was very comfortable the toilet and bath was huge.  Perhaps my only comment would be the shower area where you have to step into a tub and there was not a hand rail to hold  on to just the swinging glass partition.   It wasn't a bother to me but might be an issue for senior citizens.  (the music in the shower and the changing lights were a pleasant surprise nice to play the relaxing music while taking the shower).

Breakfast was very good and the wait staff/servers very efficient and very good really kudos to them!  They add to the wonderful experience in this hotel.

The old city walls in the hotel basement was amazing!  Imagine having part of history just below the hotel we had originally intended to enjoy some drinks there because it looked so cozy and we just wanted to take in the beauty of the place but sadly we didn't have much time.  At least I have something to look forward to next time.

I really really highly recommend this hotel! cons: No handrails going into the tub for the shower.

pros: The staff was incredible. Hotel extras like snacks and wine in the lobby ; ice cream at all times; fresh fruit delivered to our room; free walking tours; recommended tuk tuk tour all made our stay memorable cons: Nothing

pros: The staff was incredible and really made the stay special! Everything was clean and beautiful. The free walking tour the hotel offers was one of our highlights of the trip. Corpo Santo is in a great location - we were able to walk to many sites and to transportation easily. Breakfast in the restaurant was very good and they just kept bringing food out. Snacks in the lobby were very handy given adjusting to a new time zone and the happy hours gave us the opportunity to meet other guests. The free walking tour the hotel offers was one of our highlights of the trip. Corpo Santo is in a great location - we were able to walk to many sites and to transportation easily. I was traveling with my son and always felt safe. We will definitely stay here again and highly recommend it! cons:
pros: Facilities location and most of all service cons: Nothing

pros: My stay at the Corpo Santos by far exceeded my expectiatons.  The order off the menu breakfast was excellent the candy/pastries/ice cream and drinks in the lobby were such a nice touch the 2 x day guided tours and happy hour with wine and appetizers were delicious.  Anna was the concierge we used to help us get to Sintra was so helpful and sweet.  When we arrived we were early to check in and they showed us to the downstairs area with couches wifi books I just couldn‚Äôt believe they offered such a lovely place to relax AND we received a free 20 minute massage.  I will tell ALL my friends who go to Lisbon to stay here. cons: Nothing!

pros: FREE Spa breakfast wine in the evenings and 20 minute massage ‚Äî all amazing amenities.  Location is walking distance from all the major landmarks.  I would book this hotel again and highly recommend it! cons: The bar service was mediocre.
pros: good breakfast very nice services cons:
pros: The people and their concern for all your needs. cons:

pros: The hotel is conveniently situated for the old town - a 10 minute walk.
The staff were all excellent especially the reception staff restaurant and bar staff and masseuse. cons: It was all perfect.
pros: Location superb customer service friendly staff and great amenities.. cons: N/a‚Ä¶ everything was perfectly

pros: If you‚Äôre looking to experience the best of Lisbon with wonderful people elevated service and attention and great amenities with so many wonderful delights and surprises that they offer - then this is the place for you!

Our family really enjoyed so many of the amenities and services that were included in the stay it made our very long and tiring journey so much easier to bounce back from!

We took full advantage of the very knowledgeable and interesting walking tours and we learned so much from Miguel! Even when it was raining Nuno was more than willing to grab an umbrella and show us around! 

Our kids stuffed their bellies with unlimited ice cream and we unwound with the included happy hour each evening.

I especially enjoyed the steam room and sauna! Such a wonderful gem to use at the end of a full day of walking! 

This hotel was so full of wonderful treats and delights - and it was so awesome to not feel nickel and dimed for everything. 


Corpo Santo is the epitome of what happens when people show up with care and I will be so glad to stay again for future visits! cons:

pros: Excellent check in process. We were greeted by Gonzalo and Eduardo during check in. They were very helpful and even tried to help us with restaurant reservations outside of the hotel. 
Hotel breakfast was complimentary. It was very elaborate and amazing. I would have also liked a buffet option where I could quickly grab something to eat and be done. Especially for days when we had some early plans and were in a hurry. Hotel is in  very good location and has easy accessible to public transport. cons:
pros: The staff and complimentary offerings and overall attention to detail.  Best hotel have stayed at in a long time. cons:

pros: This is hands down the best place we stayed at on our trip. The staff was absolutely amazing professional and helpful. I have never had this kind of breakfast service before and it was par none. The servers were on their game! It was such a great touch having snacks around (in the lobby and on our floor)  and the 20 minute massage that came with the room was so great we extended the time for more. The location is perfect right by pink street time out market and a couple of blocks from praca do comercio. 
There is also a great lounge area with couches downstairs that is part of the old town wall and a little display with some historical artifacts. I wish i had time to sit and read down there.. cons: Nothing ‚Ä¶i loved everything about it it really was great.
pros: Staff was beyond helpful and friendly breakfast was so nice cons: Massage was a little aggressive could have been more relaxing less rushed more calm

pros: Location was greatstaff was friendly and helpfuleverybody in hotel was awesomethey have free minibar free ice cream free fruits free wins and free lot of things their hospitality was unique 
Definitely i will come back again cons:

pros: Location was amazing.  Great walkability to most desired tourist locations including historical sites shopping restaurants waterfront. The staff went above and beyond in every aspect. Hotel was spotless and well kept. Bathrooms were great with great water pressure. The ‚Äúall-inclusive‚Äù nature of the rooms (mini bar water drinks etc) was great and we loved that they customized it to our desires. The included breakfast was very good. They were very accommodating.  They even reheated food for us from previous dinner takeaway. I loved their daily rotating snacks wine tastings sweet treats in the lobby. I also loved their late night snacks. cons: Maybe that we didn‚Äôt stay longer?  Also the fitness center at the hotel is very basic but they make up for it by giving free access to a full gym only 5 minute walk away.
pros: It was the best hotel I've ever stayed at in Europe and amazing location! cons:

pros: We loved the wholesome kindness of the staff as well as a great level of attention. Breakfast was really good and very complete although nothing out of the ordinary. All the things that are included in the price were amazing from the minibar to the walking tours. Also the hotel has a lovely area for taking meetings a calls downstairs which is half museum. cons:

pros: Everything was perfect. The staff were very polite and helpful and there were lots of things planned throughout the day including free walking tours free 20min massages ice cream in the lobby etc. rooms were comfortable and spacious and windows were soundproof cons: Nothing

pros: Clean amazing location great services. Walking tour was amazing and 20 minute massage as well! Thank you to the staff for being so polite and kind and welcoming I hope to be back soon! cons: Honestly I couldn‚Äôt find anything I didn‚Äôt like

pros: This hotel exceeded our expectations! I spent a lot of time researching hotels in the Lisbon area to find the right fit. This hotel has a great location friendly staff and unexpected surprises. There was a free city walking tour (we had Ana all to ourselves and she was fabulous!) complementary snacks and wine tastings each day free 20 minute massage complimentary mini bar with refills and delicious breakfast. Highly recommend! cons:

pros: Fabulous hotel right in the middle of this fabulous city. 
Staff were wonderful friendly and eager to help. 
Breakfast was A star
Added bonus of complimentary massage wine tasting ice cream and snacks. cons: Nothing

pros: The little touches and the staff‚Äôs attention to customers. The restaurant and the spa. cons: We had a mixed experience with breakfast where one day it was terrific and the next it was not so good.
pros: ABSOLUTELY EVERYTHING!!!! cons: All great!

pros: The location was perfect for our family. Close to the center (walking distance) but far from the noise. Several good restaurants around. The rooms were comfortable. There was always free snacks fruits etc in the lobby. Breakfast was very good. We really like this hotel! cons:
pros: The service was exceptional in all areas of the hotel from the minute we stepped through the front doors! cons: N\A

pros: Fabulous hotel.. The staff were amazing each and every one went above and beyond to give advice and help with bookings.  There was an abundance of drinks and snacks available at reception corridors and in your room .. all free of charge.  Comfortable quiet rooms with extras like hair straighteners.. can‚Äôt recommend highly enough. cons: Nothing

pros: This property is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed. The staff are the most kind and helpful people. The wine tasting and appetizer each evening is a really nice touch. The snacks in the lobby and water bottles are so appreciated!  Our room was spacious and very clean. Great pillows and large shower!  This hotel is right in the downtown historical centre plus a close walk to the seaside. They offer historical walks twice a day!  We went on both walks and learnt so much about Lisbon and Portugal.  Breakfast was great with a lot of wonderful options. Thank you to all staff for a truly wonderful stay in your beautiful hotel. cons: Nothing

pros: Wonderful stay in early February -- huge spacious room (we chose a suite) delicious breakfasts and very warm and welcoming staff. cons: This is a minor nit ... but if you are someone who enjoys a comfortable lobby to sit in and read this is not the hotel for you. While the hotel itself is gorgeous the main lobby area is somewhat "blah" with not very comfortable seating. Again this is a minor issue.

pros: Everything was excellent. Clean rooms super friendly staff small but comfy gym (they partner the second one which is bigger ask on reception) really good location. Molton Brown cosmetics in the bathroom Lavazza coffe capsules. We also appreciated complimentary minibar and snacks everywhere. In the evening there is a possibility of wine testing for free we never tried but the idea is nice. cons: Breakfast is served with classic restaurant approach when you have to make an order and wait while eating ‚Äústarters‚Äù. Although food was perfect in terms of quality the time you forced to dedicate to waiting is too long in most cases (on Sunday we spent 35 min just waiting eggs to be prepared). Thus maybe just avoid to book with breakfast if you have busy schedule in Lisbon.

pros: The hotel was incredibly clean and comfortable but what really made this a great hotel was the amazing staff. They were so friendly and hospitable going above and beyond to ensure we had a great experience. cons:
pros: The staff were exceptionally friendly and responsive to our requests. There were many nice surprises such as free 20-minute massage free happy hour drinks and snacks. cons: Nothing.
pros: It‚Äôs old money style classic and beautiful. Felt super relaxed and comfortable right at home. cons:
pros: Staff were very welcoming and attentive. cons: Nothing!

pros: This is an amazing establishment. The staff in this hotel are re-engineering the word service to be guest-centered. The hotel is a historic site . It is situated in the middle of everything you want to see in Lisbon.  The metro station is dew meters away. The area has many restaurants. The hotel's breakfast offerings are out of this world. In addition the hotel staff run their own city tour twice a day. The message spa is accessable to all guests. I can go on and on. You need to come and stay here. cons:

pros: This was our best stay anywhere im our travels 25 years of extensive. We‚Äôve stayed in high end hotels in different cities but the care here was beyond expectations. The room was gorgeous spacious super clean tastefully decorated and we had 1 and a half bath with a partition separating the sleep area from the living area. The closet space was more than we needed and the snack at night was a great touch. The historic area downstairs was a nice place to relax and have scotch and their daily wine hour was fun. We definitely recommended this hotel to anyone and everyone. Oh the breakfast was always delicious with lots of variety the bar has some fun cocktail creations and the restaurant did not disappoint. The staff goes above and beyond every minute of every day. cons: Nothing

pros: Nice hotel very clean with comfortable rooms. Good location near bars and restaurants. What makes it exceptional is the staff who are very welcoming and helpful. A special thank you to Reginald Badsam and the young man who made the effort to come outside to offer a wine tasting and some Portuguese tapas. cons: Some of the hotel food was nice but it was variable. The room service meal on the last night was much too salty.

pros: We love the location friendliness of staff and little details such as complimentary snacks and breakfast that made our stay enjoyable. cons: Although we got upgraded to their best room I think the rooms will looks so much better if they replaced their brown carpet.

pros: The helpfulness of the staff stands out - that went for everyone who worked in the hotel. 
Breakfast was outstanding - fruit cold meats cheese eggs bacon mushroom - before you even start the main breakfast. 
Complimentary snacks both in the room (minibar) and in hotel reception.
We ate in the restaurant on two occasions once from the bar menu and later a la carte - both times excellent.
Jacuzzi sauna steam room and 20 minute massage if you wanted it.
Room was spotless. Sensory shower meant you often stayed in longer than intended.
The room with the historic ruins under the bar is a great place to sip a glass of wine and relax.
Finally the location is ideal. It is 5-10 minute walk from city centre attractions/shops. Trams and Metro also nearby. cons: Nothing!

pros: The Location is perfect it‚Äôs right in the middle of Lissabon. The room was clean and comfortable. The beds were high quality cons: The breakfast can be improved. The breakfast menue is small and the Service is not what you expect in a five star hotel. Maybe the hotel Management should think about a modern breakfast concept.
pros: Property was good but the best by far is the staff every signal one were as nice and helpful as it gets and in a very genuine way. cons:
pros: Everything was perfect. Especially the location was super and every staffs were very kind and supportive. cons:
pros: The place is wonderful and the service is beautiful especially Mr. Faisal who is very helpful and everyone cons:

pros: All the amenities of the property were absolutely amazing. The staff were brilliant professional and super friendly. The rooms were kept in immaculate condition and cleanliness by the housekeeping staff. Left the property with a huge smile on our faces and super satisfied. Highly recommended to anyone looking to stay here. cons: I have absolutely nothing negative to say about my experience.
pros: Both the location and the service were excellent. We were impressed by the unlimited drinks the surprise food and the authentic building. Everyone was very nice and helpful. cons:
pros: The staff were so attentive we loved the sweets in the lobby and the different foods and the free massage. cons:
pros: Many complementary foods and drinks and very cooperative stuff and very very clean rooms  I would like to go back to lisbon because of this hotel. cons: Nothing at all.

pros: Super friendly staff. Good location. Train station nearby to explore Sintra or Cascais. Superb breakfast served at the table. Free guided city tour. In the afternoon free drinks cookies nuts & sweets. cons: can't think of anything..

pros: The staff we're unbelievable. We have never had service like this. The kindness with food on each floor down to the free bar fridge was unreal. Location was also great. cons: Absolutely nothing. Would recommend everyone stay here.
pros: Design and attention to detail. Focus on how to make it a special experience for guests. And the icecream emergency. cons: Nothing to dislike
pros: Everything! Location hotel amenities staff... the works. cons: Not enough vegan options.

pros: Service was above and beyond any previous experiences even at much more expensive hotels. Made our Lisbon trip one of our favorite moments of 2023 cons: The only small downside is that the spa is a little small and the showers in the spa are not amazing. But that's really nitpicking
pros: GREAT EXPERIENCE; THE STAFFS WERE VERY HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY FOOD EXCEPTIONAL FANTASTIC SPA AND MESSAGE SERVICES. ALL ARE Exceptionally cons: Nothing

pros: The location is great close to all the important monuments (3' away from Praca do Comercio). The staff is very polite and accomodating free food and tours are offered and the restaurant works all day long. The rooms are spacious (we had a Superior Double) and the towels were changed everyday. The food served at the restaurant was tasty. The lobby on -1 floor has some amazing relics of the city's walls totally worth visiting. cons: The hotel lacks luxury and perfection. The building from the outside doesn't give the impression of a 5* hotel the restaurant area needs upgrading and the decoration of the rooms needs some care too (artworks rugs and furniture). All in all the hotel is a bit overpriced.

pros: The lobby is fantastic with food available all day. The staff were very friendly and professional and the guided tours were excellent.
The hotel looks very ordinary from the outside but inside it is fantastic and we look forward to coming back agian. cons: I didn't like the fact that we only stayed for 3 nights because there was so much to do and see around Lisbon.

pros: Loved the very convenient location the friendly staff the restaurant the different themed floors and the beautiful room. cons: We had trouble with our A/C and our minibar but the staff was responsive.  We were not able to take advantage of all the extras the hotel offers so maybe the hotel was more expensive than we would have otherwise paid but the hotel was still wonderful!
pros: Great location and staff cons:

pros: The staff the treats available on each floor and in the lobbyand the free tour and history of the country by the staff. In addition the hotel was generally very accommodating. The lounge and all other areas in the hotel to relax outside of the room was a great idea! cons: Nothing.
pros: Attention to detail and impeccable service. cons: Not much to dislike.

pros: The staff at the reception were very friendly and their customer service excellent !  Paulo was exceptionally helpful in recommending places to visit and he was willing to help in every way possible.  Sergio Pinto was our guide on the morning walking tour; he was very pleasant and knowledgeable with a joyous personality and we enjoyed every minute of the walk! Thanks a million Sergio you were simply great.

The food was excellent - be it at breakfast lunch or dinner.  Corpo Santo Historical is a true 5 Star Hotel I would gladly recommend and will definitely go back! cons: It is a matter of preference - to me the mattress was a little too hard.

pros: Really nice boutique hotel in Lisbon. The staff could not have been nicer. We loved the building itself and the historic archaeological findings in the lower lounge are not to be missed. The bar is excellent and the bartender really knows what he's doing. The included breakfast was outstanding. The rooms are very large in this hotel but the bathroom (in our room) was a bit small. Loved all of the free food in the lobby (ice cream fruit candy desserts). cons: Corpo Santo is located very near Lisbon's famous Pink Street which is a series of bars. It was loud in the middle of the night.
pros: Location great staff very hospitable very generous clean cons: Nothing. All was great; a bit pricey but well worth it

pros: The staff are the biggest selling point and draw to this hotel. Everyone was friendly especially the front desk and guest services staff. We really appreciated the efforts from Anna Miguel Nuno Gon√ßalo Ling John and the guys who greet the guests at the door. This is my second stay at CSLHH and as I said before there are plenty of 5* hotels and perhaps there may be some with better decor or facilities but as long as you keep up the high-standard of customer service you will continue to get booked up. 
The hotel overall is very clean and has a very cosy home-away-from-home feel. The freebies are a nice touch including but not limited to ice-cream and snacks in the front lobby and the free evening drink and ‚Äòmidnight‚Äô snack. The free walking tour is very unique and good enough to be a paid service. Anna did our tour and you can tell she is passionate about the city and very knowledge with history. 
The full length mirror was great and it was helpful to have an iron and iron board in the room (without requesting it). However the standard of the iron and the board itself (kept collapsing) was poor. 
The location is brilliant as it‚Äôs close to many of the tourist sites and the hotel can help you to book personalised tours if desired. cons: These aren‚Äôt major gripes but perhaps areas of improvement. We only had breakfast in the common room downstairs one time but in honesty we wouldn‚Äôt have returned (even if we had further days left). The food was average at best. The service was again excellent. On the contrary the room service food is to a high standard (including the breakfast delivered to the room). 
It would have been really helpful to have a keyhole in the room as it felt slightly unsafe when someone knocked on our door and we weren‚Äôt able to check their identity prior to opening the door. Furthermore the bathroom door didn‚Äôt have a lock. But this is a small detail.

pros: Loved the extra care that went into looking after travellers such as snacks in the lobby and turn down service. Special shout out to Ana for her fun and informative free walking tour of Lisbon cons: All perfect

pros: Breakfast is included and and quite good.  We had lunch there a couple times and was great. Nice little wine list. Staff very helpful and friendly. Room was spacious.  Concierge (all of them) very knowledgeable about local food scene and good reference if you want to confirm if the restaurant choices you made are authentic or traps.  They are happy to provide other options as well. cons: Location is at bottom of the hill so traversing by foot to dinner at nights in nice clothes takes some adjustments and effort and you are likely to break a sweat. And don‚Äôt even think about heels ladies.  It‚Äôs ok the footwear being practical seems to be the norm out of necessity there.  Exterior awnings seem a little tired and worn but inside is very clean.  The jacuzzi wasn't super warm or working well. The area around the hotel seemed a little sketchy with the skateboarders and what sometimes looked like homeless around the church across the street.  We didn't feel in danger but it was a first impression that initially concerned us.  It‚Äôs a highly trafficked area and the major tourist spots behind the Square are very close.

pros: Very nice hotel with very friendly staff. Concept of the hotel makes a different to a lot of standard ones. Hotel is also good located for discovering Lisbon. cons: Only one constructive feedback as I liked the hotel very much: the organisation during the breakfast could be a little improved. But this is a small issue.

pros: This hotel was such a special surprise! Great location! The two complimentary tours offered by the hotel were WONDERFUL...small groups with guests only. Both are walking tours so be prepared for steps hills rocky sidewalks but a lot a full facts and history. The staff was extremely helpful and full of knowledge. The HOHO bus stop is across the street so that was convenient. Our room was modern clean and big. The complimentary breakfast was not a buffet but you order off a menu! Each evening they serve wine and hors d'oeuvres along with 24/7 soft serve ice cream! We highly recommend this hotel planning to stay again and at their other properties! cons: Our stay was too short! Everything was wonderful.
pros: It‚Äôs absolutely fabulous in all aspects and they went the extra mile to make our stay pleasant cons:

pros: This is a property in a class of its own!
It is 5* in every aspect you would expect like standard of rooms service etc- but Corpo Santo Hotel offers so much more:

There is a chic to the decoration of common areas and accommodation - for instance with beautiful old letters and books displayed on side boards‚Ä¶ hand painted wall pictures‚Ä¶and period features: our room had the old huge wall safe inbuilt ( the building was a bank in its previous incarnation) and the most mind-blowing thing of all‚Ä¶. the incredible lounge which incorporates beautifully part of the 13th century fortifications which were found on the extensive building work necessary to change the building into a hotel.

The breakfast was a feast for body and the eye‚Ä¶. Eggs freshly prepared for each guest ( the perfect poach egg!) ‚Ä¶served in little enamel pans tea served in heavy Japanese-style teapots‚Ä¶..

But a sixth extra star goes to the staff who all without fail go over and beyond their remit. Nothing is too much. They thrive under the guidance of the guest relations manager Pedro Falconi. Pedro himself offers 2 free guided walks per day to give an insight into the beautiful city of Lisbon. He does that with so much care and love‚Ä¶. it feels like we have made a friend for life! Thank you so much Pedro!

I won‚Äôt even go into detail of all the other loving little treats Corpo Santo Hotel hold in store‚Ä¶. an ice cream machine water cakes and fruit at all times in reception a free 20 minute massage for everybody‚Ä¶.

We can‚Äôt wait to return! cons: We liked everything
pros: all went well  location is to be explored to reach main center cons:

pros: The location of the hotel with a five minute walk to sights and shopping is a plus. Upon my arrival the greeting was unforgettable I was immediately taken care of. My luggage was taken to my room the room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was nothing lacking. After seeing the fully stocked stacked fridge with snacks sodas and water I smiled to myself yes! Iron safe water awesome rain shower with led change lights and spa sounds I'm loving this hotel. A Free massage 24 hr ice cream complimentary umbrella when it rains free water to stay hydrated going out or coming back in beautiful historic hotel with basement lounge and (snacks/juice) that I discovered one evening. The mouth watering midnight snack of assorted soups sandwiches cookies pastries and drinks after a long day out was a welcoming sight. The restaurant was beautiful and the meals were tasty.
What I remembered most was the helpfulness of the staff. The free tour with Pedro Falcao was an amazing introduction to Lisbon. If you miss this tour you missed out on the history of Lisbon and the significance of the historic hotel. Pedro is a walking history book of everything Lisbon. If you need help booking tours places to eat shopping ect he knows it all and will go above and beyond to help you thank you Pedro.
 I want to also say thank you to the one hotel staff member that went above and beyond to ensure that I arrived at the correct train station and was able to board my train to Porto. I was so grateful for this as a female solo traveler to receive that whatsapp call from the hotel just to make sure everything was OK. I Can't wait to return to Lisbon and Corpo is my new home away from homeüòÅ‚ù§Ô∏è cons: There was nothing to not like

pros: The staff were incredibly helpful. Pedro and Joao and Nuno especially would check how you were going and if you needed anything. My husband has some walking difficulties and Pedro suggested we book a tuk tuk tour so we could see the city and cope with the hills. They arranged it all for us and briefed the driver on our needs. In St Anthony festival they put on a special bbq outside the hotel. All the staff were so excited about the festival
and sharing it with guests.
There were always unexpected little treats being given to guests and complimentary bottled water. There were complimentary snacks in the foyer. The hotel offered each guest a complimentary 20
minute massage. When we left the hotel to catch the train Pedro arranged picnic box lunches for us to take. Pedro was soo helpful
when my husband sprained his ankle and he organised ice for him and offered to arranged medical attention. Nothing  was too much trouble for him. Thanks Pedro. 
Also- the mattress on the bed was excellent. when we first checked in we were allocated a room with a shower bath when I had requested a walk-in shower- Joao sorted it straight away and made sure the new room was suitable for us. cons: The exterior at the hotel entry is a bit shabby and underwhelming on arrival. But the helpful staff compensate for any draw backs with appearance or decor.

Thank you for your hard work sincere smiles and great hospitality! Thank you for wonderful 6pm wine and snacks tasting! May God Bless each and all personnel! pros: All of the previous reviews were completely right when they said that this is a five star hotel in terms of how helpful friendly and kind each member of staff is. The facilities and room were also top class but not in the usual five star snobby way! All the special touches (like surprise sparkling wine and chocolate strawberries delivered to our room) made our experience even better. The breakfast was excellent and there were gluten free options that I (as a Coeliac) could have. 

We especially enjoyed going on the free walking tour with Ana - she was such a lovely and funny person. We asked her to recommend a nearby restaurant and she booked us a table at O Portugu√™s - it was FABULOUS one of the best meals we have ever eaten. Thank you so much Ana! cons:

pros: Location excellent staff went above and beyond. Rooms perfectly appointed and extremely clean.  Added extras such as complimentary ice cream in reception midnight snacks minibar in room walking tours and massages made the stay extra special.  Daily turndown service and surprise gifts for my husband's birthday (celebrated during our stay) really made a difference. Food in restaurant is excellent as are the cocktails in Bar 146. The "living room" area provided incredible insight into historical Lisbon amazing to see in the hotel. If you are planning a trip to Lisbon you have to stay at this hotel- by far the best experience we have encountered on any city break. cons: We couldn't fault this hotel.

pros: The staff were excellent. They went all out to ensure we were well taken care of. Pedro and his staff were amazing! My kids enjoyed it so much that they could not stop talking about Corpo Santo or Pedro! cons:

pros: Everything!! Treated us like royalty the entire time--even left a little surprise in our room because it was out anniversary. Perfect location (bookstand and trolley stops out front) excellent food/drink (to-die-for risotto and novelty cocktails) amazing amenities (free walking tours and evening canap√©s) and delightful staff (attentive and interested). Guests CANNOT miss the downstairs "living room" with archaeological excavations and lending library. cons: Unfortunately I was not able to leave a tip for the spa staff. Upon checkout we paid for all extra services but they could only take gratuities on behalf of the hotel. We had no more euros and no time to get any before departure flight.

pros: Oh my gosh!  What an incredible experience from beginning to end!  Every team member was professional knowledgeable and genuinely friendly from the greeters at the door to the dining staff and the wonderful ladies who provided a fabulous spa treatment. The bonuses and surprises ranged from a self-serve ice cream machine assorted snacks  to a daily chef experience in the early evening available to hotel guests. Pedro even surprised the us with hand made soap roses on International Women's Day!!  Our rooms were impeccable with all the amenities! We took advantage of the interesting walking tours to learn more about the city.  The front desk made check in/out easy and also arranged transportation shuttle service to the airport. We absolutely loved our Lisbon experience and thank the entire staff for making out stay memorable.  The Portuguese people are so proud of their culture and their country! You can feel it when you chat with those who were born and raised there! cons: Can't think of one thing that I didn't like.
pros: we loved it! cons:

pros: Can't beat this location - was able to walk to major sights and to restaurants in Lisbon including with two young kids. Also really commend their wonderful staff and great welcome perks for guests (free 20 min massage snacks in the lobby throughout the day welcome baskets complimentary refreshments from the mini-bar free walking tours). Our toddler also loved the soft serve ice cream machine in the lobby! cons: Rooms had a bit of wear and tear (though perhaps expected for a historical hotel) and breakfast service was a bit slow on some days (though the staff were very friendly).

pros: I highly recommend this property first and foremost because of the attentive and friendly staff. Big shout out to Pedro and Andre.  The hotel offered 2 complimentary walking tours hearty breakfast midnight snacks pre dinner snacks and there‚Äôs an ice cream vending machine in the lobby. After a long day of walking the hills of Lisbon we availed of the complimentary massage. The housekeeping is impeccable. Our room has a terrace that has views of the Pink Street.  The mini bar is complimentary and there‚Äôs a Nespresso machine if you don‚Äôt feel like going down to the lobby for coffee.  A pillow menu is available depending on your sleeping needs. I‚Äôve never seen this in any other hotels before. 
We were celebrating our birthdays and they provided us with cake and wine. What a pleasant surprise! cons: None

pros: Every single person on staff is exceptionally kind and attentive with little treats to surprise guests throughout the stay. Staff members are available should you need anything but they also are not intrusive if they understand their guests may not need as much guidance (which was my case as it was not my first time in Lisbon). They are also incredibly patient should you want to try and speak Portuguese no matter how poorly. The staff is definitely what will make Corpo Santo my go-to hotel for all future visits in Lisbon. cons: The hotel has invested in soundproofing however noise from the street can still be heard when passerby are being loud. You can also hear when other guests are not being considerate and talking loudly in the halls or stomping their feet and dropping their suitcases on the floor in their room but that would happen anywhere. 

As noted by many before the food is nothing exceptional but it is perfectly adequate when sticking to simple dishes and there is plenty.

pros: everything but in particular:
- perfect location. centrally located downtown near the river. walking distance to most major attractions. close to bus stops metro tram and train stations
- service. the best you can ever ask for. they went above and beyond to help us. they even called a doctor for us when we were not feeling well. they were always smiling trying to make sure that we are happy with our stay
- concierge- excellent service. they booked the tours and transportation for our family
- amenities- free midnight room service free fruits water sodas breakfast and ice cream. minibar absolutely free. it‚Äôs like an all inclusive hotel
- dining- their breakfast is delicious.

pros: Absolutely everything but especially the staff! They are all stellar from the front desk to  the porters to the massage specialist‚Ä¶everyone greeted us warmly and attended to all our requests. The goodies table at the entrance makes you feel home for Christmas and NYear‚Äôs. cons: Nothing at all.

pros: We stayed for 8 nights in December. This is one of the best hotels we have stayed at! The hotel and room were very clean. Service from the friendly and cheerful staff was prompt and supportive. In particular Leticia was most helpful throughout our stay from when we arrived in the early morning after a long flight to our departure. Thank you Leticia! The hotel is in a great location near the river and close to downtown. We appreciated the heritage aspects of the hotel - nice to stay in an old historic building which has been completely modernised. The blending of old and new was perfect. The included breakfast was delicious with a varied menu so we had a variety of options over an 8 day stay (eggs bacon pancakes porridge). Ana did a good job of making sure that my wife's gluten free requirements were attended to. Finally - the hotel restaurant - we ate there twice - was superb - providing meals of great quality - and the restaurant staff were professional and courteous and helpful. A fabulous and unique stay! . cons: A small problem with the drainage of the sink in our bathroom was quickly fixed.
pros: it‚Äôs central location cons: we liked everything

pros: could not fault the hotel location or the staff. Each individual member of staff made us feel welcome and extremely helpful. The hotel offered walking tours of Lisbon (free) to learn much about the history of the city. The hotel itself has a rich history to offer. cons: Nothing

pros: Fantastic hotel. I would stay here again. Very clean and spacious room comfy bed. We ate almost every meal at the restaurant. Perfect location for walking around or public transportation. The staff was extremely accommodating. cons: There were no negatives

pros: We received a dirty room but it got rectified properly. We got a free upgrade rooms were big with two toilets (with bidet) and with almost all the necessary utilities that you need. The shower is great the noise outside is non-existent the windows open fully and the A/C works even in December. The hotel offers a free 20-minute massage and jacuzzi access. There are free snacks coffee and ice cream in the lobby all day. They offer a walking free walking tour twice a day. The staff are friendly and professional. I would return to this hotel. cons: The location isn't centric. It's a 10-minute walk to the nearest metro station and a 10-minute walk to the city centre (shops cafes restaurants..). The bed wasn't the most comfortable. There was some sort of maintenance work being done next to our room in the morning that we weren't notified about.

pros: This is one of the few hotels in the world that would make you choose your vacation destination by the hotel. I can trully find no words to describe this rare jem. The extremely comfortable room the impecable cleanness the facilities the perfect location the excellent breakfast the beautiful and instructive trips (we were with the most friendly Miguel)  the spa the complimentary things you get (spa massage midnight snacks trips). The Bar the excellent restaurant and the unique Fernandina wall room all complete the most extraordinary experience. But above all is the most friendly and helpful staff. Each one of them does just anything to make your staying purely unforgettable !!! Definitely will come again! cons: Can't think of anything!

pros: This hotel was a pleasant surprise.
The staff is very kind and professional I would like to mention Miguel from the lobby who is extraordinarily happy kind ready to help and very natural in his job. 
I had a superior deluxe double room which was a very confortable and spacious room (around 40/50 mp2). 
The rooms and the service are definetly of a high level according to a good rated 5 star hotel. 
I really enjoyed the general attitude of the hotel to be generous with the guests: snacks / drinks / sweets / fruits complementary in the lobby mini bar completmentary 2 x refill of minibar / day.
I also enjoyed their shower with ambiental lighting and music. 
The room service is very good we had a club sandwich. cons: The brakfast is fundamentally wrong. This is a shame becouse I know the hotel made great efforts in all areas including the Breakfast. 
It‚Äôs ok to replace the buffet with a la carte breakfast ONLY if the a la carte breakfast is better than buffet and this is difficult to do requires lot of creativity. 

In current breakfast the menu is very very poor. 
They dont have in menu things they are actually seve to Brakfast drinks and bread for example. You always have to ask or to guess what kind of coffe they have what kind of juice what kind of bread and so on.
They also have important things missing from the menu like cheese olives. They dont have in u hummus/guacamole/or other things like that. It‚Äôs a very basic menu which I have to mention that offer good varienty of eggs.

The breakfast desserts are ok but not the american pankcakes which were a big fail: I ordered pancakes and hot something like a cake muffins without any taste of pancakes. 

I hope the hotel will do something to change the breakfast becouse I would really like to come back here. 


The spa area is not very big we have not enjoyed it too much becouse the jacuzzy had cold water inside. 

Overall a good price/quality deal.

pros: We stayed for our honeymoon two years after originally booking having had to cancel and rearrange multiple times due to the pandemic. The staff make this hotel the best we have ever used everyone - without exception - is friendly helpful and kind. We made use of the free massage the team came to our room at a time of our choosing. What a wonderful experience. The bed was comfortable the room quiet and the bathroom well equipped. Breakfast was good and plentiful. We had dinner on the first night tasty and good value. The little touches really made our stay memorable. cons: The bedside lighting is odd the switches don‚Äôt seem to work in an intuitive way.

pros: We stayed at Corpo Santo for two nights and chose this hotel based on their excellent reviews on various websites. I had very high expectations coming here and was quite impressed overall.
While the rooms public areas and facilities didn‚Äôt exactly scream 5-star hotel you could see that they really made an effort. The building a historic one was well-kept with a lot of personal touches and perks (including but not limited to complimentary massages cocktail hour snacks and minibar). 
What really stood out however was the service oriented staff. From the front desk to the concierge bellboy and everyone I crossed path with; you could feel that they put the guests‚Äô best interest as the highest priority. It was both a service with a smile AND going to the extra mile. 
Special shoutouts to Victoria who helped me getting my soaking wet shoes dried Diana and Beatriz who helped us with activities and reservations throughout the stay and Paulo who made my return to the hotel amusing each time.

Despite some minor shortcomings I would have given Corpo Santo the highest possible score as the team really went above and beyond. cons: Sadly my experience was completely tarnished during our visit to the hotel bar on the last night.
The waiter who took our order brought me the wrong beer which of course is absolutely not an issue in its own. Mistakes can happen we are all humans after all. What cannot happen and is completely unacceptable on the other hand is him starting an argument with me; blaming me for ordering the wrong item. For the sake and clarity of the review I won‚Äôt go into granularity. But even IF I was ambiguous with my order there is no need trying to educate your guest on the differences of beer especially a connoisseur who has tried thousands.
Long story short the waiter continued blaming and lecturing me on the differences of beers. Despite my attempts of stopping this argument - ‚ÄúPlease just bring me the beer I wanted‚Äù - he continued his barrage. At this point I stood up and left the bar.

Needless to say my final review score reflects this incident. While it can be seen as a small fly in the ointment it has left a major aftertaste; sadly not of the beverage that I ordered in the first place.

pros: Absolutely great location very hearty and tasty breakfast lots of free drinks and snacks.  Really enjoyed the combination of archaeological sites and modern architecture. Highly recommended. cons: It's a pity that I didn't have time to enjoy the hotel's spa wait for next time.

pros: Everything was exceptional. I loved the service the staff the breakfast the unlimited snacks the water the mini bar the massage the jacuzzi. Everything was incredible. I will definitely return soon. cons:

pros: For short - I loved it. One of the best hotels I've stayed so far.
- Location excellent! Close by to the river side all main attractions within walking distance. Most importantly living in the Corpo Santo gives you an impression that you are in the middle of the all events. 
- Breakfast - we didn't take there are plenty of amazing places to eat around (even for vegan !!)
- Room - spacious with coffee machine and kettle; bathrobe and slippers available
- Living room - that place is magnificent. I loved that we could just chill there being next to the historical site
- Staff - super friendly and helpful they are amazing at making you feel special
- Included massage - that was my first and I wish all hotels were providing it.
- Snacks and drinks available at all times 
- Included tour through the city which is taking place twice a day. We had a pleasure to go for an afternoon walk with Beatriz and we really enjoyed it. cons: We couldn't figure out the lights - they kept turning on in the morning.
Sometimes the internet signal was very weak.

pros: We stayed here our last night is Lisbon and it was a big treat. The room was large and comfortable. The staff was impressive and went above and beyond to ensure we had a great stay. Hotel offers many amenities including a free snack station ice cream station and wine happy hour. We wish we could have stayed longer to take advantage of all their amenities. It is a pricey hotel but definitely worth the cost. If it fits in your budget I highly recommend staying here. cons:

pros: the hotel is excellent very friendly service the location is perfect for all city attractions. we also enjoy the SPA and my wife had excellent massage by Marcel. highly recommended!!! cons: all was excellent
pros: amazing property worth a visit cons: nothing! it was just perfect

pros: We loved everything about this hotel & the staff!!! They go above & beyond to help to accommodate and the service is amazing. The restaurant is wonderful too. Plus there is an amazing floor below reception with ancient ruins that have been preserved and presented in an incredible manner. The staff made us a to-go back for our early morning trip to Porto and even helped load our van when we left for Madrid. Homemade ice cream in the lobby and fresh snacks! We will stay here again and recommend to all our friends and family! cons: That we did not stay here long enough!!

pros: This beautiful hotel was worth every cent. It is in a great location and made it convenient to walk to almost all of our activities. The staff was very attentive the room was beautiful spotless modern and comfortable. I can't even tell you all the little included extras because I want you to be pleasantly surprised. The restaurant on site was also amazingly good. This will be my hotel when I return to Lisbon which I will soon because I totally fell in love with the city and the country of Portugal. cons: It's pricey but well worth it. There are not washcloths nor an iron in the room which I am used to having in a hotel room but I should have researched better.

pros: I loved the hotel and the staff who were always happy to help me. They were funny and kind. The cocktail hour was really nice and the snacks were actually lovely. I am disabled and everybody went out of their way to help. I loved the neighborhood. There were so many extras that added to their exceptional hospitality. I loved the neighborhood. It was close to many attractions that I could visit on my mobility scooter. I loved watching the kids across the square learn to skateboard. It was a happy place and not pretetentious. cons: The bathroom was set up for someone in a wheelchair so it didn't suit my needs. I wish every hotel had grab bars by the toilet and in the shower in every room so it would suit someone with limited mobility but not in a chair.

pros: Review Corpo Santo Hotel Lisbon

In August 2022 I spent 7 nights at this beautiful hotel as a solo female traveler.  The hotel was centrally -located and I was able to walk to several main tourist sites.   The location was perfect!

The hotel goes above and beyond to spoil its guests.  The hotel offers complimentary snacks fresh fruit  ice cream and bottled water in the lobby 24/7.   Hot and cold midnight snacks are served nightly in the lobby. The hotel hosts daily complimentary wine and snacks in the lobby every evening at 6:00 p.m.  The hotel also offers free walking tours to guests and complimentary 20-minute massages in the spa.   Breakfast was included in my rate.  I enjoyed breakfast every morning at the on-site restaurant. The food was fresh and tasty.  The staff was over-the-top with excellent customer service.   I felt like royalty during breakfast with several servers tending to me making sure I had everything that I needed.   Immediately upon sitting guests are served a basket filled with baked goods a plate of sliced fresh fruit and a plate of meat and cheese.  Then you are offered a menu to order freshly prepared hot or cold breakfast.  I was never able to finish all of the food (despite having a large appetite).

The beds are extremely comfortable and the linen is very plush.   I was pleased to find a hair driver flat iron coffee maker kettle and a flat iron in my room. cons: On several occasions despite having a ‚ÄúDo not disturb‚Äù sign on my door I returned to my room to find that my room had been cleaned.  One morning a housekeeper entered my room unannounced as I was undressed.   Unfortunately the complimentary mini bar did not work and the drinks inside were room temperature.   I called the front desk a couple of times.  Eventually the refrigerator was replaced.  


Apart from a few minor issues my stay at the Corpo Santa Hotel Lisbon was fabulous.  I was sad to leave this hotel.   Diana Guitana Leticia Paul Magalhaes and Beatriz Silvestre were amazing as was most of the staff.

pros: The environment provided a pleasant experience to be had.  The dining service was amazing fast and delicious.  The staff made my visit feel like I was home (away from home).  Every single aspect of my stay was memorable.  I will come back to Corpo Santo.  Thank you. cons:

pros: The hotel was in the perfect location it was beautiful  and above everything else the staff was outstanding.  It was the best service I have ever have had in any hotel - ever.  Truly exceptional!! cons: Nothing. Everything was outstanding.

pros: The location was fantastic. I loved the hotel decor and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. The restaurant served a wonderful breakfast and all the staff were excellent. cons: The room was a bit small and I kept stubbing my toe on the feet of the bed

pros: The hotel has a very pleasant atmosphere friendly attentive staff who give you the feeling that they do their job with passion. The employees always seemed relaxed and in a good mood even when there was a lot going on. I felt completely welcome. Everything was very clean and comfortable. I am a noise sensitive person and had moved from another hotel to the Art Legacy because of the noise. The room here was very quiet and the windows were well insulated I heard very very little of the traffic outside so I was able to sleep easily. I was happy that I moved here and finally had some peace and quiet. The breakfast was very rich and there were lots of healthy things. There was a buffet and you could order specialties √† la carte it was very tasty. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who values ‚Äã‚Äãa good atmosphere and/or is noise sensitive. cons: The locking mechanism of the doors like most hotels is something that could be improved. The doors close loudly and you can hear it when neighbors leave their rooms. It was better here than in many other hotels but it can still be optimized. There were also sharp corners on the bed that I hit myself on a few times.

pros: I had a great stay at the Rate Art Legacy Hotel Baixa-Chiado in Lisbon. From the moment I arrived I was greeted with a lovely welcome drink which set a pleasant tone for the stay. The staff was exceptional‚Äîfriendly accommodating and always willing to help with recommendations or any requests. The room though decorated in bold red tones was still comfortable and stylish with all the amenities you could need. The location couldn‚Äôt be better‚Äîright in the heart of the city center within walking distance to many iconic landmarks and attractions. It‚Äôs a perfect base for exploring Lisbon. Overall a very enjoyable experience! cons: The room although stylish had a bold red color scheme that while unique made the lighting feel a bit dim. It would definitely benefit from brighter lighting to create a more inviting atmosphere.
pros: Chic & boutique excellent staff cons: Bathroom minimal usable shelf space for toiletries no bedside cabinets to put drinks on and a mirror in bedroom would have been handy but not essential
