pros: Perfect downtown location very nice design kind staff amazing breakfast! cons: Everything was great we really enjoyed our stay. We will definitely come back!

pros: Breakfast was included buffet and made to order options. Hugo the dining captain was super helpful and accommodating.
The hotel bar has a great wine selection. Tiago the evening bartender and server was cracking us up and provided guidance for our last day in the area.
The reception staff were very responsive especially Jo√£o who popped up whenever we needed something! Denise also gave us an informative hour long walking tour. 
Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a central location and beautiful hotel. cons: The only issue during our stay was a fickle AC unit. The staff were super helpful and eventually it was resolved.
Also the original pillows were scratchy but the hotel offers a pillow menu to choose your preferred pillow. Solved the issue immediately.
pros: The hotel was as we expected for a relatively new hotel. It was tastefully decorated. The staff were extremely nice and the breakfast was excellent. cons: Nothing comes to mind.

pros: The staff were extremely polite and went beyond the call of duty to ensure our comfort.
Nothing was any trouble.
The hotel decor is unusual but lovely.
Breakfast was excellent. cons: Nothing.
pros: The staff were great. Location amazing. Nice rooms! cons: N/A

pros: I expected more cons: No gym
The breakfast should be better 
The service should be better

pros: It has been freshly renovated and it looks spectacular. It is located in one of the best areas of Lisbon. cons: The only downside was the rooms that face the courtyard don‚Äôt get a lot of sunlight.
pros: It was beautiful and comfortable and in a perfect location.  The staff were all wonderful - friendly and accommodating. cons: I have no complaints

pros: Staff were very courteous and helpful
Breakfast was excellent 
Location was perfect cons:

pros: One of the most incredible hotels that I have ever stayed at. The location is fantastic with plenty of easy access to a whole world of sights sounds and flavours. The staff are exceptional in every way that you can imagine. Breakfast is a must experience feast. Dinner at the restaurant felt like a fine dining experience. The rooms are so stylish and you will feel like are walking through a colourful dream. The head chef is supremely talented an absolute gentleman and chatted with us as if we were his old friends coming to visit him. Their entire team will make you feel like royalty. You will leave with a heavy heart because you couldn‚Äôt stay longer but will still manage a smile because you gifted yourself this experience. cons: There is nothing that I didn‚Äôt like about this gem.

pros: From arrival the hotels team were exceptional in their attention to detail from check in introduction to hotel and location to include your room. Meals prepared in the restaurant (breakfast/dinner) were excellent prepared to your taste by the team both chefs/front of house...... The personalized walking tour provided by duty managers of the rich history of Lisbon and locations within 1km radius of hotel was outstanding as an introduction to the city and its rich history.
The attention of duty teams each day in lobby restaurant bar waiters & porters was superb and the unseen cleaning team in preparation of facilities ensured no details were left unchecked at any time. Many thanks to all and look forward to our return cons: A little more space in room may be appreciated but not a lot the duty teams can do about layout

pros: Beautiful hotel.  Staff very friendly and clearly took pride in working there. Good coffee in the room and beautiful bathroom. cons: I am familiar with small European hotel rooms but this was tiny - about 12 inches of space at the end of the bed and not much more on either side.
pros: Everything cons:

pros: The location was perfect close to the metro station. The hotel is beautiful with amazing design. Staff is service-oriented always willing to help guests and make them feel welcome already from the arrival. Very comfortable bed and big rooms. Well-organised cleaning service. cons: Breakfast could be more diversified.

pros: Well situated a 7 min walk from all the action. The staff was extremely helpful went way beyond expectations and are super helpful! The hotel is exceptionally clean and beautifully designed. cons: Rooms are quite small.
pros: Amazing location amazing team and facility cons: All was good no complains

pros: Firstly it was central to everything. The staff were brilliant - all were attentive and positive. They knew the local area and amenities very well.   They provided their honest views when asked and we booked a Tuk-tuk tour through them to the old town. cons: Breakfast was a little slow. We had to wait for coffee and our a la carte orders one day came out lukewarm - even though they were made in front of us. However did not disappoint on taste and freshness. Did find that the lack of normal tea in our room was annoying but quickly rectified.
pros: The property was beautiful and well appointed cons: Everything !

pros: Everything amazing staff from the reception to the departure the desire to help always with a smile the location - the best there is an excellent breakfast a very spacious room clean and pleasant to stay. cons: nothing

pros: The location was fabulous and staff went above and beyond for us... It was the small details that made the experience enjoyable. Everyday there was a new handwritten note thanking us for choosing the Art Legacy Hotel and asking if there was anything more they could do for us they couldn't everything was perfect. Their wine selection at the hotel bar/restaurant was fabulous and made a lovely back drop to the area. cons:
pros: Quite good and good variety cons: N/a
pros: Great location decoration and comfort is exceptional and staff is helpful and kind cons: Would not recommend the dining but selection of spirits & wine is excellent

pros:  cons: Rooms are not that big but its ok

pros: Excellent location excellent service amazing design of the entire hotel and the room. A beautiful view overlooking all the 
 - important sites. We would especially like to mention the entire hotel staff and especially the reception staff -

pros: Amazing decor and the staff were so helpful and attentive. Nothing was too much trouble to help

pros: The property was awesome!   Clean in a fantastic location totally upscale!  I‚Äôm not sure what else they could have offered to make our stay better. cons: I‚Äôm not sure what else the staff could have done to make our stay better.  The hotel was awesome.

pros: The staff.   We felt at home.. seldomly have I experienced the feeling of being ‚Äòhome‚Äô like I did at the Art Legacy.. from start to finish cons: The lighting..  perhaps because we traveled now during winter and because it rained every day the lighting in the room was minimal..

pros: A new hotel!!! And what a hotel wow!!! Centrally located right in the city centre of Lisbon very well designed and the room was beautiful. Well decorated and the whole Hotel felt like an art gallery. The staff was amazing and the breakfast was delicious. cons:

pros: Very upscale Great helpful staff Lovely lighting cons: No bedside tables.  Makes it very inconvenient to charge phone or tablet put a glass of water or glasses etc.
Very small room and not even two chairs to sit down. Not enough lighting in rooms or toilet to even shave.

pros: We enjoyed the breakfast very much and bathroom is nice.  Really well situated in Lisbon. cons: The room itself is tiny! we felt like trolls in there - so sad with otherwise amazing hotel. Also way too dark in the rooms and weird lighting!

pros: Overall my stay at the Rate Art Legacy Hotel Baixa-Chiado was enjoyable with excellent service a great central location and a comfortable atmosphere though the room‚Äôs lighting could be improved. cons: This was our second stay at Art Legacy Hotel Baixa-Chiado and while we appreciated the overall experience the room this time was smaller than expected making it a bit uncomfortable for two people to move around freely. The dim lighting largely due to the room‚Äôs color scheme also made the space feel less inviting. While the hotel still offers great service and a fantastic location we found the room a bit lacking in comfort during this visit.

pros: Location Location Location! The hotel has an excellent location. cons: What's more the reception is lovely and courteous. 
Unfortunately the 5* pleasure ends there. The rooms are small. Very very small! It is not possible to have two suitcases standing around in the room. With good will there is 50 cm of space around the bed.
However the bathroom is pleasantly large with a shower.  A 4* yes but not a 5* hotel.
The breakfast is also not worth it. Little choice what is prepared is unfortunately always served cold.

pros: Beautiful interior

Good hotel location cons: Very small bedroom that is impossible to move around in comfortably

Unsafe bed with sharp corners that you constantly bang your feet against

Unsafe glass partition in the bathroom. Hit our head on it several times during dark hours.

Large but not equipped second room in which it is impossible to set up a workplace. Lots of space but everything is inconsiderate. It would be better to increase the size of the bedroom. 

Sometimes at breakfast there are no free tables and you have to wait for your turn. The staff can not cope with the flow of people and can forget about your order. 

Weak English language skills despite the fact that most of the guests speak English.

The baby crib was provided without a blanket and pillow citing internal regulations.

Dirty toilets on ground floor.

No one helps with luggage when you check out. Even the transfer driver was extremely surprised by this attitude.
pros: Very small room Very hard to walk in it cons: Very small room very sharp corners when you walk in the room for your legs my legs were cut and bleeding

pros: We were very disappointed in the breakfast despite the manager being extremely nice. There was very little of everything limited choice a small platter of fruit for en entire restaurant pastries for just a handful of people no toaster no natural yoghurt very little choice of everything. For a hotel like yours the breakfast was unacceptable. cons: We stayed five nights and every evening on our return to our room it had still not been cleaned. I have never experienced this in any hotel and find it unacceptable that the room is not ready until late afternoon.

The team of the Hotel was very hospital they every day provided us lots of homemade sweets with Porto wine Portugal sparking wine and liquor. pros: One of the best hotels I‚Äôve ever stayed at especially for the value. Beautifully designed old manor house refashioned as a hotel‚Äîthey‚Äôve kept a lot of wonderful architectural flourishes from the original building while still making it a very comfortable hotel with good-sized rooms and all the modern amenities you‚Äôd want. Right in the heart of the trendy Bairro Alto neighborhood and across the street from a plaza with sweeping views across the city the location could not be better and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful too. I Cannot recommend this highly enough! cons:
pros: Very helpful concierge. Love the interior and decor cons: room service offering limited

pros: Pros:  Excellent location.  Very friendly staff (particularly Pedro).  Great dining experience at Federico (particularly the carrot-in-different-textures dish).  Our corner room was spacious clean and very comfortable.  Nice sheets towels and room temperature.  The view was incredible and we particularly enjoyed the Bluetooth speakers in the bathroom as well as the his-and-hers sinks.  We also loved the detail of the daily pastry/wine left by housekeeping. cons: Cons:  Breakfast should start before 7:30am and dinner should end later than 10pm.

pros: One of my best sleeps in a while.  Nice thick doors carpeting outside shutters on the window.  In the heart of the city but oh so peaceful.  Luxurious bathroom.  Staff attentive efficient and very friendly.  Wonderful bar downstairs with great staff.  A place to spoil yourself while being in the buzz of it all. cons: Not a thing.

pros: Everything.   five star hotel as it relates to service which was impeccable.  historic facility was beautiful and comfortable.   location was central for touring the seven hills.   perfect. cons: have staff auto fill the coffee machine daily.  done at another hotel we stayed in Porto. minor but would be a plus.

pros: Breakfast was amazing!  The breakfast area is really beautiful charming and cozy.  The staff was very helpful and solicit. cons: The only thing that could get a little better was the bathroom.  When wet the floor felt like liquid soap.  I slipped and almost got really hurt.

That said the downside is that the hotel is surrounded by local bars that are very popular with young adults so it's not unusual them to congregate and party outside in the streets which can make it quite noisy at 3 AM. That said the hotel does have thick windows and window treatments that did help to dampen the noise.

And personally I did not liked the internal view of the bedroom I understand is the cheaper one but for me was a bit claustrophobic also if there was the view of a beautiful lobby. And in the end I would have loved it if there had been a spa with a sauna steamer and whirlpool for the hotel guests.

pros: The selection choice of wine and spirits at the bar was excellent. Staff service was very good. The cleanliness and overall decoration was lovely. cons: The hot breakfast was limited and wasn‚Äôt ‚Äòreal‚Äô bacon. The room was on 2nd floor so the noise from the bars was loud. It was less with windows closed but then the room was stuffy.

pros: Great location right at the top of Elevator de Gloria and very close to all Bairro Alto / Baixa / Chiado have to offer. Short downhill walk to train station for access to Sintra etc and Baixo / Chiada metro station <10mins walk too. Everything was crisp and clean and nicely finished rooms. Restaurant was very good and sommelier is passionate about local wines / ports and knows his stuff. Great cocktails and conversation in bar afterwards too cons: At time of our stay we understand the hotel has only been open approximately 1 month so still experiencing some expected teething problems - one of which was rain coming through the atrium roof - room would benefit from extra cupboard space if tea/coffee maker was relocated but these are minor niggles overall would highly recommend

pros: very comfortable and very helpful and polite staff.  Daily turn down with delivery of surprise gifts of snacks and complimentary Portuguese drinks were much appreciated. cons: Roof-top bar/ restaurant similar to Lumi next door would have been a real bonus for the hotel but the hotel is really perfect with lots of attention to deal.
pros: the property was beautifully done! the staff were exceptional.  such a relaxing atmosphere! cons:

pros: Great stay rooms are recently refurbished to a very high standard bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was great with a large selection of options from the buffet. Staff were very attentive and gave some great recommendations. cons: Not much - Eggs Benedict was slightly undercooked and coffee with frothy milk not the best.

pros: The courteous staff who are well informed and are able to give helpful suggestions. cons: The breakfast is a bit chaotic but this may be due to the fact that they‚Äôve just opened. I hope they will address these short comings.

pros: A new hotel and it shows both in design and effort of staff. Though building itself looks big its a relatively small. Staff is young and in our case very helpful approachable friendly and speaking fluently English. Location is great for a city hotel. Bairro Alto just a few steps away from elevador de gloria and a nearby parc with great views. Building itself is beautifully restored old former palace with a mixture of old/new decor. Do make an effort and climb up via old stairways. Booked comfort double with inner courtyard view. Room and bathroom were OK sized (room 409) exactly what i expected. As it is an inner courtyard it was despite quite loud "surroundings" completely silent (after midnight and until start of the breakfast). It also includes Caudalie toiletry. Service was top notch. Bonus was a daily small gift in the room (for example pasteis de nata chocolates...). Breakfast was good with quality stuff selection was a bit smaller than in other 5* hotels... though hot dishes were freshly prepared upon request (and quickly provided). cons: It has some quirks of a new hotel and things could be quickly resolved others probably not. In the bathroom unfortunately sink has a design flaw and water stays in even when emptied. Also there is a lack of storage space to put you toiletry bag around the sink. There are no paper napkins anywhere in the room (or bathroom). Regarding the room note that 409 has an interior patio view. Unfortunately lights are not dimmed during the night and patio remains relatively bright (though one can completely close the shutters to darken the room). As mentioned before breakfast was ok staff attentive. What i do not understand is the fact that you have to ask for water or juice and you cannot fill up your glass alone (waiter comes and fills your glass). It would be much easier if they just had water bottles for guests to pick up and that would also help during busy hours. For example during busy sunday breakfast staff seemed overwhelmed with requests orders and restocking self service.

pros: Staff super-helpful

pros: Everything! Absolutely amazing! And especially the staff who were very nice and happy to help in everything we needed. cons: Nothing - everything was absolutely perfect.

pros: The staff is so friendly I would like to name them all but I don't want to forget any name but the staff is absolutely phenomenal.

The smell everywhere is great the views from any corner of the hotel were just great.

The breakfast was exceptional I believe that they bake everything in-house they just taste so fresh and good I already miss the breakfast.

I understand that this is a new hotel and they are trying their best every day we would walk into a clean room with a bottle of wine/champagne and some desserts (which I know might be just because they are new since I never experienced such) but this was a nice gesture from them.

I've stayed in over 80 hotels using booking none less than 4 stars and mostly 5 stars. This was by far the best one I've stayed at.

The friendliest people cleanest room most artistic place I will definitely return to it. cons: Nothing.
pros: the staff was super friendly and happy to help cons: The hotel located in nice area
pros: We were both unwell with food poisoning when we checked out this morning so unfortunately we left some clothes behind. I am happy to pay the postage to send them back to Australia cons:
pros: Location cons: The room is small

pros: Beautifully Designed Hotel. Great Location. My room was just lovely. cons: When I arrived to check in (My flight 7 hours late) I was warmly greeted. Then the phone rang and the person proceeded to deal with them. I stood there and  listened to him explain that they should probably email the hotel directly. They were on one of the Booking sites and the site was missing information... 5 minutes have gone by now... He keeps advising they should email and that they would get a MUCH better rate booking directly with the hotel. I have to say aside for delayed flights one of my biggest pet peeves is employees servicing phone clients vs ones in person. It is so unprofessional.  Learn how to say HOLD PLEASE or don't take the call. I am sure you have VM. Also nice to know I got ripped off using a booking site...
Asked for some restaurant recommendations. He eluded the the Hotel Restaurant is very expensive.. (I then hear Anna Delvay saying "you think I'm poooouuur" in her classic voice...) I passed on his suggestions and went to the hotel restaurant. Lovely restaurant. I went to sit at the bar. Greeted by the bartender. Ordered some wine. Looking over the menu. Another guest comes in. He has been there a few days and they chat wine and he gets a glass.. then the Bartender offered to carry the gentleman's wine back to his room...off they go... I am sitting there... alone. SO HUNGRY. After 15 minutes I got up and found a server and asked if I can order. I ask for Foe Gras and the Garlic Shrimp. He says sure... 10 minutes later they both come out together..UGH. Still no bartender and my glass is empty. Another couple have walked in and sit down only to leave after 10 minutes of no one in the room. A good half hour late the bartender appears. Looking a bit disheveled. Hmmm ... He then does that thing where he rubs his face and nose with his hands... then proceed to touch glasses. I lose my appetite.
Foe Gras was good. Not enough bread as usual. The shrimp nothing special.
Hotel is lovely.  Staff need serious 5 star training.

pros: The location was fairly good with two tram lines just outside the entrance. There are several small cafes nearby. On Saturdays there's a street market just up the hill which was neat. And the view of the city from the adjacent plaza was majestic. cons: The hotel was not ready for prime time having just opened a few weeks earlier. The TV had no power cord and was covered in construction dust. The bathroom was clean but had an unpleasant wet smell. The light switches were poorly marked and designed. This room was on the backside right over a neighborhood bar which was very very noisy well into the night (though the hard shutters over the windows helped a little bit). There is no business center (more on that in a moment) and the "Wine Experience" off the lobby was not yet completed.

A good test of a high-end hotel is how well they can assist a guest with a problem. We needed to take COVID tests that required the use of a desktop or laptop with a camera. When asked if we could use a hotel computer we were told no -- none were available (there were two at the reception desk in front of us!). They suggested "checking at the library" (about 15min away) or trying one of the other hotels several blocks away. Since we don't speak Portuguese we asked if they might call one or two hotels to make the inquiry for us and they refused. Flabbergasted we struck out on our own and managed to find a hotel that helped us without hesitation -- Bairro Alto Hotel which is where we'll be staying next time we're in Lisbon.

pros: the hotel itself was beautiful!  The smell of sewage was unbearable in the hotel! cons: The smell of sewage was unbearable throughout the hotel.  The manager of the breakfast area was not nice and the breakfast was awful.  They did not have an iron for you to use your clothes had to be sent out to be ironed and charged a unbelievable price to do it.

pros: look and feel and location
amazing front desk staff cons: horrible sewage smell everyday
breakfast was very poor and disorganized
lady in charge of breakfast quite unfriendly and incompetente
hard to eat with constant sewage smell
pros: it was beautiful and the room were spacious. cons: It was understaffed. Our rooms weren‚Äôt cleaned.

pros: Location was a great place to navigate the city and use the hotel as a central base. cons: the room was nicely decorated but I had some issues. The shower didn't function properly and the water spilled out of the shower unless the glass door was closed which I found claustrophobic and there wasn't a waist paper basket.

pros: - Good room size everything is new
- good central location beautiful building cons: Stayed one short night after a night out in town as we live close to Lisbon. Unfortunately we could not enjoy our stay at all. For 350 euro/night what we got was a room with bad sound insulation on the second floor in the backside of the hotel where there is some Erasmus student party place with lots of people noise and loud music until like 5AM. The sound insulation is completely inadequate and it's pretty much as if the party is happening in your room. This is definitely not what you sign up for at this price point. Moreover the hotel was pretty empty and for sure the staff is aware of the weekend noise so it would only require minimal thoughtfulness not to put guests on lower floor rooms on that side if there is other options available. When I complained about the problem at check-out the staff didn't offer any gesture to make up for the bad experience other than 'I am sorry to hear you had a bad experience'.

In general I feel this hotel claims to be 5 star but isn't really one. It's a nice building and room although despite wanting to be boutique it misses soul and has a corporate/formula feel to it. Details that make the difference like not having tissues in the room the soap dispenser in the shower not working the room being a bit cold but the airco control unit not working use of cheap construction materials like laminate fake wooden floors instead of real ones and the noise problem above ... all take away from the 5 star feeling and made this a subpar experience.
pros: design quality. cons: staff was a bit inexperienced room was cleaned at 7pm instead of 11am lost a t-shirt when picking the sheets for cleaning.
pros: very clean and new cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Clean bed great hospitality cons: Small room. Challenge door locks

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Beautiful hotel with wonderful staff and a great location. The decor is very elegant with beautiful small touches throughout. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet. Lovely breakfast and great staff. cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Everything about the hotel was excellent- location breakfast facilities cons: Very minor but struggled to get milk for our tea. Very English I know but we asked twice but to no avail. Otherwise we would have scored a 10

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: This Hotel is in the "Chiado" area of Lisbon with river-front nearby. The Hotel opened recently (less than a year ago) in a 300 year old building - the interiors of the hotel have been completely re-modeled and have modern amenities. Excellent view from the Room gallery. The Hotel Staff was friendly and  helpful. cons: The Hotel restaurant did not have any vegetarian options for Dinner.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Everything and the front disk staff was amazing they made my stay fantastic cons: Nothing

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Nice cozy hotel with a great breakfast cons: room size a bit too small

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Terrific hotel. Feels brand new. Staff cannot do enough. Breakfast superb. Will stay here again if back in Lisbon. Thank you to all the staff! cons: A bit of noise outside at night.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Location was fantastic staff were lovely and the hotel and room were stunning. cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: everything cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText:
pros: The location was exceptional! close to all the main neighborhoods. The staff was nice and always welcoming. cons: The service at breakfast was a little slow. Order first and then go to the buffet. 
The space for utilities in the bathroom is a bit small

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: New decor  everything is new and really nice. Location is great near nice bars restaurants and metro. cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Breakfast excellent location really great very friendly professional and helpful staff.  5 star standard room - double basins in bathroom. Very good restaurant on site. Boutique style hotel cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText:
pros: Great location
Good staff
Bathroom lovely
Beds great
Yea/coffee facilities in room cons: No comfortable chairs in room 
TV bit limited

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Beautiful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast. cons: Nothing

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Staff super friendly and accommodating. cons: Can‚Äôt really say anything negative.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Great location loved the design of the hotel also cons: The room service menu could be better!

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: A great location very friendly staff. A nice boutique place in the middle of the city. Close to the coast main areas and attractions. The bathroom was big and the ceilings tall and airy. Nice 5pm ish chocolate delivery and a pretty restaurant space. cons: City sized rooms my room looked on to the road so a little nosy. Plus the window was a safety one so only opened an inch or so. Otherwise no real issues for a short city break.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Rita was exceptional she has supported us with tours bookings extension of stay and practical advices. The rest of their staff are awesome too. cons: There was no veggies/salad bar at breakfast but if requested it was provided.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Well designed great location very comfortable breakfast excellent and the staff were brilliant - really helpful. cons: Nothing

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: The hotel is extremely comfortable with great design and taste. Excellent for those traveling alone - as the busy and touristy Chiado area will not allow anyone to feel lonely - and upscale clients that like triple A environments.  Worth to mention that everything has high quality - from the floor to the roof; and this reflects in the fact that you can actually choose the room temperature sharply (finally a thermostat that works!). Windows are sound proof so don‚Äôt worry about the buzz. cons: The rooms are small but pretty and cozy.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: I thought the location was perfect the linens were very high end and comfortable beds.  The room was beautiful and the hotel as well.  Breakfast was delicious too. The staff was super friendly and helpful. cons: Our room was very small.  We didn‚Äôt have any place for our clothes and it was impossible to step out of the bed on one side as our suitcases were on the floor.  This was smaller than I have seen before it is possible our room was smaller than most.  Also we had very little natural light even though we were on the fourth floor.  Also the bathroom was spacious but the toilet made noise and there seemed to be other plumbing issues.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText:
pros: Beautiful restored & decorated building
Great location helpful & friendly staff. 
Lovely rooms with all the facilities needed. 
Close to shops bars & restaurants. cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText:
pros: The hotel was in a fabulous location. It was exceptionally clean had a wonderful fresh breakfast with eggs cooked to order. 
The most outstanding point of this hotel was the remarkable staff ‚Ä¶ providing every possible help attention to our needs taking time to provide a daily itinerary of places to go and restaurants to suit.  Thank you very much appreciated cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: It was wonderful  that the staff was so helpful and got us into our room early.. Great location and very comfortable. cons: No complaints.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: The original historical character combined with the beautiful modern design. cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: The location was amazing the staff (shout out to Bruno and Sophia) for all of their help answer questions and for helping when in need. The breakfast was a surprise it was delicious! My friend and I decided to cancel our other hotel reservation and stay here again at the tail end of our trip!  Would totally recommend! cons: Noting!

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText:
pros: Fantastic place.
Staff very nice. cons: Everything is amazing

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: Great location near lots of restaurants and walking distance from most things. Staff were lovely and very helpful. cons: Soundproofing isn‚Äôt brilliant could hear all corridor noise. Lack of storage such as a drawer would have been more helpful for small items.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: I was really impressed with this hotel. The staff was so kind and welcoming. Bruno was really amazing many recommendations of where to go how to get there super helpful and kind. I felt like we were friends and got to know him while I was there for 4 nights.  I needed to get out of a terrible Airbnb situation and booked this hotel because I needed comfort and a place I could rest and still be in central Lisbon (I did not have a car) they were wonderful. The room was lovely peaceful and quiet. The breakfast buffet each morning was extremely nice and everything you could ever want. Impeccable service. Don‚Äôt miss the hotel restaurant for a first class dining experience. They have a great Chef waiters who know regional wines of Lisbon and Portugal. 5 stars. cons: This has nothing to do with the hotel or their staff but realize you are in the heart of Lisbon. The Chiado neighborhood is vibrant and lively and active until later in the night. You will hear noise and partiers from local bars all around the area. Music singing people out quite later especially the weekends. It didn‚Äôt bother me though at all. I bring earplugs and close the windows. I slept very well and kind of enjoyed the vibe there it‚Äôs a wonderful place easy access to lots of restaurants bars etc.

The power outlet cut off when the keycard was removed causing problems with device charging.

It is hilly but that is Lisbon so be prepared. cons: It is hard to find any faults as it was perfect for our stay in Lisbon.

Staff was very nice and welcoming. Cute breakfast not big but totally has everything you need. Everything is clean an new so that‚Äôs nice but they are still adjusting to the routine of being an hotel cons: Since the hotel is new you could feel  that some of the workers are not fully on top of everything.
The cleaning staff often forgot to do something in the room ( put more soap or put new towels) but one call to reception and they responded in a heart beat! 
The workers at breakfast did not always speak English and did not understand whether you wanted milk or caff√® lattes .. but the is very minor things for a new hotel.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText:
pros: Very central and beautifully decorated
We picked this hotel because of its amazing location. The ambiance was a wonderful surprise very warm and welcoming and beautifully decorated by the Vista Alegre brand. Everything looks just beautiful and it has everything you really need for a Lisbon stay. The location is very central walking distance to almost every major sight and really close to the river. Very lively area but the hotel feels very quiet and safe. Our room was very large and comfortable and overlooking a nice public square. The staff is very friendly and always helpful. We truly enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend. cons:

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros:  cons: The staff is horrible annoying and arrogant! Room is the smallest smallest hotel is dirty.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: The staff at front desk were good and helpful. Good location. Breakfast was also good. cons: After first night reported air conditioning didn‚Äôt work and shower didn‚Äôt drain. They fixed the shower drain and said they replaced the ac Filter. Spent night 2 again with no ac. Morning of day 3 one of the front desk people said to be honest the ac was broken and could not be fixed until we checked out of the room. Said they would give us another room to which we had to pack up and move ourselves. When we went out that evening the hotel director was at the front desk and we asked if there was to be some concession for no ac for 2 nights and the inconvenience of having to move and if we hadn‚Äôt asked they would not have told us the truth or given us a different room. She was very unkind and rude and said you got a different room.  If she is the face for  the hotel I feel sorry for them. For a 5 star hotel it lacked customer service mainly because of her! Our next stop in Seville (another 5 star hotel) we got a welcome bottle of champagne with a note from the GM. Last night there another note from GM with a lovely Cheesecake thanking us for our stay. A real 5 star hotel! We are traveling 27 days between Portugal and Spain and by far the stay in Lisbon was the bottom of the barrel for 5 star hotels! Please get a different hotel director that knows  anything about customer service.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: The location is incredible (can't get much better in Lisbon) walking distance to all nearby attractions packed with restaurants and bars. The staff in the restaurant at breakfast were brilliant and so were the cleaning staff. The shower was great and the water pressure was perfect. I also liked the decor in the hotel it had a luxurious feel to it. The housekeeping staff also ironed a dress for us really quickly and graciously which we really appreciated. The door staff/porters are very professional and polite. cons: The front of house lady barely welcomed us before demanding our passports - it felt like we were being inspected rather than welcomed to a hotel. There's no music or atmosphere in the lobby. We were also told our room wasn't ready even though we were 2 hours after check in. In the end the room was ready so this was an unnecessary confusion. For a 5 star hotel this was a disappointing first impression of the hotel that stuck with us - I've never had such a clumsy unwelcoming check in experience in a 5 star hotel. It's also EXTREMELY noisy and I had to buy earplugs to sleep due to the traffic/cobbled streets and nightlife being so close. You can hear the nearby nightclub music from the room. I also feel the breakfast options weren't great (unless you want multiple egg options). Compare this with a W Hotel or a Sheraton 5 star and you'll be amazed at how comprehensive the breakfasts are compared to the one on offer here.

hotelName: Montebelo Vista Alegre Lisboa Chiado Hotel
reviewText: pros: The location was great! Right in the heart of Lisbon cons: The bed was a queen bed which for two people is small. There was an odd smell coming from the bathroom ventilation and you couldn‚Äôt sleep with the windows open since it‚Äôs a very noisy neighborhood and full of drunk teens.

pros: Great location. The staff are always super attentive and helpful. The hotel is beautiful from the lobby to the rooms. The Italian restaurant inside is great too. cons: None that I can think of
pros: The location was perfect cons: loud music at night after 11 am It was impossible to sleep and it continued late into the night
pros: Great location cons: Toilet was very small however we booked Deluox room but the bathroom was very small
pros: It‚Äôs excellent location and high class services cons: I like environment of whole hotel specially lobby and staff is very professional
pros: Fantastisk cons: Beauty
pros: Beautiful hotel lovely staff and excellent breakfast cons: Bed was a little harder than I‚Äôd prefer but just personal preference

pros: I liked that it was clean and welcomed by the concierge. The service was great and the best part. Special thanks to Karim for going above and beyond. cons: The elevators are too slow during peak hours sometimes 15 min wait.
pros: The location  the facilities and the staff went above and beyond . Georgous hotel cons:

pros: Best bed and linen I had through my 2 week European trip
Exceptionally clean
Possibility to open a window in the room
Very attentive staff cons: Nothing to complain about
pros: The customer service was excellent! The rooms were beautiful and very comfortable beds cons: The swimming facility closed at 13:00 for kids.
pros: Found the property very close to all the locations we wanted to visit Staff were excellent and great value for money cons: Everything . Didn‚Äôt find any faults
pros: Love it cons:

pros: The room can see the castle staff were really helpful and the service was excellent Breakfast had various of options located close to metro can easy access to the major attractions downtown. Many restaurants around. cons: The light switches were confusing maybe add some tags or any signs would be more convenient.
pros: The room is very well equipped. Amazing shower. All high quality. Bed was so comfortable. cons:

pros: Not sure where to start but let‚Äôs say this hotel should be on top of the 5 stars list. The staff not one person the entire staff was superior consistent and delivered everything as expected and more. We already decided to go back again soon with friends for our next vacation. Just amazing. cons:
pros: Isolation and quiet room cons: The gym was very small
pros: Very good cons: Nothing

pros: Room was clean comfortable and had a nice view. Loved the workout room and location was great. The STAFF was EXCELLENT. From the Front Desk to the Restaurant they were all fabulous. The Italian restaurant had delicious meals and the staff was friendly and welcoming. It was a fantastic stay cons: Nothing

pros: Beautiful hotel and great service. It's much better than the other Epic Sana a few steps away. We appreciated the surprise treats in the room. There was noise from the room next door and they dealt with it swiftly. The restaurant and breakfast were both great. cons: Nothing
pros: excellent room staff fabulous and good location. cons: nothing

pros: Lovely modern hotel with amazing facilities. Loved the Spa and fabulous breakfast. Great service. They went above and beyond. Would highly recommend. cons: A little pricey but they had all the bells and whistles. everything you could want.
pros: Absolutely fabulous hotel very well located on the heart of Lisbon fantastic room gym and SPA. cons:

pros: Room:
- Pros: The room is very modern and dazzling spacious and offers a good view (depending on the specific room).
- Cons: The bathroom tub shower is quite high which poses a significant risk of slipping when getting out after a wet shower.

Breakfast:
- Pros: There is a huge spread available which would delight many meat lovers. The price is reasonable at 25 euros per person.
- Cons: There is no √† la carte option and the healthy and vegetarian selections are very limited. Additionally the food lacks flavor and there are no spicy ketchup or even regular ketchup options.

Room Service:
- Pros: There is a good variety of options and delivery is timely.
- Cons: The same item can come with different assortments. For example I ordered mushroom egg whites twice: one day it arrived with a nice assortment of breads granola yogurt cappuccino etc. while on the second day it came with just toast coffee and some unappealing green yogurt with no nuts granola or fruit which was very disappointing.

Other:
I used the gym and jacuzzi both of which were fantastic. I also dined at the Allora restaurant where the food and service were top-notch. The front desk staff was extremely courteous and helpful; they even arranged a table fan for my wife.

Overall: This is a very modern high-end hotel with a multitude of facilities and a central location. However I would recommend avoiding their most basic room due to the tub shower. Additionally I suggest finding a different breakfast place. cons: Please see above
pros: I loved the fresh smell of flowers when walking in being greeted with enthusiasm and willing to help! Breakfast was exceptional! Beds were so comfortable & we loved the amenities!! cons:
pros: Great spacious luxurious rooms and beds. Friendly staff. Located directly near the city centra only at 15 minutes from the airport. cons: The Koji Bar was closed on Monday but understandable.

pros: Clean & bright
Welcoming staff
Excellent buffet breakfast
The deluxe suite was absolutely perfect cons: Restaurants a bit high in price 
Not the best location for great shopping but only 5-10 minutes ride with uber
pros: Elegant 5* service. cons: Broken shower seals and broken room switches

pros: - Location
- Friendly staff cons: - Small rooms
- No bidet in the toilet
pros: Location cons: We didn‚Äôt realise until the last day that we didn‚Äôt get breakfast with our room rate. We got charged after we ate our breakfast on the last day.

pros: Location 
Beautiful large corner room cons: Nothing
pros: Good Hotel. Clean & Comfortable Rooms. Convenient Location. cons:
pros: A warm welcome great location and wonderful breakfast. cons: Electric lighting fixtures and curtains could be annoying.
pros: Rich & Tastefull Breakfast cons:

pros: The staff in this hotel are fantastic. The Concierge Karim helped me plan the next part of my trip and it's perfect. The food was outstanding. The house cocktails were exceptional. A truly outstanding hotel in that classic way. cons: I can't think of anything.
pros: Great spa and gym. The in house Italian restaurant was excellent. The cocktails were exceptional. cons: Parking instructions could be clearer. And the cost of parking is ‚Ç¨25 a day.

pros: Very comfortable hotel with excellent staff and service. cons: Unable to get a restaurant reservation at child friendly time (between 7-8.30pm).Kids unable to use indoor pool after 1pm due spa treatments. Although it's an excellent hotel I will probably look at another option on my next trip for these reasons.

pros: Fabulous breakfast buffet spacious rooms and bathrooms lovely rooftop pool. The staff is simply superb; super friendly extremely helpful and accommodating. cons: The spa facilities can get overcrowded at peak times.

pros: This is my third stay at a Sana Hotel and my second time at this particular one. I can confidently say that my experience was even better than last year! I loved every aspect of my visit‚Äîfrom the relaxing massage to the delightful birthday surprise the delicious breakfast the comfortable room and the exceptional staff.

I truly appreciated that my feedback from last year was taken into consideration especially regarding the breakfast options. I enjoyed every bite! 

A huge thank you to all the staff who were not only professional but also incredibly friendly and helpful. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel‚Äî100% !!!!! cons: The elevator was a bit slow; we wanted to go to the pool but waited for more than 5min. We decided to take the stairs and ended up a bit lost trying to find the lobby. Thankfully a friendly staff member from the Allora Restaurant came to our rescue and helped us out.

While the elevator may be slow it turned into a fun and memorable experience!

pros: The location was excellent and the breakfast was very good . I highly recommend the Allora restaurant for the amazing service and food !!! Thank you to all the staff at the hotel for their excellent service  we enjoyed our stay very much ! cons:
pros: Breakfast was fantastic cons:

pros: great hotel for resting and enjoying the rooftop pool. Staff were helpful and kind. room was specious and the bathroom is really good cons: location is not bad but quite far from the central area

pros: Pretty fancy hotel. Room was comfortable although a little small. Bed was comfortable and there was a welcome drink and desert - it was a very nice touch. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. A lot of facilities in the hotel and a great restaurant. Very close to the big bus tour/hopon hopoff. cons: Nothing major except another shower that gets water all over the floor that was very annoying. Maybe it's a user error. TV was behind the glass so you cannot connect your own device to watch anything.

pros: It was amazing. cons: The fact that there was only 2 small bottle of water and two midum size bottle of water which was less than 2 litres for 24 hours.
pros: It was so beautiful. The room was huge. Bed very comfortable. Breakfast just amazing. The staff was so nice cons: Nothing. It was superb

pros: I absolutely loved this hotel and wish we would have stayed longer. The gym and pool were awesome great breakfast comfortable rooms. Location was great a 20 minute walk to the centre with plenty to see/do on the way down. Will definitely be back. cons: Nothing

Lovely wellness area. Great value for money. cons: These items are just small details. Pillows in the bed could be more comfortable water in the bathroom did not drain very well great wellness area but guests should be reminded via a sign to sit on towels inside of the dry sauna rather than sweating directly on the wood something that is standard in any well run sauna.

pros: Exceptionally clean and modern. Staff went over and beyond to ensure that I had the best birthday trip ever. Everyone I came into contact with was kind. 
Loved the spa facilities the pool sauna etc. loved that you could use those for free as a guest. cons: I can‚Äôt think of anything I didn‚Äôt like. It truly exceeded my expectations!
pros: We had a great experience! cons:

Apart from that everything was good
pros: Overall the property is exquisite and done in great taste. cons: Minor housekeeping imperfections

pros: Exceptional service. The staff were very friendly helpful and warm. cons:

pros: the room cons: the restaraunts food in general

We just opened the windows to air it out. Some hotel perfume would have been a nice touch to mask the smell.

pros: Its a very lovely 5 star hotel and the staff are v professional. The breakfast was v lovely and varied. The room was extremely comfortable and relaxing. Booked a joint massage session with my partner .. would highly recommend. Booked the 75 minute session and was so so relaxing and invigorating. Thank you for all the Spa staff for making this a v special treat for me and my partner. cons: The only slight thing to mention is that breakfast was not as relaxing as other 5 star Hotels. The table staff were wonderful but very busy. The staff replenishing the breakfast items seemed stressed and rushed. Realise that it's a 5 star hotel but maybe an option of self service coffee machine might help relieve some pressure and for me something that I would prefer.
pros: Comfortable room clean good breakfast cons: Large tourist hotel very busy and impersonal

pros: 1) Appreciated the cleanliness of the room.
2) Appreciated the young woman (with eye glasses) who was the concierge who gave good information or travel directions.
3) Appreciated the breakfast choices. A very good assortment for every food category from fresh fruit cooked-to-order eggs breakfast pastries etc. Nice breakfast staff too. 
4) Very pretty rooftop pool area.
5) There was a bottle of wine (which we didn‚Äôt drink) and 3 mini ‚Äúwelcome‚Äù pastries in the in-room table upon our arrival. (Not enough for 2 people to share equally but a nice thought).
5) Our son and his roommate got the last two spots for a massage at the spa and said that it was a wonderful experience. They also liked the steam room.
6) Allora restaurant on the ground floor was our first meal and last meal in Lisbon. They were able to safely accommodate my son‚Äôs nut allergies. Delicious Italian food in a lovely setting. cons: 1) Our son has severe (life and death level) peanut/treenut allergies. We were told at the first breakfast that almost everything either had nut ingredients or could not be trusted for cross-contamination. He went without breakfast for the first 4 morningsüò†.  I had to find an Aldi market to buy him safe food and even that was hard to find.  The man at the front desk gave us awful directions to find one market (which we never did find) and despite me having arthritic feet we just kept walking until we found the Aldi on our own. 
2) My husband and I were not able to get massages (something we had looked forward to on this vacation) because we gave the last two available openings to our son and his friend/roommate. 
3) We did not care for the room light and window draperies being tied to the room key being put in the wall slot. Room light operation was difficult to understand.
4) All the breakfast restaurant food was good but the ‚Äújuices‚Äù tasted like nothing but colored water- -very weak taste.
5) Although we were on the 8th floor the street traffic noise (perhaps motorcycles?) woke us up every single day. More should be done structurally for noise prevention.

pros: Everything was perfect from the moment I arrived at the hotel.  My room so nice and the bed was extremely comfortable. The welcome note a gift so very thoughtful and yummy. Probably one of the best breakfast buffets I‚Äôve experienced. The service at every touch point 10/10. Thank you. cons:

pros: This was an impeccable stay from start to finish. The first stay began and ended by the most amazing service team. Beatrice and Carolina at the front desk were so kind and warm after an experience I had with canceled flights. I was completely frazzled...they just did everything to welcome me and make me feel at home. So much was the entire team .. especially room service  doorman/bellman just exquisitely wonderful....that when I checked out the first time...and was eventually heading to Albufiera in the Algarve ...I made my week long reservation for their Sister property called the Epic Sana Algarve. I will be forever grateful for both properties and all of the support staff and I will be a life long customer at this marvelous Hotel brand. Incredible. cons: I did not have any experience that I didn't like.

pros: The stuff are very helpful and polite and well trained people.

pros: Hotels of this scale can sometimes lose personality / service standards due to demands of the job and customer demands. I have to say this is not the case here.. the staff on the rooftop bar were so friendly kind and hard working. The cleaning staff were also very bubbly and cheerful - which can be hard to maintain given the hard work turning over rooms at that scale. The rooms are immaculate spa area and gym really airy spacious and clean. The Pool is beautiful.. felt so relaxed. All in all I feel this hotel deserves its 5 stars. Exceeded my expectations on so many levels. Cant wait to return.. cons: One very minor thing is the toilet seats in common areas are black and peeling away in a lot of areas like the spa and pool toilets. But that‚Äôs clutching at straws.

Then she said that she was going to do me a favor and give us a room on the 7th floor instead of 5th.  I could have cared less which floor we were on.  What I cared about is that we were very tired from six hours of travel and we were forgotten about. We selected a higher level hotel because we wanted the service that should be there. Needless to say I was not very happy.

The view was amazing out of our window - it exceeded expectations! We loved visiting the spa - it was really well looked after by the staff and just such an overall great experience. cons: The check-in process didn't feel very smooth as people who arrived ahead of check-in time due to an early flight.
pros: Fantastic place! cons:

pros: Really lovely hotel. Very clean with attentive staff. Would stay again and recommend to others. Liked the pool area for a city hotel and the spa was lovely. cons: My only criticism was the drinks service at breakfast. This was served by waiters and could be better organised. It was hard to get tea and coffee or refills.

pros: Best breakfast in Lisbon! We met people at the buffet who weren't even staying at the hotel but went there for the food. it was SO GOOD. Definitely include breakfast in your booking! The staff is AMAZING - they were able to get us dinner reservations when the restaurant website wouldn't let us and they helped us figure out which beach to go to where we would have sun protection access to food and bathrooms. I also got a massage scub aromatherapy thing at the spa downstairs which was totally worth the money - afterwards they guide you to a little relaxation room with soft lighting and curtains and they provide you with healthy snacks (dried fruit and nuts) and herbal tea. I also used the gym it was a lot nicer than most hotel gyms and had towels water bottles (both room temp and refrigerated) cool washcloths in the fridge yoga mats kettle bells free weights and a punching bag in addition to the usual treadmills ellipticals rowing machine etc. Everything was in good condition. The Allora restaurant is on the ground floor we went for dinner - the food and service there was excellent. Definitely ask for the port! cons: some stuff that the hotel can't really control at this point: the lighting controls are weirdly complicated we kept accidentally turning the wrong lights on or off. The bathroom door is weirdly hard to close - it's a sliding door and easily bounces back open if you don't slowly deliberately close it. Cleaning - make sure your little door signs indicate you want the room cleaned - they do a good job with cleaning (even folded my clothes which i was not expecting) but i think one of the small signs says to skip it which i missed one or two days. Room service menu is a little limited imo but still good.

Staff were super friendly the room cleaners were really polite and conscientious. Loved the 12 o'clock checkout it meant we could have a slow last morning which was really appreciated. The spa facilities were really nice the treatments were too expensive for us unfortunately. The sensory shower was my highlight. cons: The lifts - they were really slow possibly there aren't enough to service everyone at busy times like breakfast. We also got stuck in a lift one night which was quite scary. The rooms were quite soundproof apart from our last night as the people next door were really loud. The curtains didn't block out a lot of light some eye masks would have been appreciated. Rooftop pool was not heated so we didn't go in this was a shame as that was one of the biggest draws for booking this hotel further out of town than other options for our group.

Both pools were not working when we arrived but the hotel paid for us to get a taxi to and from their sister hotel which was a few minutes away so we could use their pool. The pools in both hotels were lovely. cons: The outdoor pool was closed when we arrived because of the poor weather and construction works. I understand they can't help the weather but we would've liked to know beforehand if it was going to be closed because of construction anyway as we didn't get to use it at all and it was a big reason we chose the hotel. The Italian restaurant and lobby bar were both very nice but too expensive in my opinion.

pros: Overall we had a very nice stay. The employees were wonderful very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious clean very quiet and with a comfortable bed. The breakfast was great with amazing variety. There were some nice touches like pastries and wine upon arrival and a beautiful pastry on my birthday. We were able to get a late checkout without issue. cons: The spa was closed which was disappointing as it was the main reason we chose this hotel and we would have liked to be informed in advance. Although the hotel arranged a taxi for us to go to a different spa it was not quite the same as it involved more planning. 

There was also an odd situation where a stranger found out our name/room number soon after we checked in and tried to come see us pretending to be our son. The hotel did inform us about the incident promptly and gave us a new room but it made for a stressful first day. 

Finally we had housekeeping (try to) enter our room once at 9.30pm and once while we were at dinner to bring items we didn't request like chocolate or weirdly on our final night slippers. While they probably meant well this left us feeling on edge a bit as it started feeling like we could be disturbed any time day and night.

The bed and shower were my favorite stand outs ! The mattress was a dream and the linens were soft and luxurious we looked forward to getting into bed ! In fact would love to know if you could share the mattress brand?LoL
The beautiful translucent mural in the shower was memorable  and the rain shower combined with the the water pressure perfection! The staff was welcoming  friendly and extremely attentive The beautiful and delicious  Birthday Dessert and Champagne was a special touch THANK YOU for that !!
The massage at the Spa was one of the best I've experience in a long time..So needless to say we will be back ! cons: The Elevators were a bit lagging- the wait time was a bit long..it seemed as though just one elevator worked at a time..I  got stuck on the roof top waiting for a while.
The only other thing I notice was the shower flooring peeling a bit  ..and the were burn marks or ring marks on the bathroom counter . Everything else was up to par for a 5 star hotel!

pros: It was my second time celebrating my birthday in a SANA hotel. I really appreciated the consideration and effort making the day special. The staff super professional and welcoming. The room was beautiful and the bathroom perfect mostly for privacy. The indoor pool was super fun. It's like a huge jacuzzi. The spa area was super clean although many people were around the pool the sauna and steam room. cons: I didn't like the restaurant Allora. The restaurant was chic. The background music was loud and the music played gave disco night vibes than classy. The waiters were quite agitated sprinting fast from table to table I noticed all of them. I was wondering if there were enough waiters that night. The second "eek!" was the breakfast. The Restaurant was pretty and spacious. The issue was the buffet. There were lot of vegan and gluten free food option which is not bad but less option for normal eaters like myself.  We had hard time picking what to eat and the taste didn't match our expectations due to  as mention earlier vegan or gluten free food.

Very thankful. cons: One concern is the swimming pool it needs more attention and should be cleaned just as how other areas of the hotel are kept. Aside that it is a great rooftop pool with comfortable sitting chairs and clean adequate towels . However There should be a shower provided near the pool area or even in the washroom for all who want to swim to wash down before entering the pool.

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: This was a beautiful home base for our visit to Lisbon. The hotel interior is stunningly designed with gorgeous marble and tile. The grounds are beautiful as well offering an oasis of serene beauty. We used the indoor sauna and pool every night after a day of sightseeing! The breakfast buffet was amazing as well. But the best things by far are the kind friendly and helpful staff. We enjoyed everything about our stay! cons: There is nothing we didn‚Äôt like. It is a long walk or short Uber ride to the most popular historic areas but we liked the peace and quiet.

reviewText: pros: The room was tastefully decorated and was very spacious with a balcony. All staff that we encountered were courteous and polite. The whole place was very clean with grand decor and marble floors. The cost for each night was also reasonable compared to other 5 star hotels. cons: We were over charged nearly 200 euros for a meal we did not have. The hotel should have procedures in place to audit their invoices before checkout. They did however deal with my complaint quickly and reimbursed the over payment almost immediately.

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Customer service very good beautiful breakfast pool and gym and great local staff knowledge and recommendations for sightseeing and eating out. cons: The only thing that disappointed us was being billed for the airport transfer which we asked concierge to book for us. When we checked out there was an 80 euros charge. When we booked with Booking.com complimentary airport transfers were listed in the hotel description. This was extremely misleading and clearly not the case. We discussed this with concierge who informed that a number of other guests who had booked with Booking.com had also been led to believe the same and were equally disappointed. The hotel advised us to address this with Booking.com when we arrived home. I have written to customer service but have not yet had a response. We have noticed that the previously stated- ‚Äúfree airport transfers‚Äù has now been removed from the description on the Booking.com website for this hotel. We feel disappointed that our complaint has yet to be addressed and sincerely hope Booking.com will get in contact with us and other customers who may have been similarly misled.

reviewText: pros: The hotel provided impeccable service from the moment we arrived. It was a quiet luxurious setting. The pools were lovely. Room service was fast and fabulous. The staff was attentive and helpful. The breakfast options were good and the atmosphere was pleasant. We had connecting rooms each with a balcony that was quiet and overlooked the pool and gardens. Carpeting was plush and the beds were comfortable. Room size was generous. There were fresh flowers in the bathrooms and L'Occitane bath products. We frequently stay at the Ritz-Carlton and the Four Seasons but this hotel provided better service and amenities than those. We highly recommend this boutique hotel. cons: Loved everything!

Viva Lapa Palace! cons: The hotel feels a little dated. If they made a few tweaks  like replacing carpets draperies and bedspreads with livelier brighter more modern patterns and hues I think it would have a huge impact and it would create a better guest experience.

reviewText: pros: Beautiful building. I stayed in the palace part in an art deco room which was why I chose the hotel. Doesn‚Äôt feel too big. Garden and pool are lovely. cons: A little away from the centre of things so I recommend taxis if you‚Äôre not fond of a lot of walking. I was surprised there wasn‚Äôt a folder in the room with information about the hotel such as a map. The doorman wasn‚Äôt the best.

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Excellent and friendly service and support from the staff. Very comfortable room with view of the Tagus and a modern and well equipped bathroom. Good dining options especially the bar where the staff could not be more helpful and where the menu is more varied and frankly much better than the more formal restaurant which we found very expensive for what was sadly an average meal. Buffet breakfast was superb. The hotel has an excellent range of facilities including a very relaxing garden and outdoor swimming pool. cons: Our only comment relates to the hotel‚Äôs position. It is not easy to access other than by taxi; it is a distance from the historic centre of Lisbon and is located underneath the flight path for Lisbon airport. As a consequence the outdoor breakfast area bar and garden can be quite noisy especially as jet aircraft tend to land every 5-10minutes!

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The room and bathroom were both great confortable and pleasant.  The breakfast was spectacular as it was the breakfast area coutyard...pleasant peaceful and just pain very enjoyable.  Although we did not use the pool or spa facilities we visited these and thought they were great.  The pool and the gardens are beautiful....an oasis in the city of Lisbon.
The staff for the hotel were always attentive and welcoming. 
Overall we had a wonderful stay.  The only draw back is that the hotel is not close to the city center. cons: Distance to the city center is about 15 minutes away via taxi on a regular day....not walkable.

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left everything was absolutely perfect.

This is what I would describe as a classic "old school" hotel in the best sense of the word.

The breakfast is buffet style but in the grandest sense.  You get to choose from a wonderful selection of fresh breads pastries cheeses fruits cereals to hot breakfast foods such as scrambled/fried/boiled eggs bacon sausages mushrooms tomatoes.  Tea and coffee is served in silver pots.  There is smoked salmon and sparkling wine. The breakfast room is lovely and you can choose to eat inside the airy room or outside in the courtyard.

The heated outdoor pool and its surrounding garden are a beautiful oasis in a busy city that is pushed for space.  The adjoining bar serves great casual food.  We had the Salmon Poke bowl and it was delicious and very filling.

The main restaurant is serious silver service without being in the slightest bit stuffy or formal.  I would highly recommend the tasting menu.  You get to try the what I consider the highlights of what is on offer for a little more than 2 courses.  The chef is exceptional.  The room is beautiful and  in keeping with its traditional setting.  Lots of chandeliers swagged curtains flower arrangements.

The bar is just what you would expect from a hotel of this style.  Moody lighting with lots of red tones and dark wood.  Expert cocktails free bar snacks very friendly staff and a piano player to die for.

There is also a great indoor pool with a sauna and steam room.

Our room was spacious with a large marble bathroom and balcony. cons: This is not something that the hotel can change and it did not affect our stay but you should be aware that the pool is under the flight path of the airport.  So you will hear and see planes flying overhead during the day.  You will NOT hear them inside the hotel.

reviewText: pros: excellent service cons:

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful setting for our last few days in Lisbon. The Accomodations were world class. The room restaurants pool grounds were all top rate. The staff was terrific. cons:

reviewText: pros: Amazing breakfast buffet and lovely swimming pool (indoor and outdoor). We enjoyed the quietness of the area as well as the quick walk to public transportation to travel around. cons: The indoor swimming pool closed twice 10 minutes before the official time.

reviewText: pros: The room was very large and had a very nice balcony overlooking the lovely garden  The garden featured a large and attractive swimming pool but also a lovely natural pond with coy carp and fresh water turtles.  The whole garden was simply stunning.  Another bonus was the indoor pool -  great for an early morning swim before breakfast.  Both pools were heated.  The breakfasts were excellent with plenty of choice. The hotel was very quiet and elegant with lovely gardens off the breakfast room and bar and a terrace overlooking the main garden off the dining room.  The hotel was one of the nicest I have stayed in anywhere. cons:

We made one mistake and that was the bed was too hard but didn‚Äôt mention it until late. They told us we should have mentioned it as it was solvable so our problem. In spite of this a HIGH recommendation

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: We wanted to mix up our stay in Lisbon with some new ducky hotels and then something more traditional and beautiful and wow did Olissippo Lapa deliver! 
STUNNING grounds and the palace is so beautiful to walk thorough. The rooms are big and very comfortable.
It is a more traditional hotel so expect lots of old school service (doorman room turn down in the evenings staff bringing you towels by the pool) but it is definitely worth the stay!
We ate at some incredible local restaurants while we were here - so a neighbourhood for the foodies! cons: It was a little stiff and formal for us but we still loved the stay.

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: very clean and five star for everything cons: N/A

reviewText: pros: everything cons: nothing

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: We came right after our wedding and were upgraded to a lovely room. On arrival sparkling wine and strawberries were brought to our room a very sweet attention. The outdoors are spectacular: the pool the park and the view are stunning. Last but not least I absolutely loved the bed (I even asked for the mattress brand!) and the breakfast was so delicious. The decor is from another time but it adds to the charm because you easily forget which year it is... cons: The spa facilities are beautiful there is a heated pool a steam room and massage cabins. We booked two body massages and we thought that the techniques could have been stronger. However when mentionned to the reception our two massages were immediately refunded and I'm sure our feedback was taken into account.

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: as one would expect cons: all good

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Everything was absolutely perfect from the moment we checked in to the late check out that was generously granted. The room was large and very comfortable and with an exceptional view. The staff was attentive and kind especially with my 88 year old mother who travelled with me. The pool is surprisingly large for a city hotel the bar and fumoir are very elegant with an old school style which I loved. The Olissippo Lapa is most definitely a true Palace and I look forward to returning. Thank you once again to everyone who made my mother's dream come true cons:

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast excellent with a good range of food. cons:

hotelName: BOlissippo Lapa Palace ‚Äì The Leading Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The hotel is a beautiful building with lovely views over the river.  The staff are all extremely helpful friendly and professional.  We had a room upgrade to a top floor room with balcony which was lovely.  Breakfast was fabulous with a good choice of hot and cold dishes fresh fruit etc. cons: There was nothing not to like but as an extra it would be good to have a hottub in the spa area and the steam room was closed when we were there so spa was a bit limited.
